06796       char *pdata;
06797       INT convert_flags;
06798       INT i, min_wp, size, max_size, total_size, status = 0;
06799       INT my_client_index;
06800       BOOL found;
06801       INT old_read_pointer, new_read_pointer;
06802 
06803       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
06804 
06805       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
06806          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_receive_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06807          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06808       }
06809 
06810       if (!pbuf->attached) {
06811          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_receive_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06812          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06813       }
06814 
06815       max_size = *buf_size;
06816       *buf_size = 0;
06817 
06818       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
06819          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
06820       else
06821          convert_flags = 0;
06822 
06823     CACHE_READ:
06824 
06825       /* look if there is anything in the cache */
06826       if (pbuf->read_cache_wp > pbuf->read_cache_rp) {
06827          pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_rp);
06828          size = pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
06829 
06830          if (size > max_size) {
06831             memcpy(destination, pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_rp, max_size);
06832             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_receive_event", "event size larger than buffer size");
06833             *buf_size = max_size;
06834             status = BM_TRUNCATED;
06835          } else {
06836             memcpy(destination, pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_rp, size);
06837             *buf_size = size;
06838             status = BM_SUCCESS;
06839          }
06840 
06841          /* now convert event header */
06842          if (convert_flags) {
06843             pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) destination;
06844             rpc_convert_single(&pevent->event_id, TID_SHORT, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
06845             rpc_convert_single(&pevent->trigger_mask, TID_SHORT, RPC_OUTGOING,
06846                                convert_flags);
06847             rpc_convert_single(&pevent->serial_number, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING,
06848                                convert_flags);
06849             rpc_convert_single(&pevent->time_stamp, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING,
06850                                convert_flags);
06851             rpc_convert_single(&pevent->data_size, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING,
06852                                convert_flags);
06853          }
06854 
06855          /* correct size for DWORD boundary */
06856          size = ALIGN8(size);
06857 
06858          pbuf->read_cache_rp += size;
06859 
06860          if (pbuf->read_cache_rp == pbuf->read_cache_wp)
06861             pbuf->read_cache_rp = pbuf->read_cache_wp = 0;
06862 
06863          return status;
06864       }
06865 
06866       /* calculate some shorthands */
06867       pheader = pbuf->buffer_header;
06868       pdata = (char *) (pheader + 1);
06869       my_client_index = pbuf->client_index;
06870       pclient = pheader->client;
06871       pc = pheader->client + my_client_index;
06872 
06873       /* first do a quick check without locking the buffer */
06874       if (async_flag == ASYNC && pheader->write_pointer == pc->read_pointer)
06875          return BM_ASYNC_RETURN;
06876 
06877       /* lock the buffer */
06878       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06879 
06880     LOOP:
06881 
06882       while (pheader->write_pointer == pc->read_pointer) {
06883          bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06884 
06885          /* return now in ASYNC mode */
06886          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
06887             return BM_ASYNC_RETURN;
06888 
06889          pc->read_wait = TRUE;
06890 
06891          /* check again pointers (may have moved in between) */
06892          if (pheader->write_pointer == pc->read_pointer) {
06893 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06894             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Receive sleep: grp=%d, rp=%d wp=%d",
06895                    pheader->read_pointer, pc->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
06896 #endif
06897 
06898             status = ss_suspend(1000, MSG_BM);
06899 
06900 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06901             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Receive woke up: rp=%d, wp=%d",
06902                    pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
06903 #endif
06904 
06905             /* return if TCP connection broken */
06906             if (status == SS_ABORT)
06907                return SS_ABORT;
06908          }
06909 
06910          pc->read_wait = FALSE;
06911 
06912          bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06913       }
06914 
06915       /* check if event at current read pointer matches a request */
06916       found = FALSE;
06917 
06918       do {
06919          pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pdata + pc->read_pointer);
06920 
06921          total_size = pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
06922          total_size = ALIGN8(total_size);
06923 
06924          prequest = pc->event_request;
06925 
06926          for (i = 0; i < pc->max_request_index; i++, prequest++)
06927             if (prequest->valid &&
06928                 bm_match_event(prequest->event_id, prequest->trigger_mask, pevent)) {
06929                /* we found one, so copy it */
06930 
06931                if (pbuf->read_cache_size > 0 &&
06932                    !(total_size > pbuf->read_cache_size && pbuf->read_cache_wp == 0)) {
06933                   if (pbuf->read_cache_size - pbuf->read_cache_wp < total_size)
06934                      goto CACHE_FULL;
06935 
06936                   if (pc->read_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
06937                      /* copy event to cache */
06938                      memcpy(pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp, pevent, total_size);
06939                   } else {
06940                      /* event is splitted */
06941                      size = pheader->size - pc->read_pointer;
06942                      memcpy(pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp, pevent, size);
06943                      memcpy((char *) pbuf->read_cache + pbuf->read_cache_wp + size,
06944                             pdata, total_size - size);
06945                   }
06946                } else {
06947                   if (pc->read_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
06948                      /* event is not splitted */
06949                      if (total_size > max_size)
06950                         memcpy(destination, pevent, max_size);
06951                      else
06952                         memcpy(destination, pevent, total_size);
06953                   } else {
06954                      /* event is splitted */
06955                      size = pheader->size - pc->read_pointer;
06956 
06957                      if (size > max_size)
06958                         memcpy(destination, pevent, max_size);
06959                      else
06960                         memcpy(destination, pevent, size);
06961 
06962                      if (total_size > max_size) {
06963                         if (size <= max_size)
06964                            memcpy((char *) destination + size, pdata, max_size - size);
06965                      } else
06966                         memcpy((char *) destination + size, pdata, total_size - size);
06967                   }
06968 
06969                   if (total_size < max_size)
06970                      *buf_size = total_size;
06971                   else
06972                      *buf_size = max_size;
06973 
06974                   /* now convert event header */
06975                   if (convert_flags) {
06976                      pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) destination;
06977                      rpc_convert_single(&pevent->event_id, TID_SHORT, RPC_OUTGOING,
06978                                         convert_flags);
06979                      rpc_convert_single(&pevent->trigger_mask, TID_SHORT, RPC_OUTGOING,
06980                                         convert_flags);
06981                      rpc_convert_single(&pevent->serial_number, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING,
06982                                         convert_flags);
06983                      rpc_convert_single(&pevent->time_stamp, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING,
06984                                         convert_flags);
06985                      rpc_convert_single(&pevent->data_size, TID_DWORD, RPC_OUTGOING,
06986                                         convert_flags);
06987                   }
06988                }
06989 
06990                if (pbuf->read_cache_size > 0 &&
06991                    !(total_size > pbuf->read_cache_size && pbuf->read_cache_wp == 0)) {
06992                   pbuf->read_cache_wp += total_size;
06993                } else {
06994                   if (total_size > max_size) {
06995                      cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_receive_event",
06996                             "event size larger than buffer size");
06997                      status = BM_TRUNCATED;
06998                   } else
06999                      status = BM_SUCCESS;
07000                }
07001 
07002                /* update statistics */
07003                found = TRUE;
07004                pheader->num_out_events++;
07005                break;
07006             }
07007 
07008          old_read_pointer = pc->read_pointer;
07009 
07010          /* shift read pointer */
07011          new_read_pointer = (pc->read_pointer + total_size) % pheader->size;
07012 
07013          if (new_read_pointer > pheader->size - (int) sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
07014             new_read_pointer = 0;
07015 
07016 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
07017          cm_msg(MDEBUG, "bm_receive_event -> wp=%d, rp %d -> %d (found=%d,size=%d)",
07018                 pheader->write_pointer, pc->read_pointer, new_read_pointer, found,
07019                 total_size);
07020 #endif
07021 
07022          pc->read_pointer = new_read_pointer;
07023 
07024          /*
07025             Repeat until a requested event is found or no more events
07026             are available.
07027           */
07028 
07029          if (pbuf->read_cache_size == 0 && found)
07030             break;
07031 
07032          /* break if event has bypassed read cache */
07033          if (pbuf->read_cache_size > 0 &&
07034              total_size > pbuf->read_cache_size && pbuf->read_cache_wp == 0)
07035             break;
07036 
07037       } while (pheader->write_pointer != pc->read_pointer);
07038 
07039     CACHE_FULL:
07040 
07041       /* calculate global read pointer as "minimum" of client read pointers */
07042       min_wp = pheader->write_pointer;
07043 
07044       for (i = 0, pctmp = pclient; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pctmp++)
07045          if (pctmp->pid) {
07046             if (pctmp->read_pointer < min_wp)
07047                min_wp = pctmp->read_pointer;
07048 
07049             if (pctmp->read_pointer > pheader->write_pointer &&
07050                 pctmp->read_pointer - pheader->size < min_wp)
07051                min_wp = pctmp->read_pointer - pheader->size;
07052          }
07053 
07054       if (min_wp < 0)
07055          min_wp += pheader->size;
07056 
07057       pheader->read_pointer = min_wp;
07058 
07059       /*
07060          If read pointer has been changed, it may have freed up some space
07061          for waiting producers. So check if free space is now more than 50%
07062          of the buffer size and wake waiting producers.
07063        */
07064       size = pc->read_pointer - pheader->write_pointer;
07065       if (size <= 0)
07066          size += pheader->size;
07067 
07068       if (size >= pheader->size * 0.5)
07069          for (i = 0, pctmp = pclient; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pctmp++)
07070             if (pctmp->pid && (pctmp->write_wait < size) && (pctmp->pid != ss_getpid() ||       /* check if not own thread */
07071                                                              (pctmp->pid == ss_getpid()
07072                                                               && pctmp->tid !=
07073                                                               ss_gettid()))) {
07074 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
07075                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Receive wake: rp=%d, wp=%d, level=%1.1lf",
07076                       pheader->read_pointer,
07077                       pheader->write_pointer, 100 - 100.0 * size / pheader->size);
07078 #endif
07079                ss_resume(pctmp->port, "B  ");
07080             }
07081 
07082       /* if no matching event found, start again */
07083       if (!found)
07084          goto LOOP;
07085 
07086       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
07087 
07088       if (pbuf->read_cache_size > 0 &&
07089           !(total_size > pbuf->read_cache_size && pbuf->read_cache_wp == 0))
07090          goto CACHE_READ;
07091 
07092       return status;
07093    }
07094 #else                           /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07095 
07096    return SS_SUCCESS;
07097 #endif
07098 }

INT EXPRT bm_request_event ( INT  buffer_handle,
short int  event_id,
short int  trigger_mask,
INT  sampling_type,
INT *  request_id,
void(*)(HNDLE, HNDLE, EVENT_HEADER *, void *)  func 
)

Referenced by cm_msg_register(), main(), register_requests(), source_booking(), tr_start(), tr_start1(), and update_request().

INT EXPRT bm_send_event ( INT  buffer_handle,
void *  source,
INT  buf_size,
INT  async_flag 
)

Sends an event to a buffer. This function check if the buffer has enough space for the event, then copies the event to the buffer in shared memory. If clients have requests for the event, they are notified via an UDP packet. 

char event[1000];
// create event with ID 1, trigger mask 0, size 100 bytes and serial number 1
bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) event, 1, 0, 100, 1);

// set first byte of event
*(event+sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) = <...>
#include <stdio.h>
#include "midas.h"
main()
{
 INT status, i;
 HNDLE hbuf;
 char event[1000];
 status = cm_connect_experiment("", "Sample", "Producer", NULL);
 if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
 return 1;
 bm_open_buffer(EVENT_BUFFER_NAME, EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE, &hbuf);

 // create event with ID 1, trigger mask 0, size 100 bytes and serial number 1
 bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) event, 1, 0, 100, 1);

 // set event data
 for (i=0 ; i<100 ; i++)
 *(event+sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)+i) = i;
 // send event
 bm_send_event(hbuf, event, 100+sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
 cm_disconnect_experiment();
 return 0;
}
Parameters:
buffer_handle Buffer handle obtained via bm_open_buffer()
source Address of event buffer
buf_size Size of event including event header in bytes
async_flag Synchronous/asynchronous flag. If FALSE, the function blocks if the buffer has not enough free space to receive the event. If TRUE, the function returns immediately with a value of BM_ASYNC_RETURN without writing the event to the buffer
Returns:
BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE, BM_INVALID_PARAM
BM_ASYNC_RETURN Routine called with async_flag == TRUE and buffer has not enough space to receive event
BM_NO_MEMORY Event is too large for network buffer or event buffer. One has to increase MAX_EVENT_SIZE or EVENT_BUFFER_SIZE in midas.h and recompile.

Definition at line 6057 of file midas.c.

References _buffer_entries, ALIGN8, BUFFER::attached, BM_ASYNC_RETURN, bm_flush_cache(), BM_INVALID_HANDLE, BM_INVALID_PARAM, bm_lock_buffer(), bm_match_event(), BM_NO_MEMORY, BM_SUCCESS, bm_unlock_buffer(), BUFFER::buffer_header, BUFFER_HEADER::client, BUFFER::client_index, cm_msg, data_size, EVENT_REQUEST::event_id, BUFFER_CLIENT::event_request, FALSE, GET_ALL, i, EVENT_REQUEST::id, if, increment, j, BUFFER_HEADER::max_client_index, MAX_EVENT_SIZE, BUFFER_CLIENT::max_request_index, MDEBUG, MERROR, MSG_BM, BUFFER_HEADER::name, BUFFER_HEADER::num_in_events, BUFFER_CLIENT::num_waiting_events, BUFFER_CLIENT::pid, BUFFER_CLIENT::port, BUFFER_CLIENT::read_pointer, BUFFER_HEADER::read_pointer, BUFFER_CLIENT::read_wait, RPC_BM_SEND_EVENT, rpc_call(), rpc_is_remote(), EVENT_REQUEST::sampling_type, BUFFER_HEADER::size, size, SS_ABORT, ss_resume(), ss_suspend(), status, EVENT_REQUEST::trigger_mask, TRUE, EVENT_REQUEST::valid, BUFFER::write_cache, BUFFER::write_cache_size, BUFFER::write_cache_wp, BUFFER_HEADER::write_pointer, and BUFFER_CLIENT::write_wait.

06059    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
06060 
06061    /* check if event size defined in header matches buf_size */
06062    if (ALIGN8(buf_size) != (INT) ALIGN8(((EVENT_HEADER *) source)->data_size +
06063                                       sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))) {
06064       cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event", "event size (%d) mismatch in header (%d)",

06066                                           sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)));

06073              "event size (%d) larger than maximum event size (%d)",
06074              ((EVENT_HEADER *) source)->data_size, MAX_EVENT_SIZE);
06075       return BM_NO_MEMORY;
06076    }
06077

06079       return rpc_call(RPC_BM_SEND_EVENT, buffer_handle, source, buf_size, async_flag);
06080 
06081 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06082    {
06083       BUFFER *pbuf;
06084       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader;
06085       BUFFER_CLIENT *pclient, *pc;
06086       EVENT_REQUEST *prequest;

06097       INT request_id;
06098       char str[80];
06099 
06100       pbuf = &_buffer[buffer_handle - 1];
06101 
06102       if (buffer_handle > _buffer_entries || buffer_handle <= 0) {
06103          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06104          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06105       }
06106 
06107       if (!pbuf->attached) {
06108          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
06109          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
06110       }
06111 
06112       pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) source;
06113       total_size = buf_size;
06114 
06115       /* round up total_size to next DWORD boundary */
06116       total_size = ALIGN8(total_size);
06117 
06118       /* look if there is space in the cache */
06119       if (pbuf->write_cache_size) {
06120          status = BM_SUCCESS;
06121 
06122          if (pbuf->write_cache_size - pbuf->write_cache_wp < total_size)
06123             status = bm_flush_cache(buffer_handle, async_flag);
06124 
06125          if (status != BM_SUCCESS)
06126             return status;
06127 
06128          if (total_size < pbuf->write_cache_size) {
06129             memcpy(pbuf->write_cache + pbuf->write_cache_wp, source, total_size);
06130 
06131             pbuf->write_cache_wp += total_size;
06132             return BM_SUCCESS;
06133          }
06134       }
06135 
06136       /* calculate some shorthands */
06137       pheader = _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].buffer_header;
06138       pdata = (char *) (pheader + 1);
06139       my_client_index = _buffer[buffer_handle - 1].client_index;
06140       pclient = pheader->client;
06141 
06142       /* check if buffer is large enough */
06143       if (total_size >= pheader->size) {
06144          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_send_event",
06145                 "total event size (%d) larger than buffer size (%d)", total_size,
06146                 pheader->size);
06147          return BM_NO_MEMORY;
06148       }
06149 
06150       /* lock the buffer */
06151       bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06152 
06153       /* check if enough space in buffer left */
06154       do {
06155          size = pheader->read_pointer - pheader->write_pointer;
06156          if (size <= 0)
06157             size += pheader->size;
06158 
06159          if (size <= total_size) {      /* note the '<=' to avoid 100% filling */
06160             /* if not enough space, find out who's blocking */
06161             n_blocking = 0;
06162 
06163             for (i = 0, pc = pclient; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pc++)
06164                if (pc->pid) {
06165                   if (pc->read_pointer == pheader->read_pointer) {
06166                      /*
06167                         First assume that the client with the "minimum" read pointer
06168                         is not really blocking due to a GET_ALL request.
06169                       */
06170                      blocking = FALSE;
06171                      request_id = -1;
06172 
06173                      /* check if this request blocks */
06174 
06175                      prequest = pc->event_request;
06176                      pevent_test = (EVENT_HEADER *) (pdata + pc->read_pointer);
06177 
06178                      for (j = 0; j < pc->max_request_index; j++, prequest++)
06179                         if (prequest->valid &&
06180                             bm_match_event(prequest->event_id, prequest->trigger_mask,
06181                                            pevent_test)) {
06182                            request_id = prequest->id;
06183                            if (prequest->sampling_type & GET_ALL) {
06184                               blocking = TRUE;
06185                               break;
06186                            }
06187                         }
06188 
06189                      if (!blocking) {
06190                         /*
06191                            The blocking guy has no GET_ALL request for this event
06192                            -> shift its read pointer.
06193                          */
06194 
06195                         old_read_pointer = pc->read_pointer;
06196 
06197                         increment = sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) +
06198                             ((EVENT_HEADER *) (pdata + pc->read_pointer))->data_size;
06199 
06200                         /* correct increment for DWORD boundary */
06201                         increment = ALIGN8(increment);
06202 
06203                         new_read_pointer = (pc->read_pointer + increment) % pheader->size;
06204 
06205                         if (new_read_pointer > pheader->size - (int) sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
06206                            new_read_pointer = 0;
06207 
06208                         pc->read_pointer = new_read_pointer;
06209                      } else {
06210                         n_blocking++;
06211                      }
06212 
06213                      /* wake that client if it has a request */
06214                      if (pc->read_wait && request_id != -1) {
06215 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06216                         cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send wake: rp=%d, wp=%d",
06217                                pheader->read_pointer, pheader->write_pointer);
06218 #endif
06219                         sprintf(str, "B %s %d", pheader->name, request_id);
06220                         ss_resume(pc->port, str);
06221                      }
06222 
06223 
06224                   }             /* read_pointer blocks */
06225                }
06226             /* client loop */
06227             if (n_blocking > 0) {
06228                /* at least one client is blocking */
06229 
06230                bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06231 
06232                /* return now in ASYNC mode */
06233                if (async_flag)
06234                   return BM_ASYNC_RETURN;
06235 
06236 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06237                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send sleep: rp=%d, wp=%d, level=%1.1lf",
06238                       pheader->read_pointer,
06239                       pheader->write_pointer, 100 - 100.0 * size / pheader->size);
06240 #endif
06241 
06242                /* has the read pointer moved in between ? */
06243                size = pheader->read_pointer - pheader->write_pointer;
06244                if (size <= 0)
06245                   size += pheader->size;
06246 
06247                /* suspend process */
06248                if (size <= total_size) {
06249                   /* signal other clients wait mode */
06250                   pclient[my_client_index].write_wait = total_size;
06251 
06252                   status = ss_suspend(1000, MSG_BM);
06253 
06254                   pclient[my_client_index].write_wait = 0;
06255 
06256                   /* return if TCP connection broken */
06257                   if (status == SS_ABORT)
06258                      return SS_ABORT;
06259                }
06260 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06261                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send woke up: rp=%d, wp=%d, level=%1.1lf",
06262                       pheader->read_pointer,
06263                       pheader->write_pointer, 100 - 100.0 * size / pheader->size);
06264 #endif
06265 
06266                bm_lock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06267 
06268                /* has the write pointer moved in between ? */
06269                size = pheader->read_pointer - pheader->write_pointer;
06270                if (size <= 0)
06271                   size += pheader->size;
06272             } else {
06273                /*
06274                   calculate new global read pointer as "minimum" of
06275                   client read pointers
06276                 */
06277                min_wp = pheader->write_pointer;
06278 
06279                for (i = 0, pc = pclient; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pc++)
06280                   if (pc->pid) {
06281                      if (pc->read_pointer < min_wp)
06282                         min_wp = pc->read_pointer;
06283 
06284                      if (pc->read_pointer > pheader->write_pointer &&
06285                          pc->read_pointer - pheader->size < min_wp)
06286                         min_wp = pc->read_pointer - pheader->size;
06287                   }
06288 
06289                if (min_wp < 0)
06290                   min_wp += pheader->size;
06291 
06292                pheader->read_pointer = min_wp;
06293             }
06294 
06295          }
06296          /* if (size <= total_size) */
06297       } while (size <= total_size);
06298 
06299       /* we have space, so let's copy the event */
06300       old_write_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
06301 
06302       if (pheader->write_pointer + total_size <= pheader->size) {
06303          memcpy(pdata + pheader->write_pointer, pevent, total_size);
06304          pheader->write_pointer = (pheader->write_pointer + total_size) % pheader->size;
06305          if (pheader->write_pointer > pheader->size - (int) sizeof(EVENT_HEADER))
06306             pheader->write_pointer = 0;
06307       } else {
06308          /* split event */
06309          size = pheader->size - pheader->write_pointer;
06310 
06311          memcpy(pdata + pheader->write_pointer, pevent, size);
06312          memcpy(pdata, (char *) pevent + size, total_size - size);
06313 
06314          pheader->write_pointer = total_size - size;
06315       }
06316 
06317       /* check which clients have a request for this event */
06318       for (i = 0; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++)
06319          if (pclient[i].pid) {
06320             prequest = pclient[i].event_request;
06321             num_requests_client = 0;
06322             request_id = -1;
06323 
06324             for (j = 0; j < pclient[i].max_request_index; j++, prequest++)
06325                if (prequest->valid &&
06326                    bm_match_event(prequest->event_id, prequest->trigger_mask, pevent)) {
06327                   if (prequest->sampling_type & GET_ALL)
06328                      pclient[i].num_waiting_events++;
06329 
06330                   num_requests_client++;
06331                   request_id = prequest->id;
06332                }
06333 
06334             /* if that client has a request and is suspended, wake it up */
06335             if (num_requests_client && pclient[i].read_wait) {
06336 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06337                cm_msg(MDEBUG, "Send wake: rp=%d, wp=%d", pheader->read_pointer,
06338                       pheader->write_pointer);
06339 #endif
06340                sprintf(str, "B %s %d", pheader->name, request_id);
06341                ss_resume(pclient[i].port, str);
06342             }
06343 
06344             /* if that client has no request, shift its read pointer */
06345             if (num_requests_client == 0 && pclient[i].read_pointer == old_write_pointer)
06346                pclient[i].read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
06347          }
06348 
06349       /* shift read pointer of own client */
06350 /* 16.4.99 SR, outcommented to receive own messages
06351 
06352   if (pclient[my_client_index].read_pointer == old_write_pointer)
06353     pclient[my_client_index].read_pointer = pheader->write_pointer;
06354 */
06355 
06356       /* calculate global read pointer as "minimum" of client read pointers */
06357       min_wp = pheader->write_pointer;
06358 
06359       for (i = 0, pc = pclient; i < pheader->max_client_index; i++, pc++)
06360          if (pc->pid) {
06361             if (pc->read_pointer < min_wp)
06362                min_wp = pc->read_pointer;
06363 
06364             if (pc->read_pointer > pheader->write_pointer &&
06365                 pc->read_pointer - pheader->size < min_wp)
06366                min_wp = pc->read_pointer - pheader->size;
06367          }
06368 
06369       if (min_wp < 0)
06370          min_wp += pheader->size;
06371 
06372 #ifdef DEBUG_MSG
06373       if (min_wp == pheader->read_pointer)
06374          cm_msg(MDEBUG, "bm_send_event -> wp=%d", pheader->write_pointer);
06375       else
06376          cm_msg(MDEBUG, "bm_send_event -> wp=%d, rp %d -> %d, size=%d",
06377                 pheader->write_pointer, pheader->read_pointer, min_wp, size);
06378 #endif
06379 
06380       pheader->read_pointer = min_wp;
06381 
06382       /* update statistics */
06383       pheader->num_in_events++;
06384 
06385       /* unlock the buffer */
06386       bm_unlock_buffer(buffer_handle);
06387    }
06388 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06389 
06390    return BM_SUCCESS;
06391 }

INT EXPRT bm_set_cache_size ( INT  buffer_handle,
INT  read_size,
INT  write_size 
)

Modifies buffer cache size. Without a buffer cache, events are copied to/from the shared memory event by event.

To protect processed from accessing the shared memory simultaneously, semaphores are used. Since semaphore operations are CPU consuming (typically 50-100us) this can slow down the data transfer especially for small events. By using a cache the number of semaphore operations is reduced dramatically. Instead writing directly to the shared memory, the events are copied to a local cache buffer. When this buffer is full, it is copied to the shared memory in one operation. The same technique can be used when receiving events.

The drawback of this method is that the events have to be copied twice, once to the cache and once from the cache to the shared memory. Therefore it can happen that the usage of a cache even slows down data throughput on a given environment (computer type, OS type, event size). The cache size has therefore be optimized manually to maximize data throughput.

Parameters:
buffer_handle buffer handle obtained via bm_open_buffer()
read_size cache size for reading events in bytes, zero for no cache
write_size cache size for writing events in bytes, zero for no cache
Returns:
BM_SUCCESS, BM_INVALID_HANDLE, BM_NO_MEMORY, BM_INVALID_PARAM

Definition at line 5589 of file midas.c.

References _buffer_entries, BM_INVALID_HANDLE, BM_INVALID_PARAM, BM_NO_MEMORY, BM_SUCCESS, cm_msg, M_FREE, M_MALLOC, MERROR, BUFFER::read_cache, BUFFER::read_cache_rp, BUFFER::read_cache_size, BUFFER::read_cache_wp, RPC_BM_SET_CACHE_SIZE, rpc_call(), rpc_is_remote(), BUFFER::write_cache, BUFFER::write_cache_rp, BUFFER::write_cache_size, and BUFFER::write_cache_wp.

Referenced by main(), register_equipment(), register_requests(), rpc_server_dispatch(), tr_start(), and tr_start1().

05594

05598

05601          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05602       }

05605          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid buffer handle %d", buffer_handle);
05606          return BM_INVALID_HANDLE;
05607       }
05608

05610          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid read chache size");
05611          return BM_INVALID_PARAM;
05612       }
05613

05615          cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size", "invalid write chache size");

05617       }
05618

05628             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size",
05629                    "not enough memory to allocate cache buffer");
05630             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05631          }
05632       }
05633 
05634       pbuf->read_cache_size = read_size;
05635       pbuf->read_cache_rp = pbuf->read_cache_wp = 0;
05636 
05637       /* manage write cache */
05638       if (pbuf->write_cache_size > 0)
05639          M_FREE(pbuf->write_cache);
05640

05642          pbuf->write_cache = (char *) M_MALLOC(write_size);
05643          if (pbuf->write_cache == NULL) {
05644             cm_msg(MERROR, "bm_set_cache_size",
05645                    "not enough memory to allocate cache buffer");
05646             return BM_NO_MEMORY;
05647          }
05648       }
05649 
05650       pbuf->write_cache_size = write_size;
05651       pbuf->write_cache_rp = pbuf->write_cache_wp = 0;
05652 
05653    }
05654 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05655 
05656    return BM_SUCCESS;
05657 }

Useful for single event displays to see the newest events

INT EXPRT cm_check_deferred_transition ( void   ) 

Check for any deferred transition. If a deferred transition handler has been registered via the cm_register_deferred_transition function, this routine should be called regularly. It checks if a transition request is pending. If so, it calld the registered handler if the transition should be done and then actually does the transition.

Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, <error> Error from cm_transition()

Definition at line 3482 of file midas.c.

References cm_msg, CM_SUCCESS, cm_transition(), FALSE, i, MERROR, status, SUCCESS, SYNC, TR_DEFERRED, TRANS_TABLE::transition, and TRUE.

Referenced by scheduler().

03483 {
03484    INT i, status;
03485    char str[256];
03486    static BOOL first;
03487 
03488    if (_requested_transition == 0)
03489       first = TRUE;
03490 
03491    if (_requested_transition & _deferred_transition_mask) {
03492       for (i = 0; _deferred_trans_table[i].transition; i++)
03493          if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == _requested_transition)
03494             break;
03495 
03496       if (_deferred_trans_table[i].transition == _requested_transition) {
03497          if (((BOOL(*)(INT, BOOL)) _deferred_trans_table[i].func) (_requested_transition,
03498                                                                    first)) {
03499             status =
03500                 cm_transition(_requested_transition | TR_DEFERRED, 0, str, sizeof(str),
03501                               SYNC, FALSE);
03502             if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
03503                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_check_deferred_transition",
03504                       "Cannot perform deferred transition: %s", str);
03505 
03506             /* bypass hotlink and set _requested_transition directly to zero */
03507             _requested_transition = 0;
03508

03510          }
03511          first = FALSE;
03512       }
03513    }
03514 
03515    return SUCCESS;
03516 }

INT EXPRT cm_cleanup ( char *  client_name,
BOOL  ignore_timeout 
)

Remove hanging clients independent of their watchdog timeout.

Since this function does not obey the client watchdog timeout, it should be only called to remove clients which have their watchdog checking turned off or which are known to be dead. The normal client removement is done via cm_watchdog().

Currently (Sept. 02) there are two applications for that:

  1. The ODBEdit command "cleanup", which can be used to remove clients which have their watchdog checking off, like the analyzer started with the "-d" flag for a debugging session.
  2. The frontend init code to remove previous frontends. This can be helpful if a frontend dies. Normally, one would have to wait 60 sec. for a crashed frontend to be removed. Only then one can start again the frontend. Since the frontend init code contains a call to cm_cleanup(<frontend_name>), one can restart a frontend immediately.

Added ignore_timeout on Nov.03. A logger might have an increased tiemout of up to 60 sec. because of tape operations. If ignore_timeout is FALSE, the logger is then not killed if its inactivity is less than 60 sec., while in the previous implementation it was always killed after 2*WATCHDOG_INTERVAL.

Parameters:
client_name Client name, if zero check all clients
ignore_timeout If TRUE, ignore a possible increased timeout defined by each client.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 5147 of file midas.c.

References _buffer_entries, _database_entries, KEY::access_mode, OPEN_RECORD::access_mode, bm_lock_buffer(), bm_unlock_buffer(), BUFFER::buffer_header, DATABASE_HEADER::client, BUFFER_HEADER::client, DATABASE::client_index, BUFFER::client_index, cm_delete_client_info(), cm_msg, CM_SUCCESS, DATABASE::database_header, db_lock_database(), db_set_mode(), db_unlock_database(), FALSE, OPEN_RECORD::handle, i, interval, j, k, DATABASE_CLIENT::last_activity, BUFFER_CLIENT::last_activity, DATABASE_HEADER::max_client_index, BUFFER_HEADER::max_client_index, MAX_CLIENTS, DATABASE_CLIENT::max_index, MERROR, MINFO, MODE_EXCLUSIVE, MODE_WRITE, DATABASE_HEADER::name, DATABASE_CLIENT::name, BUFFER_HEADER::name, BUFFER_CLIENT::name, KEY::notify_count, DATABASE_HEADER::num_clients, BUFFER_HEADER::num_clients, DATABASE_CLIENT::open_record, DATABASE_CLIENT::pid, BUFFER_CLIENT::pid, BUFFER_CLIENT::port, BUFFER_CLIENT::read_wait, rpc_call(), RPC_CM_CLEANUP, rpc_is_remote(), ss_millitime(), ss_resume(), status, DATABASE_CLIENT::tid, TRUE, WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, DATABASE_CLIENT::watchdog_timeout, BUFFER_CLIENT::watchdog_timeout, and BUFFER_CLIENT::write_wait.

Referenced by command_loop(), main(), and rpc_server_dispatch().

05148 {
05149    if (rpc_is_remote())
05150       return rpc_call(RPC_CM_CLEANUP, client_name);
05151 
05152 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05153    {
05154       BUFFER_HEADER *pheader = NULL;
05155       BUFFER_CLIENT *pbclient, *pbctmp;
05156       DATABASE_HEADER *pdbheader;
05157       DATABASE_CLIENT *pdbclient;
05158       KEY *pkey;

05161       BOOL bDeleted;
05162       char str[256];
05163       DWORD interval;
05164 
05165       /* check buffers */
05166       for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
05167          if (_buffer[i].attached) {
05168             /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
05169             pheader = _buffer[i].buffer_header;
05170             pbclient = pheader->client;
05171             pbclient[_buffer[i].client_index].last_activity = ss_millitime();
05172

05176                    (client_name[0] == 0
05177                     || strncmp(pbclient->name, client_name, strlen(client_name)) == 0)) {

05179                      interval = 2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05180                   else
05181                      interval = pbclient->watchdog_timeout;
05182 
05183                   /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
05184                   if (ss_millitime() - pbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05185                      bm_lock_buffer(i + 1);
05186                      str[0] = 0;
05187 
05188                      /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
05189                      if (ss_millitime() - pbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05190                         sprintf(str,
05191                                 "Client %s on %s removed (via cleanup) (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
05192                                 pbclient->name, pheader->name,
05193                                 (ss_millitime() - pbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
05194                                 interval / 1000.0);
05195 
05196                         /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
05197                         memset(&(pheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
05198 
05199                         /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
05200                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
05201                            if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05202                               break;
05203                         pheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
05204 
05205                         /* count new number of clients */
05206                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
05207                            if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05208                               nc++;
05209                         pheader->num_clients = nc;
05210 
05211                         /* check if anyone is wating and wake him up */
05212                         pbctmp = pheader->client;
05213 
05214                         for (k = 0; k < pheader->max_client_index; k++, pbctmp++)
05215                            if (pbctmp->pid && (pbctmp->write_wait || pbctmp->read_wait))
05216                               ss_resume(pbctmp->port, "B  ");
05217 
05218                      }
05219 
05220                      bm_unlock_buffer(i + 1);
05221 
05222                      /* display info message after unlocking buffer */
05223                      if (str[0])
05224                         cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_cleanup", str);
05225 
05226                      /* go again through whole list */
05227                      j = 0;
05228                   }
05229                }
05230          }
05231 
05232       /* check online databases */
05233       for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
05234          if (_database[i].attached) {
05235             /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
05236             db_lock_database(i + 1);
05237 
05238             pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
05239             pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
05240             pdbclient[_database[i].client_index].last_activity = ss_millitime();
05241 
05242             /* now check other clients */
05243             for (j = 0; j < pdbheader->max_client_index; j++, pdbclient++)
05244                if (j != _database[i].client_index && pdbclient->pid &&
05245                    (client_name[0] == 0
05246                     || strncmp(pdbclient->name, client_name, strlen(client_name)) == 0)) {
05247                   client_pid = pdbclient->tid;
05248                   if (ignore_timeout)
05249                      interval = 2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
05250                   else
05251                      interval = pdbclient->watchdog_timeout;
05252 
05253                   /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
05254 
05255                   if (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05256                      bDeleted = FALSE;
05257                      str[0] = 0;
05258 
05259                      /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
05260                      if (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity > interval) {
05261                         sprintf(str,
05262                                 "Client %s on %s removed (via cleanup) (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
05263                                 pdbclient->name, pdbheader->name,
05264                                 (ss_millitime() - pdbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
05265                                 interval / 1000.0);
05266 
05267                         /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
05268                         for (k = 0; k < pdbclient->max_index; k++)
05269                            if (pdbclient->open_record[k].handle) {
05270                               pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pdbheader +
05271                                               pdbclient->open_record[k].handle);
05272                               if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
05273                                  pkey->notify_count--;
05274 
05275                               if (pdbclient->open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
05276                                  db_set_mode(i + 1, pdbclient->open_record[k].handle,
05277                                              (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE),
05278                                              2);
05279                            }
05280 
05281                         /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
05282                         memset(&(pdbheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
05283 
05284                         /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
05285                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
05286                            if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05287                               break;
05288                         pdbheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
05289 
05290                         /* count new number of clients */
05291                         for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
05292                            if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
05293                               nc++;
05294                         pdbheader->num_clients = nc;
05295 
05296                         bDeleted = TRUE;
05297                      }
05298 
05299 
05300                      /* delete client entry after unlocking db */
05301                      if (bDeleted) {
05302                         db_unlock_database(i + 1);
05303 
05304                         /* display info message after unlocking buffer */
05305                         cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_cleanup", str);
05306 
05307                         status = cm_delete_client_info(i + 1, client_pid);
05308                         if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
05309                            cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_cleanup", "cannot delete client info");
05310 
05311                         /* re-lock database */
05312                         db_lock_database(i + 1);
05313                         pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
05314                         pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
05315 
05316                         /* go again though whole list */
05317                         j = 0;
05318                      }
05319                   }
05320                }
05321 
05322             db_unlock_database(i + 1);
05323          }
05324 
05325    }
05326 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05327 
05328    return CM_SUCCESS;
05329 }

INT EXPRT cm_connect_experiment ( char *  host_name,
char *  exp_name,
char *  client_name,
void(*)(char *)  func 
)

dox This function connects to an existing MIDAS experiment. This must be the first call in a MIDAS application. It opens three TCP connection to the remote host (one for RPC calls, one to send events and one for hot-link notifications from the remote host) and writes client information into the ODB under /System/Clients.

Attention:
All MIDAS applications should evaluate the MIDAS_SERVER_HOST and MIDAS_EXPT_NAME environment variables as defaults to the host name and experiment name (see Environment_variables). For that purpose, the function cm_get_environment() should be called prior to cm_connect_experiment(). If command line parameters -h and -e are used, the evaluation should be done between cm_get_environment() and cm_connect_experiment(). The function cm_disconnect_experiment() must be called before a MIDAS application exits. 
#include <stdio.h>
#include <midas.h>
main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  INT  status, i;
  char host_name[256],exp_name[32];

  // get default values from environment
  cm_get_environment(host_name, exp_name);

  // parse command line parameters
  for (i=1 ; i<argc ; i++)
    {
    if (argv[i][0] == '-')
      {
      if (i+1 >= argc || argv[i+1][0] == '-')
        goto usage;
      if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
        strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
      else if (argv[i][1] == 'h')
        strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
      else
        {
usage:
        printf("usage: test [-h Hostname] [-e Experiment]\n\n");
        return 1;
        }
      }
    }
  status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, "Test", NULL);
  if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
    return 1;
  ...do operations...
  cm_disconnect_experiment();
}
Parameters:
host_name Specifies host to connect to. Must be a valid IP host name. The string can be empty ("") if to connect to the local computer.
exp_name Specifies the experiment to connect to. If this string is empty, the number of defined experiments in exptab is checked. If only one experiment is defined, the function automatically connects to this one. If more than one experiment is defined, a list is presented and the user can interactively select one experiment.
client_name Client name of the calling program as it can be seen by others (like the scl command in ODBEdit).
func Callback function to read in a password if security has been enabled. In all command line applications this function is NULL which invokes an internal ss_gets() function to read in a password. In windows environments (MS Windows, X Windows) a function can be supplied to open a dialog box and read in the password. The argument of this function must be the returned password.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, CM_UNDEF_EXP, CM_SET_ERROR, RPC_NET_ERROR
CM_VERSION_MISMATCH MIDAS library version different on local and remote computer

Definition at line 2327 of file midas.c.

References cm_connect_experiment1(), cm_get_error(), CM_SUCCESS, DEFAULT_ODB_SIZE, DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT, and status.

Referenced by cam_init_rpc(), interprete(), main(), odb_connect(), and process_file().

02334                                    func, DEFAULT_ODB_SIZE, DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT);
02335    if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
02336       cm_get_error(status, str);
02337       puts(str);
02338    }
02339 
02340    return status;
02341 }

02435

02441    if (status != DB_SUCCESS && status != DB_CREATED) {

02443       return status;
02444    }
02445

02457                                password, watchdog_timeout);
02458

02533    ss_ctrlc_handler(cm_ctrlc_handler);

)

Disconnect from a MIDAS client

Parameters:
hConn Connection handle obtained via cm_connect_client()

see rpc_client_disconnect()

INT EXPRT cm_disconnect_experiment ( void   ) 

Disconnect from a MIDAS experiment.

Attention:
Should be the last call to a MIDAS library function in an application before it exits. This function removes the client information from the ODB, disconnects all TCP connections and frees all internal allocated memory. See cm_connect_experiment() for example.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 2768 of file midas.c.

References _event_buffer_size, _message_print, _msg_buffer, _net_recv_buffer, _net_recv_buffer_size, _net_send_buffer, _net_send_buffer_size, _tcp_buffer, _watchdog_last_called, bm_close_all_buffers(), cm_delete_client_info(), cm_get_experiment_database(), cm_msg, cm_set_experiment_database(), CM_SUCCESS, cm_watchdog(), db_close_all_databases(), db_close_all_records(), FALSE, hDB, hKey, HOST_NAME_LENGTH, M_FREE, MINFO, rpc_client_disconnect(), rpc_deregister_functions(), rpc_get_name(), rpc_get_server_option(), rpc_is_remote(), RPC_OSERVER_TYPE, rpc_server_disconnect(), rpc_server_shutdown(), ss_alarm(), and ST_REMOTE.

INT EXPRT cm_enable_watchdog ( BOOL  flag  ) 

Temporarily disable watchdog calling. Used for tape IO not to interrupt lengthy operations like mount.

Parameters:
flag FALSE for disable, TRUE for re-enable
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 4949 of file midas.c.

References cm_set_watchdog_params(), CM_SUCCESS, DEFAULT_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT, FALSE, timeout, and TRUE.

INT EXPRT cm_get_environment ( char *  host_name,
int  host_name_size,
char *  exp_name,
int  exp_name_size 
)

Returns MIDAS environment variables.

Attention:
This function can be used to evaluate the standard MIDAS environment variables before connecting to an experiment (see Environment_variables). The usual way is that the host name and experiment name are first derived from the environment variables MIDAS_SERVER_HOST and MIDAS_EXPT_NAME. They can then be superseded by command line parameters with -h and -e flags. 
#include <stdio.h>
#include <midas.h>
main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  INT  status, i;
  char host_name[256],exp_name[32];

  // get default values from environment
  cm_get_environment(host_name, exp_name);

  // parse command line parameters
  for (i=1 ; i<argc ; i++)
    {
    if (argv[i][0] == '-')
      {
      if (i+1 >= argc || argv[i+1][0] == '-')
        goto usage;
      if (argv[i][1] == 'e')
        strcpy(exp_name, argv[++i]);
      else if (argv[i][1] == 'h')
        strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
      else
        {
usage:
        printf("usage: test [-h Hostname] [-e Experiment]\n\n");
        return 1;
        }
      }
    }
  status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, exp_name, "Test", NULL);
  if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
    return 1;
    ...do anyting...
  cm_disconnect_experiment();
}
Parameters:
host_name Contents of MIDAS_SERVER_HOST environment variable.
host_name_size string length
exp_name Contents of MIDAS_EXPT_NAME environment variable.
exp_name_size string length
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 2229 of file midas.c.

References CM_SUCCESS, and strlcpy().

02231 {
02232    host_name[0] = exp_name[0] = 0;
02233 
02234    if (getenv("MIDAS_SERVER_HOST"))
02235       strlcpy(host_name, getenv("MIDAS_SERVER_HOST"), host_name_size);
02236 
02237    if (getenv("MIDAS_EXPT_NAME"))
02238       strlcpy(exp_name, getenv("MIDAS_EXPT_NAME"), exp_name_size);
02239 
02240    return CM_SUCCESS;
02241 }

INT EXPRT cm_get_experiment_database ( HNDLE *  hDB,
HNDLE *  hKeyClient 
)

dox Get the handle to the ODB from the currently connected experiment.

Attention:
This function returns the handle of the online database (ODB) which can be used in future db_xxx() calls. The hkeyclient key handle can be used to access the client information in the ODB. If the client key handle is not needed, the parameter can be NULL. 
HNDLE hDB, hkeyclient;

INT EXPRT cm_msg ( INT  message_type,
char *  filename,
INT  line,
const char *  routine,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

This routine can be called whenever an internal error occurs or an informative message is produced. Different message types can be enabled or disabled by setting the type bits via cm_set_msg_print().

Attention:
Do not add the "\n" escape carriage control at the end of the formated line as it is already added by the client on the receiving side. 
   ...
   cm_msg(MINFO, "my program", "This is a information message only);
   cm_msg(MERROR, "my program", "This is an error message with status:%d", my_status);
   cm_msg(MTALK, "my_program", My program is Done!");
   ...
Parameters:
message_type (See midas_macro).
filename Name of source file where error occured
line Line number where error occured
routine Routine name.
format message to printout, ... Parameters like for printf()
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 1233 of file midas.c.

References _message_mask_system, _message_mask_user, _message_print, _msg_buffer, bm_compose_event(), BM_CREATED, bm_open_buffer(), bm_send_event(), BM_SUCCESS, cm_msg_log(), CM_SUCCESS, EVENT_HEADER::data_size, EVENTID_MESSAGE, FALSE, MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, MT_ERROR, MT_LOG, MT_USER, rpc_get_name(), status, SYNC, and TRUE.

01235 {
01236    va_list argptr;
01237    char event[1000], str[256], local_message[256], send_message[256], *pc;
01238    EVENT_HEADER *pevent;
01239    INT status;
01240    static BOOL in_routine = FALSE;
01241 
01242    /* avoid recursive calls */
01243    if (in_routine)
01244       return 0;
01245 
01246    in_routine = TRUE;
01247 
01248    /* strip path */
01249    pc = filename + strlen(filename);
01250    while (*pc != '\\' && *pc != '/' && pc != filename)
01251       pc--;
01252    if (pc != filename)
01253       pc++;
01254 
01255    /* print client name into string */
01256    if (message_type == MT_USER)
01257       sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", routine);
01258    else {
01259       rpc_get_name(str);
01260       if (str[0])
01261          sprintf(send_message, "[%s] ", str);
01262       else
01263          send_message[0] = 0;
01264    }
01265 
01266    local_message[0] = 0;
01267 
01268    /* preceed error messages with file and line info */
01269    if (message_type == MT_ERROR) {
01270       sprintf(str, "[%s:%d:%s] ", pc, line, routine);
01271       strcat(send_message, str);
01272       strcat(local_message, str);
01273    }
01274 
01275    /* print argument list into message */
01276    va_start(argptr, format);
01277    vsprintf(str, (char *) format, argptr);
01278    va_end(argptr);
01279    strcat(send_message, str);
01280    strcat(local_message, str);
01281 
01282    /* call user function if set via cm_set_msg_print */
01283    if (_message_print != NULL && (message_type & _message_mask_user) != 0)
01284       _message_print(local_message);
01285 
01286    /* return if system mask is not set */
01287    if ((message_type & _message_mask_system) == 0) {
01288       in_routine = FALSE;
01289       return CM_SUCCESS;
01290    }
01291 
01292    /* copy message to event */
01293    pevent = (EVENT_HEADER *) event;
01294    strcpy(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), send_message);
01295 
01296    /* send event if not of type MLOG */
01297    if (message_type != MT_LOG) {
01298       /* if no message buffer already opened, do so now */
01299       if (_msg_buffer == 0) {
01300          status = bm_open_buffer(MESSAGE_BUFFER_NAME, MESSAGE_BUFFER_SIZE, &_msg_buffer);
01301          if (status != BM_SUCCESS && status != BM_CREATED) {
01302             in_routine = FALSE;
01303             return status;
01304          }
01305       }
01306 
01307       /* setup the event header and send the message */
01308       bm_compose_event(pevent, EVENTID_MESSAGE, (WORD) message_type,
01309                        strlen(event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER)) + 1, 0);
01310       bm_send_event(_msg_buffer, event, pevent->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER), SYNC);
01311    }
01312 
01313    /* log message */
01314    cm_msg_log(message_type, send_message);
01315 
01316    in_routine = FALSE;
01317 
01318    return CM_SUCCESS;
01319 }

)

This routine is similar to cm_msg(). It differs from cm_msg() only by the logging destination being a file given through the argument list i.e:facility

01428    }
01429

01431    cm_msg_log1(message_type, send_message, facility);
01432 
01433    in_routine = FALSE;
01434 
01435    return CM_SUCCESS;
01436 }

{
  char str[256], *pc, *sp;
  // print message
  printf("%s\n", (char *)(message));

                 ,header->event_id
                 ,header->trigger_mask
                 ,header->serial_number
                 ,header->data_size);

  ...

  if (header->trigger_mask == MT_TALK ||
      header->trigger_mask == MT_USER)
   ...
}

10408          : cm_query_transition
10409 
10410   Purpose: Query system if transition has occured. Normally, one 
10411            registers callbacks for transitions via 
10412            cm_register_transition. In some environments however,
10413            callbacks are not possible. In that case one spciefies
10414            a NULL pointer as the callback routine and can query
10415            transitions "manually" by calling this functions. A small
10416            FIFO takes care that no transition is lost if this functions
10417            did not get called between some transitions.
10418 
10419   Output:
10420     INT   *transition        Type of transition, one of TR_xxx
10421     INT   *run_nuber         Run number for transition
10422     time_t *trans_time       Time (in UNIX time) of transition
10423 
10424   Function value:
10425     FALSE  No transition occured since last call
10426     TRUE   Transition occured
10427 
10428 \********************************************************************/
10429 {

10431    if (trf_wp == trf_rp)
10432       return FALSE;
10433 
10434    if (transition)
10435       *transition = tr_fifo[trf_rp].transition;
10436 
10437    if (run_number)
10438       *run_number = tr_fifo[trf_rp].run_number;
10439 
10440    if (trans_time)
10441       *trans_time = (int)tr_fifo[trf_rp].trans_time;
10442 
10443    trf_rp = (trf_rp + 1) % 10;
10444 
10445    return TRUE;
10446 }

INT EXPRT cm_register_deferred_transition ( INT  transition,
BOOL(*)(INT, BOOL)  func 
)

dox Register a deferred transition handler. If a client is registered as a deferred transition handler, it may defer a requested transition by returning FALSE until a certain condition (like a motor reaches its end position) is reached.

Parameters:
transition One of TR_xxx
(*func) Function which gets called whenever a transition is requested. If it returns FALSE, the transition is not performed.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, <error> Error from ODB access

02020          }
02021       }
02022 
02023       /* make following operation atomic by locking database */
02024       db_lock_database(hDB);
02025 
02026       /* check if entry with this pid exists already */
02027       pid = ss_gettid();
02028 
02029       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d", pid);
02030       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
02031       if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
02032          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
02033          db_delete_key(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
02034       }
02035 
02036       if (strlen(client_name) >= NAME_LENGTH)
02037          client_name[NAME_LENGTH] = 0;
02038 
02039       strcpy(name, client_name);
02040       strcpy(orig_name, client_name);
02041 
02042       /* check if client name already exists */
02043       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, "System/Clients", &hKey);
02044 
02045       for (index = 1; status != DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS; index++) {
02046          for (i = 0;; i++) {
02047             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hKey, i, &hSubkey);
02048             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
02049                break;
02050 
02051             if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
02052                size = sizeof(str);
02053                status = db_get_value(hDB, hSubkey, "Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
02054             }
02055 
02056             /* check if client is living */
02057             if (cm_check_client(hDB, hSubkey) == CM_NO_CLIENT)
02058                continue;
02059 
02060             if (equal_ustring(str, name)) {
02061                sprintf(name, "%s%d", client_name, index);
02062                break;
02063             }
02064          }
02065       }
02066 
02067       /* set name */
02068       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d/Name", pid);
02069       status = db_set_value(hDB, 0, str, name, NAME_LENGTH, 1, TID_STRING);
02070       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
02071          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02072          cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_set_client_info", "cannot set client name");
02073          return status;
02074       }
02075 
02076       /* copy new client name */
02077       strcpy(client_name, name);
02078       db_set_client_name(hDB, client_name);
02079 
02080       /* set also as rpc name */
02081       rpc_set_name(client_name);
02082 
02083       /* use /system/clients/PID as root */
02084       sprintf(str, "System/Clients/%0d", pid);
02085       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKey);
02086 
02087       /* set host name */
02088       status =
02089           db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Host", host_name, HOST_NAME_LENGTH, 1, TID_STRING);
02090       if (status != DB_SUCCESS){
02091          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02092          return status;
02093       }
02094 
02095       /* set computer id */
02096       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Hardware type", &hw_type,
02097                             sizeof(hw_type), 1, TID_INT);
02098       if (status != DB_SUCCESS){
02099          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02100          return status;
02101       }
02102 
02103       /* set server port */
02104       data = 0;
02105       status = db_set_value(hDB, hKey, "Server Port", &data, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);
02106       if (status != DB_SUCCESS){
02107          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02108          return status;
02109       }
02110 
02111       /* lock client entry */
02112       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
02113 
02114       /* get (set) default watchdog timeout */
02115       size = sizeof(watchdog_timeout);
02116       sprintf(str, "/Programs/%s/Watchdog Timeout", orig_name);
02117       db_get_value(hDB, 0, str, &watchdog_timeout, &size, TID_INT, TRUE);
02118 
02119       /* define /programs entry */
02120       sprintf(str, "/Programs/%s", orig_name);
02121       db_create_record(hDB, 0, str, strcomb(program_info_str));
02122 
02123       /* save handle for ODB and client */
02124       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_ODB_HANDLE, hDB);
02125       rpc_set_server_option(RPC_CLIENT_HANDLE, hKey);
02126 
02127       /* save watchdog timeout */
02128       cm_get_watchdog_params(&call_watchdog, NULL);
02129       cm_set_watchdog_params(call_watchdog, watchdog_timeout);
02130       if (call_watchdog)
02131          ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
02132 
02133       /* end of atomic operations */
02134       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02135 
02136       /* touch notify key to inform others */
02137       data = 0;
02138       db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/System/Client Notify", &data, sizeof(data), 1, TID_INT);
02139 
02140       *hKeyClient = hKey;
02141    }
02142 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02143 
02144    return CM_SUCCESS;
02145 }

INT EXPRT cm_set_msg_print ( INT  system_mask,
INT  user_mask,
int(*)(const char *)  func 
)

Set message masks. When a message is generated by calling cm_msg(), it can got to two destinatinons. First a user defined callback routine and second to the "SYSMSG" buffer.

A user defined callback receives all messages which satisfy the user_mask.

int message_print(const char *msg)
{
  char str[160];

  memset(str, ' ', 159);
  str[159] = 0;
  if (msg[0] == '[')
    msg = strchr(msg, ']')+2;
  memcpy(str, msg, strlen(msg));
  ss_printf(0, 20, str);
  return 0;
}
...
  cm_set_msg_print(MT_ALL, MT_ALL, message_print);
...
Parameters:
system_mask Bit masks for MERROR, MINFO etc. to send system messages.
user_mask Bit masks for MERROR, MINFO etc. to send messages to the user callback.
func Function which receives all printout. By setting "puts", messages are just printed to the screen.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 1032 of file midas.c.

References _message_mask_system, _message_mask_user, _message_print, and BM_SUCCESS.

Referenced by cam_init_rpc(), cm_connect_experiment1(), CMExperiment::Connect(), interprete(), main(), and CMExperiment::~CMExperiment().

01033 {
01034    _message_mask_system = system_mask;
01035    _message_mask_user = user_mask;
01036    _message_print = func;
01037 
01038    return BM_SUCCESS;
01039 }

INT EXPRT cm_set_watchdog_params ( BOOL  call_watchdog,
DWORD  timeout 
)

dox Sets the internal watchdog flags and the own timeout. If call_watchdog is TRUE, the cm_watchdog routine is called periodically from the system to show other clients that this application is "alive". On UNIX systems, the alarm() timer is used which is then not available for user purposes.

The timeout specifies the time, after which the calling application should be considered "dead" by other clients. Normally, the cm_watchdog() routines is called periodically. If a client crashes, this does not occur any more. Then other clients can detect this and clear all buffer and database entries of this application so they are not blocked any more. If this application should not checked by others, the timeout can be specified as zero. It might be useful for debugging purposes to do so, because if a debugger comes to a breakpoint and stops the application, the periodic call of cm_watchdog is disabled and the client looks like dead.

If the timeout is not zero, but the watchdog is not called (call_watchdog == FALSE), the user must ensure to call cm_watchdog periodically with a period of WATCHDOG_INTERVAL milliseconds or less.

An application which calles system routines which block the alarm signal for some time, might increase the timeout to the maximum expected blocking time before issuing the calls. One example is the logger doing Exabyte tape IO, which can take up to one minute.

Parameters:
call_watchdog Call the cm_watchdog routine periodically
timeout Timeout for this application in ms
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS

Definition at line 3000 of file midas.c.

References _buffer_entries, _database_entries, BUFFER::buffer_header, DATABASE_HEADER::client, BUFFER_HEADER::client, DATABASE::client_index, BUFFER::client_index, cm_get_experiment_database(), CM_SUCCESS, cm_watchdog(), DATABASE::database_header, db_lock_database(), db_set_mode(), db_set_value(), db_unlock_database(), hDB, hKey, i, index, DATABASE_CLIENT::last_activity, BUFFER_CLIENT::last_activity, MODE_READ, MODE_WRITE, rpc_call(), RPC_CM_SET_WATCHDOG_PARAMS, rpc_get_server_acception(), rpc_get_server_option(), rpc_is_remote(), RPC_OSERVER_TYPE, rpc_set_server_option(), RPC_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT, ss_alarm(), ss_gettid(), ss_millitime(), ST_REMOTE, ST_SINGLE, TID_INT, TRUE, WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, DATABASE_CLIENT::watchdog_timeout, and BUFFER_CLIENT::watchdog_timeout.

03045             continue;
03046

03048             continue;

03051          pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
03052 
03053          /* show activity */
03054          pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
03055       }
03056 
03057       /* set watchdog flag of alll open databases */
03058       for (i = _database_entries; i > 0; i--) {
03059          DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03060          DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
03061          INT index;
03062

03064          index = _database[i - 1].client_index;
03065          pheader = _database[i - 1].database_header;
03066          pclient = &pheader->client[index];
03067 
03068          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
03069              _database[i - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
03070             db_unlock_database(i);
03071             continue;
03072          }
03073 
03074          if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE &&
03075              _database[i - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
03076             db_unlock_database(i);
03077             continue;
03078          }
03079 
03080          if (!_database[i - 1].attached) {
03081             db_unlock_database(i);
03082             continue;
03083          }
03084 
03085          /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
03086          pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
03087 
03088          /* show activity */
03089          pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
03090 
03091          db_unlock_database(i);
03092       }
03093 
03094       if (call_watchdog)
03095          /* restart watchdog */
03096          ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
03097       else
03098          /* kill current timer */
03099          ss_alarm(0, cm_watchdog);
03100    }
03101 
03102 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03103 
03104    return CM_SUCCESS;
03105 }

INT EXPRT cm_shutdown ( char *  name,

)

CM_SUCCESS, CM_NO_CLIENT, DB_NO_KEY

04980 {
04981    INT status, return_status, i, size;
04982    HNDLE hDB, hKeyClient, hKey, hSubkey, hKeyTmp, hConn;
04983    KEY key;
04984    char client_name[NAME_LENGTH], remote_host[HOST_NAME_LENGTH], str[256];

04993

05046                       "Cannot shutdown client \"%s\", please kill manually and do an ODB cleanup",

05048                return_status = CM_NO_CLIENT;

05050                return_status = CM_SUCCESS;
05051                i--;
05052             }
05053          }
05054       }
05055    }
05056

INT EXPRT cm_transition ( INT  transition,
INT  run_number,
char *  perror,
INT  strsize,
INT  async_flag,
INT  debug_flag 
)

Performs a run transition (Start/Stop/Pause/Resume).

Synchronous/Asynchronous flag. If set to ASYNC, the transition is done asynchronously, meaning that clients are connected and told to execute their callback routine, but no result is awaited. The return value is specified by the transition callback function on the remote clients. If all callbacks can perform the transition, CM_SUCCESS is returned. If one callback cannot perform the transition, the return value of this callback is returned from cm_transition(). The async_flag is usually FALSE so that transition callbacks can block a run transition in case of problems and return an error string. The only exception are situations where a run transition is performed automatically by a program which cannot block in a transition. For example the logger can cause a run stop when a disk is nearly full but it cannot block in the cm_transition() function since it has its own run stop callback which must flush buffers and close disk files and tapes. 

...
    i = 1;
    db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Transition in progress", &i, sizeof(INT), 1, TID_INT);

      status = cm_transition(TR_START, new_run_number, str, sizeof(str), SYNC, debug_flag);
      if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
      {
        // in case of error
        printf("Error: %s\n", str);
      }
    ...
Parameters:
transition TR_START, TR_PAUSE, TR_RESUME or TR_STOP.
run_number New run number. If zero, use current run number plus one.
perror returned error string.
strsize Size of error string.
async_flag SYNC: synchronization flag (SYNC:wait completion, ASYNC: retun immediately)
debug_flag If 1 output debugging information, if 2 output via cm_msg().
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, <error> error code from remote client

Definition at line 3579 of file midas.c.

References ASYNC, PROGRAM_INFO::auto_start, PROGRAM_INFO::auto_stop, buffer, closesocket, cm_asctime(), CM_DEFERRED_TRANSITION, cm_get_experiment_database(), cm_get_version(), CM_INVALID_TRANSITION, cm_msg, cm_shutdown(), CM_SUCCESS, cm_time(), CM_TRANSITION_IN_PROGRESS, db_enum_key(), db_find_key(), db_flush_database(), db_get_data_index(), db_get_key(), db_get_record(), db_get_value(), DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS, db_set_mode(), db_set_value(), DB_SUCCESS, FALSE, TRANS_TABLE::func, hConn, hDB, hKey, HOST_NAME_LENGTH, hSubkey, i, index, j, key, MDEBUG, MERROR, MIDAS_TCP_PORT, MINFO, MODE_DELETE, MODE_READ, MODE_WRITE, KEY::name, name, NAME_LENGTH, KEY::num_values, TR_CLIENT::port, rpc_client_call(), rpc_client_connect(), RPC_FTCP, rpc_get_option(), RPC_OTIMEOUT, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_RC_TRANSITION, rpc_set_option(), RPC_SUCCESS, RPC_TCP, TR_CLIENT::sequence_number, size, ss_system(), PROGRAM_INFO::start_command, STATE_PAUSED, STATE_RUNNING, STATE_STOPPED, status, SUCCESS, TID_DWORD, TID_INT, TID_KEY, TID_STRING, tr_compare(), TR_DEFERRED, TR_PAUSE, TR_RESUME, TR_START, TR_STOP, trans_name, TRANS_TABLE::transition, TRUE, and KEY::type.

03593    transition &= ~TR_DEFERRED;
03594 
03595    /* check for valid transition */
03596    if (transition != TR_START && transition != TR_STOP &&
03597       transition != TR_PAUSE && transition != TR_RESUME) {

03881          if (perror != NULL)
03882             memcpy(perror, error, (INT) strlen(error) + 1 < strsize ?
03883                      strlen(error) + 1 : strsize);
03884

03886             free(tr_client);
03887             return status;

03890       } else {

03895                tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);

03900

03903                                      tr_client[index].client_name, &hConn);
03904          if (status != RPC_SUCCESS) {
03905             cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "cannot connect to client \"%s\" on host %s, port %d",

03907                      tr_client[index].port);

03909          }
03910 
03911          if (debug_flag == 1)
03912             printf("Connection established to client \"%s\" on host %s\n", 
03913               tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03914          if (debug_flag == 2)
03915             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03916                "cm_transition: Connection established to client \"%s\" on host %s", 
03917                 tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03918 
03919          /* call RC_TRANSITION on remote client with increased timeout */
03920          old_timeout = rpc_get_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT);
03921          rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT, 120000);
03922 
03923          /* set FTPC protocol if in async mode */
03924          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
03925             rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
03926 
03927          if (debug_flag== 1)
03928             printf("Executing RPC transition client \"%s\" on host %s...\n",

03932                "cm_transition: Executing RPC transition client \"%s\" on host %s...", 
03933                  tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03934 
03935          status = rpc_client_call(hConn, RPC_RC_TRANSITION, transition,
03936             run_number, error, strsize, tr_client[index].sequence_number);
03937 
03938          /* reset timeout */
03939          rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTIMEOUT, old_timeout);
03940 
03941          /* reset protocol */
03942          if (async_flag == ASYNC)
03943             rpc_set_option(hConn, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
03944 
03945          if (debug_flag == 1)
03946             printf("RPC transition finished client \"%s\" on host %s\n", 
03947               tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);

03949             cm_msg(MDEBUG, "cm_transition", 
03950                "cm_transition: RPC transition finished client \"%s\" on host %s", 
03951                  tr_client[index].client_name, tr_client[index].host_name);
03952 
03953          if (perror != NULL)
03954             memcpy(perror, error, (INT) strlen(error) + 1 < strsize ?
03955                      strlen(error) + 1 : strsize);
03956 
03957          if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
03958             free(tr_client);
03959             return status;
03960          }
03961       }
03962    }
03963

03965       free(tr_client);
