03991 
03992    /* send notification message */
03993    str[0] = 0;
03994    if (transition == TR_START)
03995       sprintf(str, "Run #%d started", run_number);
03996    if (transition == TR_STOP)
03997       sprintf(str, "Run #%d stopped", run_number);
03998    if (transition == TR_PAUSE)
03999       sprintf(str, "Run #%d paused", run_number);
04000    if (transition == TR_RESUME)
04001       sprintf(str, "Run #%d resumed", run_number);
04002 
04003    if (str[0])
04004       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_transition", str);
04005 
04006    /* lock/unlock ODB values if present */
04007    db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Lock when running", &hKey);
04008    if (hKey && transition == TR_START)
04009       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ, TRUE);
04010    if (hKey && transition == TR_STOP)
04011       db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE, TRUE);
04012 
04013    /* flush online database */
04014    if (transition == TR_STOP)
04015       db_flush_database(hDB);
04016 
04017    /* execute/stop programs on stop */
04018    if (transition == TR_STOP) {
04019       str[0] = 0;
04020       size = sizeof(str);
04021       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Programs/Execute on stop run", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
04022       if (str[0])
04023          ss_system(str);
04024 
04025       db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Programs", &hRootKey);
04026       if (hRootKey) {
04027          for (i = 0;; i++) {
04028             status = db_enum_key(hDB, hRootKey, i, &hKey);
04029             if (status == DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS)
04030                break;
04031 
04032             db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
04033 
04034             /* don't check "execute on xxx" */
04035             if (key.type != TID_KEY)
04036                continue;
04037 
04038             size = sizeof(program_info);
04039             status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, &program_info, &size, 0);
04040             if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
04041                cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_transition", "Cannot get program info record");
04042                continue;
04043             }
04044 
04045             if (program_info.auto_stop)
04046                cm_shutdown(key.name, FALSE);
04047          }
04048       }
04049    }
04050 
04051    /* send notification */
04052    if (transition == TR_START) {
04053       int sock, size;
04054       struct sockaddr_in addr;
04055       char buffer[512], str[256];
04056 
04057       sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
04058       memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(addr));
04059       addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
04060       addr.sin_port = htons((short) MIDAS_TCP_PORT);
04061       addr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(2172773399u);
04062 
04063       str[0] = 0;
04064       size = sizeof(str);
04065       db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Experiment/Name", str, &size, TID_STRING, TRUE);
04066       sprintf(buffer, "%s %s %d", str, cm_get_version(), run_number);
04067       sendto(sock, buffer, strlen(buffer), 0, (struct sockaddr *) &addr, sizeof(addr));
04068       closesocket(sock);
04069    }
04070 
04071    return CM_SUCCESS;
04072 }

void EXPRT cm_watchdog ( int  dummy  ) 

Called at periodic intervals, checks if all clients are alive. If one process died, its client entries are cleaned up.

Parameters:
dummy unused!

Definition at line 4756 of file midas.c.

References _buffer_entries, _database_entries, _watchdog_last_called, KEY::access_mode, OPEN_RECORD::access_mode, actual_time, bm_lock_buffer(), bm_unlock_buffer(), BUFFER::buffer_header, DATABASE_HEADER::client, BUFFER_HEADER::client, DATABASE::client_index, BUFFER::client_index, cm_delete_client_info(), cm_msg, CM_SUCCESS, cm_watchdog(), DATABASE::database_header, db_lock_database(), db_set_mode(), db_unlock_database(), FALSE, OPEN_RECORD::handle, i, interval, j, k, DATABASE_CLIENT::last_activity, BUFFER_CLIENT::last_activity, DATABASE_HEADER::max_client_index, BUFFER_HEADER::max_client_index, MAX_CLIENTS, DATABASE_CLIENT::max_index, MERROR, MINFO, MODE_EXCLUSIVE, MODE_WRITE, DATABASE_HEADER::name, DATABASE_CLIENT::name, BUFFER_HEADER::name, BUFFER_CLIENT::name, KEY::notify_count, DATABASE_HEADER::num_clients, BUFFER_HEADER::num_clients, DATABASE_CLIENT::open_record, DATABASE_CLIENT::pid, BUFFER_CLIENT::pid, BUFFER_CLIENT::port, BUFFER_CLIENT::read_wait, ss_alarm(), ss_millitime(), ss_resume(), ss_set_async_flag(), status, DATABASE_CLIENT::tid, TRUE, WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, DATABASE_CLIENT::watchdog_timeout, BUFFER_CLIENT::watchdog_timeout, and BUFFER_CLIENT::write_wait.

04760    DATABASE_HEADER *pdbheader;
04761    DATABASE_CLIENT *pdbclient;
04762    KEY *pkey;
04763    DWORD actual_time, interval;
04764    INT client_pid;
04765    INT i, j, k, nc, status;
04766    BOOL bDeleted, time_changed, wrong_interval;
04767    char str[256];
04768 
04769    /* return immediately if watchdog has been disabled in meantime */
04770    if (!_call_watchdog)
04771       return;
04772 
04773    /* tell system services that we are in async mode ... */
04774    ss_set_async_flag(TRUE);
04775 
04776    /* Calculate the time since last watchdog call. Kill clients if they
04777       are inactive for more than the timeout they specified */
04778    actual_time = ss_millitime();
04779    if (_watchdog_last_called == 0)
04780       _watchdog_last_called = actual_time - WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
04781    interval = actual_time - _watchdog_last_called;
04782 
04783    /* check if system time has been changed more than 10 min */
04784    time_changed = interval < 0 || interval > 600000;
04785    wrong_interval = interval < 0.8 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL
04786        || interval > 1.2 * WATCHDOG_INTERVAL;
04787 
04788    if (time_changed)
04789       cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog",
04790              "System time has been changed! last:%dms  now:%dms  delta:%dms",
04791              _watchdog_last_called, actual_time, interval);
04792 
04793    /* check buffers */
04794    for (i = 0; i < _buffer_entries; i++)
04795       if (_buffer[i].attached) {
04796          /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
04797          pheader = _buffer[i].buffer_header;
04798          pbclient = pheader->client;
04799          pbclient[_buffer[i].client_index].last_activity = actual_time;
04800 
04801          /* don't check other clients if interval is stange */
04802          if (wrong_interval)
04803             continue;
04804 
04805          /* now check other clients */
04806          for (j = 0; j < pheader->max_client_index; j++, pbclient++)
04807             /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
04808             if (pbclient->pid && pbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
04809                 actual_time - pbclient->last_activity > pbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04810                bm_lock_buffer(i + 1);
04811                str[0] = 0;
04812 
04813                /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
04814                actual_time = ss_millitime();
04815                if (pbclient->pid && pbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
04816                    actual_time > pbclient->last_activity &&
04817                    actual_time - pbclient->last_activity > pbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04818                   sprintf(str, "Client %s on %s removed (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
04819                           pbclient->name, pheader->name,
04820                           (actual_time - pbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
04821                           pbclient->watchdog_timeout / 1000.0);
04822 
04823                   /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
04824                   memset(&(pheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(BUFFER_CLIENT));
04825 
04826                   /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
04827                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
04828                      if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04829                         break;
04830                   pheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
04831 
04832                   /* count new number of clients */
04833                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
04834                      if (pheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04835                         nc++;
04836                   pheader->num_clients = nc;
04837 
04838                   /* check if anyone is wating and wake him up */
04839                   pbctmp = pheader->client;
04840 
04841                   for (k = 0; k < pheader->max_client_index; k++, pbctmp++)
04842                      if (pbctmp->pid && (pbctmp->write_wait || pbctmp->read_wait))
04843                         ss_resume(pbctmp->port, "B  ");
04844 
04845                }
04846 
04847                bm_unlock_buffer(i + 1);
04848 
04849                /* display info message after unlocking buffer */
04850                if (str[0])
04851                   cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog", str);
04852             }
04853       }
04854 
04855    /* check online databases */
04856    for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
04857       if (_database[i].attached) {
04858          /* update the last_activity entry to show that we are alive */
04859          pdbheader = _database[i].database_header;
04860          pdbclient = pdbheader->client;
04861          pdbclient[_database[i].client_index].last_activity = actual_time;
04862 
04863          /* don't check other clients if interval is stange */
04864          if (wrong_interval)
04865             continue;
04866 
04867          /* now check other clients */
04868          for (j = 0; j < pdbheader->max_client_index; j++, pdbclient++)
04869             /* If client process has no activity, clear its buffer entry. */
04870             if (pdbclient->pid && pdbclient->watchdog_timeout > 0 &&
04871                 actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity > pdbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04872                client_pid = pdbclient->tid;
04873                bDeleted = FALSE;
04874                db_lock_database(i + 1);
04875                str[0] = 0;
04876 
04877                /* now make again the check with the buffer locked */
04878                actual_time = ss_millitime();
04879                if (pdbclient->pid && pdbclient->watchdog_timeout &&
04880                    actual_time > pdbclient->last_activity &&
04881                    actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity > pdbclient->watchdog_timeout) {
04882                   sprintf(str,
04883                           "Client %s (PID %d) on %s removed (idle %1.1lfs,TO %1.0lfs)",
04884                           pdbclient->name, client_pid, pdbheader->name,
04885                           (actual_time - pdbclient->last_activity) / 1000.0,
04886                           pdbclient->watchdog_timeout / 1000.0);
04887 
04888                   /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
04889                   for (k = 0; k < pdbclient->max_index; k++)
04890                      if (pdbclient->open_record[k].handle) {
04891                         pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pdbheader +
04892                                         pdbclient->open_record[k].handle);
04893                         if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
04894                            pkey->notify_count--;
04895 
04896                         if (pdbclient->open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
04897                            db_set_mode(i + 1, pdbclient->open_record[k].handle,
04898                                        (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
04899                      }
04900 
04901                   /* clear entry from client structure in buffer header */
04902                   memset(&(pdbheader->client[j]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
04903 
04904                   /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
04905                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; k >= 0; k--)
04906                      if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04907                         break;
04908                   pdbheader->max_client_index = k + 1;
04909 
04910                   /* count new number of clients */
04911                   for (k = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, nc = 0; k >= 0; k--)
04912                      if (pdbheader->client[k].pid != 0)
04913                         nc++;
04914                   pdbheader->num_clients = nc;
04915                   bDeleted = TRUE;
04916                }
04917 
04918                /* delete client entry before unlocking db */
04919                if (bDeleted) {
04920                   status = cm_delete_client_info(i + 1, client_pid);
04921                   if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
04922                      cm_msg(MERROR, "cm_watchdog", "cannot delete client info");
04923                }
04924 
04925                db_unlock_database(i + 1);
04926 
04927                /* display info message after unlocking db */
04928                if (str[0])
04929                   cm_msg(MINFO, "cm_watchdog", str);
04930             }
04931       }
04932 
04933    _watchdog_last_called = actual_time;
04934 
04935    ss_set_async_flag(FALSE);
04936 
04937    /* Schedule next watchdog call */
04938    if (_call_watchdog)
04939       ss_alarm(WATCHDOG_INTERVAL, cm_watchdog);
04940 }

INT EXPRT cm_yield ( INT  millisec  ) 

dox Central yield functions for clients. This routine should be called in an infinite loop by a client in order to give the MIDAS system the opportunity to receive commands over RPC channels, update database records and receive events.

Parameters:
millisec Timeout in millisec. If no message is received during the specified timeout, the routine returns. If millisec=-1, it only returns when receiving an RPC_SHUTDOWN message.
Returns:
CM_SUCCESS, RPC_SHUTDOWN

Definition at line 4166 of file midas.c.

References al_check(), bm_check_buffers(), bm_mark_read_waiting(), bm_poll_event(), FALSE, rpc_is_remote(), RPC_SHUTDOWN, ss_suspend(), ss_time(), status, and TRUE.

Referenced by analyze_run(), caen170a_get_all(), caen170a_set_all(), check_abort(), cmd_idle(), command_loop(), dl40x_read(), lazy_copy(), load_parameters(), loop_online(), lrs1454_get(), lrs4032_get_all(), lrs4032_set(), lrs4032_set_all(), main(), poll_event(), rpc_master_poll_dead(), rpc_master_poll_live(), rpc_slave_poll_live(), scan_fragment(), scheduler(), server_loop(), source_scan(), TimerProc(), tr_poststop(), and tr_stop().

04167 {
04168    INT status;
04169    BOOL bMore;
04170    static DWORD last_checked = 0;
04171 
04172    /* check for ctrl-c */
04173    if (_ctrlc_pressed)
04174       return RPC_SHUTDOWN;
04175 
04176    /* check for available events */
04177    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
04178       bMore = bm_poll_event(TRUE);
04179       if (bMore)
04180          status = ss_suspend(0, 0);
04181       else
04182          status = ss_suspend(millisec, 0);
04183 
04184       return status;
04185    }
04186 
04187    /* check alarms once every 10 seconds */
04188    if (!rpc_is_remote() && ss_time() - last_checked > 10) {
04189       al_check();
04190       last_checked = ss_time();
04191    }
04192 
04193    bMore = bm_check_buffers();
04194 
04195    if (bMore) {
04196       /* if events available, quickly check other IPC channels */
04197       status = ss_suspend(0, 0);
04198    } else {
04199       /* mark event buffers for ready-to-receive */
04200       bm_mark_read_waiting(TRUE);
04201 
04202       status = ss_suspend(millisec, 0);
04203 
04204       /* unmark event buffers for ready-to-receive */
04205       bm_mark_read_waiting(FALSE);
04206    }
04207 
04208    return status;
04209 }

06980          return DB_SUCCESS;
06981       }

06991          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
06992       }
06993

06999

07002 
07003       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
07004       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
07005          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07006          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
07007       }
07008 
07009       pkey->notify_count++;
07010 
07011       pclient->num_open_records++;
07012 
07013       /* set exclusive bit if requested */
07014       if (access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
07015          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (pkey->access_mode | MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
07016 
07017       db_unlock_database(hDB);
07018    }
07019 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07020 
07021    return DB_SUCCESS;
07022 }

INT EXPRT db_check_record ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  keyname,
char *  rec_str,
BOOL  correct 
)

This function ensures that a certain ODB subtree matches a given C structure, by comparing the init_str with the current ODB structure. If the record does not exist at all, it is created with the default values in init_str. If it does exist but does not match the variables in init_str, the function returns an error if correct=FALSE or calls db_create_record() if correct=TRUE.

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
keyname Name of key to search, can contain directories.
rec_str ASCII representation of ODB record in the format
correct If TRUE, correct ODB record if necessary
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_KEY, DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH

Definition at line 7436 of file odb.c.

References cm_msg, db_create_record(), db_find_key(), db_get_key(), db_get_next_link(), DB_NO_KEY, DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH, DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, equal_ustring(), FALSE, i, j, key, MAX_STRING_LENGTH, MERROR, KEY::name, KEY::num_values, PTYPE, rpc_call(), RPC_DB_CHECK_RECORD, rpc_is_remote(), status, TID_KEY, TID_LAST, TID_LINK, tid_name, TID_STRING, title, TRUE, and KEY::type.

Referenced by al_check(), al_trigger_alarm(), cm_connect_experiment1(), dt5720_init(), init_module_parameters(), main(), mana_init(), register_equipment(), register_requests(), rpc_server_dispatch(), show_status_page(), tr_start(), and v1724_init().

07437 {
07438    char line[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
07439    char title[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
07440    char key_name[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
07441    char info_str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH + 50];
07442    char *pc, *pold, *rec_str_orig;
07443    DWORD tid;
07444    INT i, j, n_data, string_length, status;
07445    HNDLE hKeyRoot, hKeyTest;
07446    KEY key;
07447    BOOL multi_line;
07448 
07449    if (rpc_is_remote())
07450       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CHECK_RECORD, hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str, correct);
07451 
07452    /* check if record exists */
07453    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, keyname, &hKeyRoot);
07454 
07455    /* create record if not */
07456    if (status == DB_NO_KEY)
07457       return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str);
07458 
07459    assert(hKeyRoot);
07460 
07461    title[0] = 0;
07462    multi_line = FALSE;
07463    rec_str_orig = rec_str;
07464 
07465    db_get_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, &key);
07466    if (key.type == TID_KEY)
07467       /* get next subkey which is not of type TID_KEY */
07468       db_get_next_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, &hKeyTest);
07469    else
07470       /* test root key itself */
07471       hKeyTest = hKeyRoot;
07472 
07473    if (hKeyTest == 0 && *rec_str != 0) {
07474       if (correct)
07475          return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
07476 
07477       return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
07478    }
07479 
07480    do {
07481       if (*rec_str == 0)
07482          break;
07483 
07484       for (i = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str && i < MAX_STRING_LENGTH; i++)
07485          line[i] = *rec_str++;
07486 
07487       if (i == MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
07488          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record", "line too long");
07489          return DB_TRUNCATED;
07490       }
07491 
07492       line[i] = 0;
07493       if (*rec_str == '\n')
07494          rec_str++;
07495 
07496       /* check if it is a section title */
07497       if (line[0] == '[') {
07498          /* extract title and append '/' */
07499          strcpy(title, line + 1);
07500          if (strchr(title, ']'))
07501             *strchr(title, ']') = 0;
07502          if (title[0] && title[strlen(title) - 1] != '/')
07503             strcat(title, "/");
07504       } else {
07505          /* valid data line if it includes '=' and no ';' */
07506          if (strchr(line, '=') && line[0] != ';') {
07507             /* copy type info and data */
07508             pc = strchr(line, '=') + 1;
07509             while (*pc == ' ')
07510                pc++;
07511             strcpy(info_str, pc);
07512 
07513             /* extract key name */
07514             *strchr(line, '=') = 0;
07515 
07516             pc = &line[strlen(line) - 1];
07517             while (*pc == ' ')
07518                *pc-- = 0;
07519 
07520             key_name[0] = 0;
07521             if (title[0] != '.')
07522                strcpy(key_name, title);
07523 
07524             strcat(key_name, line);
07525 
07526             /* evaluate type info */
07527             strcpy(line, info_str);
07528             if (strchr(line, ' '))
07529                *strchr(line, ' ') = 0;
07530 
07531             n_data = 1;
07532             if (strchr(line, '[')) {
07533                n_data = atol(strchr(line, '[') + 1);
07534                *strchr(line, '[') = 0;
07535             }
07536 
07537             for (tid = 0; tid < TID_LAST; tid++)
07538                if (strcmp(tid_name[tid], line) == 0)
07539                   break;
07540 
07541             string_length = 0;
07542 
07543             if (tid == TID_LAST)
07544                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record",
07545                       "found unknown data type \"%s\" in ODB file", line);
07546             else {
07547                /* skip type info */
07548                pc = info_str;
07549                while (*pc != ' ' && *pc)
07550                   pc++;
07551                while ((*pc == ' ' || *pc == ':') && *pc)
07552                   pc++;
07553 
07554                if (n_data > 1) {
07555                   info_str[0] = 0;
07556                   if (!*rec_str)
07557                      break;
07558 
07559                   for (j = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str; j++)
07560                      info_str[j] = *rec_str++;
07561                   info_str[j] = 0;
07562                   if (*rec_str == '\n')
07563                      rec_str++;
07564                }
07565 
07566                for (i = 0; i < n_data; i++) {
07567                   /* strip trailing \n */
07568                   pc = &info_str[strlen(info_str) - 1];
07569                   while (*pc == '\n' || *pc == '\r')
07570                      *pc-- = 0;
07571 
07572                   if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK) {
07573                      if (!string_length) {
07574                         if (info_str[1] == '=')
07575                            string_length = -1;
07576                         else
07577                            string_length = atoi(info_str + 1);
07578                         if (string_length > MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
07579                            string_length = MAX_STRING_LENGTH;
07580                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record",
07581                                   "found string exceeding MAX_STRING_LENGTH");
07582                         }
07583                      }
07584 
07585                      if (string_length == -1) {
07586                         /* multi-line string */
07587                         if (strstr(rec_str, "\n====#$@$#====\n") != NULL) {
07588                            string_length =
07589                                (PTYPE) strstr(rec_str,
07590                                               "\n====#$@$#====\n") - (PTYPE) rec_str + 1;
07591 
07592                            rec_str =
07593                                strstr(rec_str,
07594                                       "\n====#$@$#====\n") + strlen("\n====#$@$#====\n");
07595                         } else
07596                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_check_record",
07597                                   "found multi-line string without termination sequence");
07598                      } else {
07599                         pc = info_str + 2;
07600                         while (*pc && *pc != ' ')
07601                            pc++;
07602                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
07603                            pc++;
07604 
07605                         /* limit string size */
07606                         *(pc + string_length - 1) = 0;
07607                      }
07608                   } else {
07609                      pc = info_str;
07610 
07611                      if (n_data > 1 && info_str[0] == '[') {
07612                         pc = strchr(info_str, ']') + 1;
07613                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
07614                            pc++;
07615                      }
07616                   }
07617 
07618                   if (i < n_data - 1) {
07619                      info_str[0] = 0;
07620                      if (!*rec_str)
07621                         break;
07622 
07623                      pold = rec_str;
07624 
07625                      for (j = 0; *rec_str != '\n' && *rec_str; j++)
07626                         info_str[j] = *rec_str++;
07627                      info_str[j] = 0;
07628                      if (*rec_str == '\n')
07629                         rec_str++;
07630 
07631                      /* test if valid data */
07632                      if (tid != TID_STRING && tid != TID_LINK) {
07633                         if (info_str[0] == 0 || (strchr(info_str, '=')
07634                                                  && strchr(info_str, ':')))
07635                            rec_str = pold;
07636                      }
07637                   }
07638                }
07639 
07640                /* if rec_str contains key, but not ODB, return mismatch */
07641                if (!hKeyTest) {
07642                   if (correct)
07643                      return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
07644 
07645                   return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
07646                }
07647 
07648                status = db_get_key(hDB, hKeyTest, &key);
07649                assert(status == DB_SUCCESS);
07650 
07651                /* check rec_str vs. ODB key */
07652                if (!equal_ustring(key.name, key_name) ||
07653                    key.type != tid || key.num_values != n_data) {
07654                   if (correct)
07655                      return db_create_record(hDB, hKey, keyname, rec_str_orig);
07656 
07657                   return DB_STRUCT_MISMATCH;
07658                }
07659 
07660                /* get next key in ODB */
07661                db_get_next_link(hDB, hKeyTest, &hKeyTest);
07662             }
07663          }
07664       }
07665    } while (TRUE);
07666 
07667    return DB_SUCCESS;
07668 }

INT EXPRT db_close_all_databases ( void   )

Close a database

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().

DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, RPC_NET_ERROR

01306 {
01307    if (rpc_is_remote())
01308       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CLOSE_DATABASE, hDB);
01309 
01310 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01311    else {
01312       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01313       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01314       INT index, destroy_flag, i, j;
01315 
01316       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01317          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_close_database", "invalid database handle");
01318          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01319       }
01320 
01321       /*
01322          Check if database was opened by current thread. This is necessary
01323          in the server process where one thread may not close the database
01324          of other threads.
01325        */
01326 
01327       /* first lock database */
01328       db_lock_database(hDB);
01329 
01330       index = _database[hDB - 1].client_index;
01331       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01332       pclient = &pheader->client[index];
01333 
01334       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE &&
01335           _database[hDB - 1].index != rpc_get_server_acception()) {
01336          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01337          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01338       }
01339 
01340       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_SINGLE &&
01341           _database[hDB - 1].index != ss_gettid()) {
01342          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01343          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01344       }
01345 
01346       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {

01348          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01349          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01350       }
01351

01361       memset(&(pheader->client[index]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01362 
01363       /* calculate new max_client_index entry */
01364       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1; i >= 0; i--)
01365          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
01366             break;
01367       pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
01368 
01369       /* count new number of clients */
01370       for (i = MAX_CLIENTS - 1, j = 0; i >= 0; i--)
01371          if (pheader->client[i].pid != 0)
01372             j++;

01374 
01375       destroy_flag = (pheader->num_clients == 0);
01376 
01377       /* flush shared memory to disk */
01378       ss_shm_flush(pheader->name, pheader,
01379                    sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * pheader->data_size);
01380 
01381       /* unmap shared memory, delete it if we are the last */
01382       ss_shm_close(pheader->name, pheader, _database[hDB - 1].shm_handle, destroy_flag);
01383 
01384       /* unlock database */
01385       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01386 
01387       /* delete mutex */
01388       ss_mutex_delete(_database[hDB - 1].mutex, destroy_flag);
01389 
01390       /* update _database_entries */
01391       if (hDB == _database_entries)
01392          _database_entries--;
01393 
01394       if (_database_entries > 0)
01395          _database =
01396              (DATABASE *) realloc(_database, sizeof(DATABASE) * (_database_entries));
01397       else {
01398          free(_database);
01399          _database = NULL;
01400       }

01407             ss_mutex_delete(_mutex_elog, TRUE);

01411 
01412    }
01413 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01414 
01415    return DB_SUCCESS;
01416 }

INT EXPRT db_copy ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  buffer,
INT *  buffer_size,
char *  path 
)

Copy an ODB subtree in ASCII format to a buffer

This function converts the binary ODB contents to an ASCII. The function db_paste() can be used to convert the ASCII representation back to binary ODB contents. The functions db_load() and db_save() internally use db_copy() and db_paste(). This function converts the binary ODB contents to an ASCII representation of the form:

  • For single value: 
    [ODB path]
 key name = type : value
  • For strings: 
    key name = STRING : [size] string contents
  • For arrayes (type can be BYTE, SBYTE, CHAR, WORD, SHORT, DWORD, INT, BOOL, FLOAT, DOUBLE, STRING or LINK): 
    key name = type[size] :
 [0] value0
 [1] value1
 [2] value2
 ...
    Parameters:
    hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
    hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
    buffer ASCII buffer which receives ODB contents.
    buffer_size Size of buffer, returns remaining space in buffer.
    path Internal use only, must be empty ("").
    Returns:
    DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_NO_MEMORY

Definition at line 5218 of file odb.c.

References cm_msg, data, db_copy(), db_enum_link(), db_get_data(), db_get_key(), DB_NO_MEMORY, db_sprintf(), DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, FALSE, hSubkey, i, KEY::item_size, j, key, MAX_ODB_PATH, MAX_STRING_LENGTH, MERROR, KEY::name, KEY::num_values, size, status, TID_KEY, TID_LINK, tid_name, TID_STRING, KEY::total_size, TRUE, and KEY::type.

05313             free(data);

INT EXPRT db_create_key ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  key_name,
DWORD  type 
)

Create a new key in a database

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().

type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see Midas_Data_Types)

01722 {
01723    if (rpc_is_remote())
01724       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_CREATE_KEY, hDB, hKey, key_name, type);
01725 
01726 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01727    {
01728       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01729       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
01730       KEY *pkey, *pprev_key, *pkeyparent;
01731       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
01732       INT i;
01733 
01734       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
01735          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid database handle");
01736          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01737       }
01738 
01739       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
01740          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid database handle");
01741          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01742       }
01743 
01744       /* check type */
01745       if (type >= TID_LAST) {
01746          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "invalid key type %d", type);
01747          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
01748       }
01749 
01750       /* lock database */
01751       db_lock_database(hDB);
01752 
01753       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
01754       if (!hKey)
01755          hKey = pheader->root_key;
01756       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
01757 
01758       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
01759       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
01760          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01761          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
01762       }
01763 
01764       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
01765          db_unlock_database(hDB);
01766          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "key has no subkeys");
01767          return DB_NO_KEY;
01768       }
01769       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01770 
01771       pkey_name = key_name;
01772       do {
01773          /* extract single key from key_name */
01774          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
01775          
01776          /* do not allow empty names, like '/dir/dir//dir/' */
01777          if (str[0] == 0) {
01778             db_unlock_database(hDB);
01779             return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
01780          }
01781 
01782          /* check if parent or current directory */
01783          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
01784             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
01785                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
01786                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
01787             }
01788             continue;
01789          }
01790          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
01791             continue;
01792 
01793          /* check if key is in keylist */
01794          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
01795          pprev_key = NULL;
01796 
01797          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
01798             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
01799                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key",
01800                       "Warning: database corruption, key %s, next_key 0x%08X",
01801                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
01802                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01803                return DB_CORRUPTED;
01804             }
01805 
01806             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
01807                break;
01808 
01809             pprev_key = pkey;
01810             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
01811          }
01812 
01813          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
01814             /* not found: create new key */
01815 
01816             /* check parent for write access */
01817             pkeyparent = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
01818             if (!(pkeyparent->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) ||
01819                 (pkeyparent->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
01820                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01821                return DB_NO_ACCESS;
01822             }
01823 
01824             pkeylist->num_keys++;
01825 
01826             if (*pkey_name == '/' || type == TID_KEY) {
01827                /* create new key with keylist */
01828                pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
01829 
01830                if (pkey == NULL) {
01831                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01832                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01833                   return DB_FULL;
01834                }
01835 
01836                /* append key to key list */
01837                if (pprev_key)
01838                   pprev_key->next_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01839                else
01840                   pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01841 
01842                /* set key properties */
01843                pkey->type = TID_KEY;
01844                pkey->num_values = 1;
01845                pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
01846                strcpy(pkey->name, str);
01847                pkey->parent_keylist = (PTYPE) pkeylist - (PTYPE) pheader;
01848 
01849                /* find space for new keylist */
01850                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEYLIST));
01851 
01852                if (pkeylist == NULL) {
01853                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01854                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01855                   return DB_FULL;
01856                }
01857 
01858                /* store keylist in data field */
01859                pkey->data = (PTYPE) pkeylist - (PTYPE) pheader;
01860                pkey->item_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01861                pkey->total_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01862 
01863                pkeylist->parent = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01864                pkeylist->num_keys = 0;
01865                pkeylist->first_key = 0;
01866             } else {
01867                /* create new key with data */
01868                pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
01869 
01870                if (pkey == NULL) {
01871                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
01872                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01873                   return DB_FULL;
01874                }
01875 
01876                /* append key to key list */
01877                if (pprev_key)
01878                   pprev_key->next_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01879                else
01880                   pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01881 
01882                pkey->type = type;
01883                pkey->num_values = 1;
01884                pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
01885                strcpy(pkey->name, str);
01886                pkey->parent_keylist = (PTYPE) pkeylist - (PTYPE) pheader;
01887 
01888                /* zero data */
01889                if (type != TID_STRING && type != TID_LINK) {
01890                   pkey->item_size = rpc_tid_size(type);
01891                   pkey->data = (PTYPE) malloc_data(pheader, pkey->item_size);
01892                   pkey->total_size = pkey->item_size;
01893 
01894                   if (pkey->data == 0) {
01895                      db_unlock_database(hDB);
01896                      cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "online database full");
01897                      return DB_FULL;
01898                   }
01899 
01900                   pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
01901                } else {
01902                   /* first data is empty */
01903                   pkey->item_size = 0;
01904                   pkey->total_size = 0;
01905                   pkey->data = 0;
01906                }
01907             }
01908          } else {
01909             /* key found: descend */
01910 
01911             /* resolve links */
01912             if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && pkey_name[0]) {
01913                /* copy destination, strip '/' */
01914                strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01915                if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
01916                   str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
01917 
01918                /* append rest of key name */
01919                strcat(str, pkey_name);
01920 
01921                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01922 
01923                return db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, type);
01924             }
01925 
01926             if (!(*pkey_name == '/')) {
01927                if ((WORD) pkey->type != type)
01928                   cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "redefinition of key type mismatch");
01929 
01930                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01931                return DB_KEY_EXIST;
01932             }
01933 
01934             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
01935                db_unlock_database(hDB);
01936                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_key", "key used with value and as parent key");
01937                return DB_KEY_EXIST;
01938             }
01939 
01940             pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
01941          }
01942       } while (*pkey_name == '/');
01943 
01944       db_unlock_database(hDB);
01945    }
01946 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01947 
01948    return DB_SUCCESS;
01949 }

INT EXPRT db_create_link ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  link_name,
char *  destination 
)

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Key handle to start with, 0 for root
link_name Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
destination Destination of link in the form "/key/key/key"
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_FULL, DB_KEY_EXIST, DB_NO_ACCESS

INT EXPRT db_create_record ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  orig_key_name,
char *  init_str 
)

dox Create a record. If a part of the record exists alreay, merge it with the init_str (use values from the init_str only when they are not in the existing record).

This functions creates a ODB sub-tree according to an ASCII representation of that tree. See db_copy() for a description. It can be used to create a sub-tree which exactly matches a C structure. The sub-tree can then later mapped to the C structure ("hot-link") via the function db_open_record().

If a sub-tree exists already which exactly matches the ASCII representation, it is not modified. If part of the tree exists, it is merged with the ASCII representation where the ODB values have priority, only values not present in the ODB are created with the default values of the ASCII representation. It is therefore recommended that before creating an ODB hot-link the function db_create_record() is called to insure that the ODB tree and the C structure contain exactly the same values in the same order.

Following example creates a record under /Equipment/Trigger/Settings, opens a hot-link between that record and a local C structure trigger_settings and registers a callback function trigger_update() which gets called each time the record is changed. 

struct {
  INT level1;
  INT level2;
} trigger_settings;
char *trigger_settings_str =
"[Settings]\n\
level1 = INT : 0\n\
level2 = INT : 0";
void trigger_update(INT hDB, INT hkey, void *info)
{
  printf("New levels: %d %d\n",
    trigger_settings.level1,
    trigger_settings.level2);
}
main()
{
  HNDLE hDB, hkey;
  char[128] info;
  ...
  cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
  db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger", trigger_settings_str);
  db_find_key(hDB, 0,"/Equipment/Trigger/Settings", &hkey);
  db_open_record(hDB, hkey, &trigger_settings,
    sizeof(trigger_settings), MODE_READ, trigger_update, info);
  ...
}
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
orig_key_name Name of key to search, can contain directories.
init_str Initialization string in the format of the db_copy/db_save functions.
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_FULL, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_OPEN_RECORD

Definition at line 7266 of file odb.c.

References buffer, buffer_size, check_open_keys(), cm_msg, db_copy(), db_create_key(), db_delete_key(), db_enum_link(), db_find_key(), db_lock_database(), DB_NO_KEY, DB_OPEN_RECORD, db_paste(), db_scan_tree_link(), DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, db_unlock_database(), FALSE, hSubkey, i, merge_records(), MERROR, rpc_call(), RPC_DB_CREATE_RECORD, rpc_is_remote(), size, ss_gettid(), status, strlcpy(), and TID_KEY.

07274 
07275    /* make this function atomic */
07276    db_lock_database(hDB);
07277

07280    if (strlen(key_name) > 1 && key_name[strlen(key_name) - 1] == '/')
07281       key_name[strlen(key_name) - 1] = 0;
07282 
07283    /* merge temporay record and original record */
07284    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, &hKeyOrig);
07285    if (status == DB_SUCCESS) {
07286       assert(hKeyOrig != 0);
07287       /* check if key or subkey is opened */
07288       open_count = 0;
07289       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKeyOrig, 0, check_open_keys, NULL);
07290       if (open_count) {
07291          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07292          return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
07293       }
07294 
07295       /* create temporary records */
07296       sprintf(str, "/System/Tmp/%1dI", ss_gettid());
07297       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmp);
07298       if (hKeyTmp)
07299          db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmp, FALSE);
07300       db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
07301       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmp);
07302       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07303          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07304          return status;
07305       }
07306 
07307       sprintf(str, "/System/Tmp/%1dO", ss_gettid());
07308       db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmpO);
07309       if (hKeyTmpO)
07310          db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmpO, FALSE);
07311       db_create_key(hDB, 0, str, TID_KEY);
07312       status = db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, &hKeyTmpO);
07313       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07314          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07315          return status;
07316       }
07317 
07318       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmp, init_str);
07319       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07320          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07321          return status;
07322       }
07323 
07324       buffer_size = 10000;
07325       buffer = (char *) malloc(buffer_size);
07326       do {
07327          size = buffer_size;
07328          status = db_copy(hDB, hKeyOrig, buffer, &size, "");
07329          if (status == DB_TRUNCATED) {
07330             buffer_size += 10000;
07331             buffer = (char *) realloc(buffer, buffer_size);
07332             continue;
07333          }
07334          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07335             db_unlock_database(hDB);
07336             return status;
07337          }
07338 
07339       } while (status != DB_SUCCESS);
07340 
07341       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmpO, buffer);
07342       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07343          free(buffer);
07344          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07345          return status;
07346       }
07347 
07348       /* merge temporay record and original record */
07349       db_scan_tree_link(hDB, hKeyTmpO, 0, merge_records, NULL);
07350 
07351       /* delete original record */
07352       for (i = 0;; i++) {
07353          db_enum_link(hDB, hKeyOrig, 0, &hSubkey);
07354          if (!hSubkey)
07355             break;
07356 
07357          status = db_delete_key(hDB, hSubkey, FALSE);
07358          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07359             free(buffer);
07360             db_unlock_database(hDB);
07361             return status;
07362          }
07363       }
07364 
07365       /* copy merged record to original record */
07366       do {
07367          size = buffer_size;
07368          status = db_copy(hDB, hKeyTmp, buffer, &size, "");
07369          if (status == DB_TRUNCATED) {
07370             buffer_size += 10000;
07371             buffer = (char *) realloc(buffer, buffer_size);
07372             continue;
07373          }
07374          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07375             free(buffer);
07376             db_unlock_database(hDB);
07377             return status;
07378          }
07379 
07380       } while (status != DB_SUCCESS);
07381 
07382       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyOrig, buffer);
07383       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07384          free(buffer);
07385          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07386          return status;
07387       }
07388 
07389       /* delete temporary records */
07390       db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmp, FALSE);
07391       db_delete_key(hDB, hKeyTmpO, FALSE);
07392 
07393       free(buffer);
07394    } else if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
07395       /* create fresh record */
07396       db_create_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, TID_KEY);
07397       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKey, key_name, &hKeyTmp);
07398       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07399          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07400          return status;
07401       }
07402 
07403       status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyTmp, init_str);
07404       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07405          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07406          return status;
07407       }
07408    } else {
07409       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_create_record",
07410              "aborting on unexpected failure of db_find_key(%s), status %d",
07411              key_name, status);
07412       abort();
07413    }
07414 
07415    db_unlock_database(hDB);
07416 
07417    return DB_SUCCESS;
07418 }

INT EXPRT db_enum_key ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
INT  index,
HNDLE *  subkey_handle 
)

Enumerate subkeys from a key, follow links.

hkey must correspond to a valid ODB directory. The index is usually incremented in a loop until the last key is reached. Information about the sub-keys can be obtained with db_get_key(). If a returned key is of type TID_KEY, it contains itself sub-keys. To scan a whole ODB sub-tree, the function db_scan_tree() can be used. 

INT   i;
HNDLE hkey, hsubkey;
KEY   key;
  db_find_key(hdb, 0, "/Runinfo", &hkey);
  for (i=0 ; ; i++)
  {
   db_enum_key(hdb, hkey, i, &hsubkey);
   if (!hSubkey)
    break; // end of list reached
   // print key name
   db_get_key(hdb, hkey, &key);
   printf("%s\n", key.name);
  }
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
index Subkey index, sould be initially 0, then incremented in each call until subhKey becomes zero and the function returns DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS
subkey_handle Handle of subkey which can be used in db_get_key() and db_get_data()
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS

Definition at line 3390 of file odb.c.

References _database_entries, cm_msg, KEY::data, DATABASE::database_header, db_find_key(), DB_INVALID_HANDLE, db_lock_database(), DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS, DB_SUCCESS, db_unlock_database(), db_validate_hkey(), KEYLIST::first_key, i, MERROR, KEY::next_key, KEYLIST::num_keys, KEYLIST::parent, KEY::parent_keylist, PTYPE, DATABASE_HEADER::root_key, rpc_call(), RPC_DB_ENUM_KEY, rpc_is_remote(), TID_KEY, TID_LINK, and KEY::type.

Referenced by al_check(), ascii_write(), book_ntuples(), build_done_list(), cam_init_rpc(), close_history(), cm_connect_client(), cm_exist(), cm_set_client_info(), cm_shutdown(), cm_transition(), command_loop(), compose_status(), create_experim_h(), db_get_event_definition(), db_save_tree_struct(), db_save_xml_key(), db_scan_tree(), dump_write(), exec_script(), feodb_file_dump(), gen_odb_attachment(), generate_hist_graph(), interprete(), lazy_remove_entry(), load_fragment(), log_callback(), log_system_history(), logger_root(), main(), mchart_compose(), mchart_get_names(), odb_load(), open_history(), rpc_server_dispatch(), show_cnaf_page(), show_delete_page(), show_hist_config_page(), show_odb_page(), show_programs_page(), show_sc_page(), show_start_page(), show_status_page(), tr_start(), tr_start1(), update_odb(), write_event_ascii(), write_event_hbook(), and write_event_odb().

03393       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_ENUM_KEY, hDB, hKey, index, subkey_handle);
03394 
03395 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03396    {
03397       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03398       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03399       KEY *pkey;
03400       INT i;
03401       char str[256];
03402       HNDLE parent;
03403 
03404       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03405          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_key", "invalid database handle");
03406          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03407       }
03408 
03409       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03410          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_key", "invalid database handle");
03411          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03412       }
03413 
03414       *subkey_handle = 0;
03415 
03416       /* first lock database */
03417       db_lock_database(hDB);
03418 
03419       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03420       if (!hKey)
03421          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03422       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03423 
03424       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03425       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03426          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03427          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03428       }
03429 
03430       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03431          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03432          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03433       }
03434       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03435 
03436       if (index >= pkeylist->num_keys) {
03437          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03438          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03439       }
03440 
03441       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03442       for (i = 0; i < index; i++)
03443          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03444 
03445       /* resolve links */
03446       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
03447          strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03448 
03449          if (*str == '/') {
03450             /* absolute path */
03451             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03452             return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subkey_handle);
03453          } else {
03454             /* relative path */
03455             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
03456                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
03457                parent = pkeylist->parent;
03458                db_unlock_database(hDB);
03459                return db_find_key(hDB, parent, str, subkey_handle);
03460             } else {
03461                db_unlock_database(hDB);
03462                return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subkey_handle);
03463             }
03464          }
03465       }
03466 
03467       *subkey_handle = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
03468       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03469    }
03470 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03471 
03472    return DB_SUCCESS;
03473 }

INT EXPRT db_enum_link ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
INT  index,
HNDLE *  subkey_handle 
)

03483          : db_enum_link
03484 
03485   Purpose: Enumerate subkeys from a key, don't follow links

03498                             db_get_key and db_get_data
03499 
03500   Function value:
03501     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03502     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
03503     DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS      Last subkey reached
03504 
03505 \********************************************************************/
03506 {
03507    if (rpc_is_remote())
03508       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_ENUM_LINK, hDB, hKey, index, subkey_handle);
03509 
03510 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03511    {
03512       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03513       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03514       KEY *pkey;
03515       INT i;
03516 
03517       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03518          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03519          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03520       }
03521 
03522       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03523          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03524          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03525       }
03526 
03527       *subkey_handle = 0;
03528 
03529       /* first lock database */
03530       db_lock_database(hDB);
03531 
03532       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03533       if (!hKey)
03534          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03535       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03536 
03537       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03538       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03539          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03540          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03541       }
03542 
03543       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03544          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03545          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03546       }
03547       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03548 
03549       if (index >= pkeylist->num_keys) {
03550          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03551          return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03552       }
03553 
03554       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03555       for (i = 0; i < index; i++)
03556          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03557 
03558       *subkey_handle = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
03559       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03560    }
03561 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03562 
03563    return DB_SUCCESS;
03564 }

INT EXPRT db_find_key ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  key_name,
HNDLE *  subhKey 
)

Returns key handle for a key with a specific name.

Keys can be accessed by their name including the directory or by a handle. A key handle is an internal offset to the shared memory where the ODB lives and allows a much faster access to a key than via its name.

The function db_find_key() must be used to convert a key name to a handle. Most other database functions use this key handle in various operations. 

HNDLE hkey, hsubkey;
// use full name, start from root
db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &hkey);
// start from subdirectory
db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo", &hkey);
db_find_key(hdb, hkey, "Run number", &hsubkey);
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
key_name Name of key to search, can contain directories.
subhKey Returned handle of key, zero if key cannot be found.
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_NO_KEY

Definition at line 2193 of file odb.c.

02194 {
02195    if (rpc_is_remote())
02196       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_KEY, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02197 
02198 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02199    {
02200       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02201       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02202       KEY *pkey;
02203       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02204       INT i, status;
02205 
02206       *subhKey = 0;
02207 
02208       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02209          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02210          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02211       }
02212 
02213       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02214          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "invalid database handle");
02215          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02216       }
02217 
02218       db_lock_database(hDB);
02219 
02220       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02221 
02222       if (!hKey)
02223          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02224 
02225       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02226 
02227       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02228       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02229          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02230          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02231       }
02232 
02233       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02234          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key", "key has no subkeys");
02235          *subhKey = 0;
02236          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02237          return DB_NO_KEY;
02238       }
02239       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02240 
02241       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02242          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02243             *subhKey = 0;
02244             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02245             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02246          }
02247 
02248          *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02249 
02250          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02251          return DB_SUCCESS;
02252       }
02253 
02254       pkey_name = key_name;
02255       do {
02256          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02257          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
02258 
02259          /* check if parent or current directory */
02260          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02261             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02262                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02263                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02264             }
02265             continue;
02266          }
02267          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02268             continue;
02269 
02270          /* check if key is in keylist */
02271          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02272 
02273          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02274             if (pkey->name[0] == 0 || !db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02275                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_key",
02276                       "Warning: database corruption, key %s, next_key 0x%08X",
02277                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02278                *subhKey = 0;
02279                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02280                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02281             }
02282 
02283             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02284                break;
02285 
02286             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02287          }
02288 
02289          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02290             *subhKey = 0;
02291             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02292             return DB_NO_KEY;
02293          }
02294 
02295          /* resolve links */
02296          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
02297             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02298             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02299             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02300                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02301 
02302             /* append rest of key name if existing */
02303             if (pkey_name[0]) {
02304                strcat(str, pkey_name);
02305                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02306                return db_find_key(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02307             } else {
02308                /* if last key in chain is a link, return its destination */
02309                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02310                status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02311                if (status == DB_NO_KEY)
02312                   return DB_INVALID_LINK;
02313                return status;
02314             }
02315          }
02316 
02317          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02318          if (*pkey_name == '/') {
02319             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02320                *subhKey = 0;
02321                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02322                return DB_NO_KEY;
02323             }
02324          }
02325 
02326          /* descend one level */
02327          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02328 
02329       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02330 
02331       *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02332 
02333       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02334    }
02335 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02336 
02337    return DB_SUCCESS;
02338 }

02463                return db_find_link1(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02464             }
02465          }

02472                return DB_NO_KEY;
02473             }

02492          : db_find_link
02493 
02494   Purpose: Find a key or link by name and return its handle
02495            (internal address). The only difference of this routine
02496            compared with db_find_key is that if the LAST key in
02497            the chain is a link, it is NOT evaluated. Links not being
02498            the last in the chain are evaluated.
02499 
02500   Input:
02501     HNDLE  bufer_handle     Handle to the database
02502     HNDLE  hKey       Key handle to start the search
02503     char   *key_name        Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
02504 
02505   Output:
02506     INT    *handle          Key handle
02507 
02508   Function value:
02509     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02510     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02511     DB_NO_KEY               Key doesn't exist
02512     DB_NO_ACCESS            No access to read key
02513 
02514 \********************************************************************/
02515 {
02516    if (rpc_is_remote())
02517       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_LINK, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02518 
02519 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02520    {
02521       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02522       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02523       KEY *pkey;
02524       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02525       INT i;

02530          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "Invalid database handle");
02531          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02532       }

02537       }

02544       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);

02547       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02548          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02549          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02550       }
02551 
02552       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02553          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "key has no subkeys");
02554          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02555          return DB_NO_KEY;
02556       }
02557       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02558 
02559       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02560          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02561             *subhKey = 0;
02562             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02563             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02564          }
02565 
02566          *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02567 
02568          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02569          return DB_SUCCESS;
02570       }
02571 
02572       pkey_name = key_name;
02573       do {
02574          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02575          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
02576 
02577          /* check if parent or current directory */
02578          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02579             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02580                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02581                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02582             }
02583             continue;
02584          }
02585          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02586             continue;
02587 
02588          /* check if key is in keylist */
02589          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02590 
02591          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02592             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02593                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link",
02594                       "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", next_key 0x%08X",
02595                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02596                *subhKey = 0;
02597                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02598                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02599             }
02600 
02601             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02602                break;
02603 
02604             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02605          }
02606 
02607          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02608             *subhKey = 0;
02609             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02610             return DB_NO_KEY;
02611          }
02612 
02613          /* resolve links if not last in chain */
02614          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && *pkey_name == '/') {
02615             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02616             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02617             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02618                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02619 
02620             /* append rest of key name */
02621             strcat(str, pkey_name);
02622             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02623             return db_find_link(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02624          }
02625 
02626          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02627          if ((*pkey_name == '/')) {
02628             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02629                *subhKey = 0;
02630                db_unlock_database(hDB);
02631                return DB_NO_KEY;
02632             }
02633          }
02634 
02635          /* descend one level */
02636          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02637 
02638       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02639 
02640       *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02641 
02642       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02643    }
02644 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02645 
02646    return DB_SUCCESS;
02647 }

INT EXPRT db_find_link1 ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  key_name,
HNDLE *  subhKey 
)

Definition at line 2650 of file odb.c.

References _database_entries, KEY::access_mode, cm_msg, KEY::data, DATABASE::database_header, DB_CORRUPTED, db_find_link1(), DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_NO_KEY, DB_SUCCESS, db_unlock_database(), db_validate_hkey(), db_validate_key_offset(), equal_ustring(), extract_key(), KEYLIST::first_key, i, MAX_STRING_LENGTH, MERROR, MODE_READ, KEY::name, KEY::next_key, KEYLIST::num_keys, KEYLIST::parent, KEY::parent_keylist, PTYPE, DATABASE_HEADER::root_key, rpc_call(), RPC_DB_FIND_LINK, rpc_is_remote(), TID_KEY, TID_LINK, and KEY::type.

Referenced by db_find_key1(), and db_find_link1().

02653          : db_find_link1
02654 
02655   Purpose: Same ad db_find_link, but without DB locking
02656 
02657   Input:
02658     HNDLE  bufer_handle     Handle to the database
02659     HNDLE  hKey       Key handle to start the search
02660     char   *key_name        Name of key in the form "/key/key/key"
02661 
02662   Output:
02663     INT    *handle          Key handle
02664 
02665   Function value:
02666     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02667     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
02668     DB_NO_KEY               Key doesn't exist
02669     DB_NO_ACCESS            No access to read key
02670 
02671 \********************************************************************/
02672 {
02673    if (rpc_is_remote())
02674       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_FIND_LINK, hDB, hKey, key_name, subhKey);
02675 
02676 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02677    {
02678       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02679       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02680       KEY *pkey;
02681       char *pkey_name, str[MAX_STRING_LENGTH];
02682       INT i;
02683 
02684       *subhKey = 0;
02685 
02686       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02687          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "Invalid database handle");
02688          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02689       }
02690 
02691       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02692          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "invalid database handle");
02693          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02694       }
02695 
02696       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02697       if (!hKey)
02698          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02699       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02700 
02701       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02702       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02703          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02704          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02705       }
02706 
02707       if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02708          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link", "key has no subkeys");
02709          return DB_NO_KEY;
02710       }
02711       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02712 
02713       if (key_name[0] == 0 || strcmp(key_name, "/") == 0) {
02714          if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
02715             *subhKey = 0;
02716             return DB_NO_ACCESS;
02717          }
02718 
02719          *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02720 
02721          return DB_SUCCESS;
02722       }
02723 
02724       pkey_name = key_name;
02725       do {
02726          /* extract single subkey from key_name */
02727          pkey_name = extract_key(pkey_name, str);
02728 
02729          /* check if parent or current directory */
02730          if (strcmp(str, "..") == 0) {
02731             if (pkey->parent_keylist) {
02732                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02733                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02734             }
02735             continue;
02736          }
02737          if (strcmp(str, ".") == 0)
02738             continue;
02739 
02740          /* check if key is in keylist */
02741          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
02742 
02743          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys; i++) {
02744             if (!db_validate_key_offset(pheader, pkey->next_key)) {
02745                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_find_link1",
02746                       "Warning: database corruption, key \"%s\", next_key 0x%08X",
02747                       key_name, pkey->next_key - sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER));
02748                *subhKey = 0;
02749                return DB_CORRUPTED;
02750             }
02751 
02752             if (equal_ustring(str, pkey->name))
02753                break;
02754 
02755             pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
02756          }
02757 
02758          if (i == pkeylist->num_keys) {
02759             *subhKey = 0;
02760             return DB_NO_KEY;
02761          }
02762 
02763          /* resolve links if not last in chain */
02764          if (pkey->type == TID_LINK && *pkey_name == '/') {
02765             /* copy destination, strip '/' */
02766             strcpy(str, (char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02767             if (str[strlen(str) - 1] == '/')
02768                str[strlen(str) - 1] = 0;
02769 
02770             /* append rest of key name */
02771             strcat(str, pkey_name);
02772             return db_find_link1(hDB, 0, str, subhKey);
02773          }
02774 
02775          /* key found: check if last in chain */
02776          if ((*pkey_name == '/')) {
02777             if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
02778                *subhKey = 0;
02779                return DB_NO_KEY;
02780             }
02781          }
02782 
02783          /* descend one level */
02784          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
02785 
02786       } while (*pkey_name == '/' && *(pkey_name + 1));
02787 
02788       *subhKey = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
02789    }
02790 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02791 
02792    return DB_SUCCESS;
02793 }

INT EXPRT db_get_data ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
void *  data,
INT *  buf_size,
DWORD  type 
)

dox Get key data from a handle

The function returns single values or whole arrays which are contained in an ODB key. Since the data buffer is of type void, no type checking can be performed by the compiler. Therefore the type has to be explicitly supplied, which is checked against the type stored in the ODB. 

  HNLDE hkey;
  INT   run_number, size;
  // get key handle for run number
  db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &hkey);
  // return run number
  size = sizeof(run_number);
  db_get_data(hDB, hkey, &run_number, &size,TID_INT);
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
data Pointer to the return data.
buf_size Size of data buffer.
type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see Midas_Data_Types).
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH

Definition at line 4150 of file odb.c.

References _database_entries, KEY::access_mode, cm_msg, KEY::data, DATABASE::database_header, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, db_lock_database(), DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH, db_unlock_database(), db_validate_hkey(), KEY::item_size, MERROR, MODE_READ, KEY::name, KEY::num_values, rpc_call(), RPC_DB_GET_DATA, rpc_is_remote(), rpc_tid_name(), TID_KEY, and KEY::type.

04151 {
04152    if (rpc_is_remote())
04153       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, type);
04154 
04155 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04156    {
04157       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04158       KEY *pkey;
04159 
04160       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04161          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04162          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04163       }
04164 
04165       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04166          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04167          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04168       }
04169 
04170       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04171          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key handle");
04172          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04173       }
04174 
04175       db_lock_database(hDB);
04176 
04177       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04178       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04179 
04180       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04181       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04182          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04183          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04184       }
04185 
04186       /* check for read access */
04187       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04188          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04189          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04190       }
04191 
04192       if (!pkey->type) {
04193          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04194          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid key");
04195          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04196       }
04197 
04198       if (pkey->type != type) {
04199          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04200          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04201                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04202          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04203       }
04204 
04205       /* keys cannot contain data */
04206       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04207          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04208          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04209          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04210       }
04211 
04212       /* check if key has data */
04213       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04214          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04215          *buf_size = 0;
04216          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04217          return DB_SUCCESS;
04218       }
04219 
04220       /* check if buffer is too small */
04221       if (pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04222          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
04223          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04224          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", pkey->name);
04225          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04226       }
04227 
04228       /* copy key data */
04229       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
04230       *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
04231 
04232       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04233 
04234    }
04235 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04236 
04237    return DB_SUCCESS;
04238 }

INT EXPRT db_get_data_index ( HNDLE  hDB,

INT  index,

)

dox returns a single value of keys containing arrays of values.

The function returns a single value of keys containing arrays of values.

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
data Size of data buffer.
buf_size Return size of the record.
index Index of array [0..n-1].
type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see Midas_Data_Types).
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_OUT_OF_RANGE

Definition at line 4376 of file odb.c.

References _database_entries, KEY::access_mode, cm_msg, KEY::data, DATABASE::database_header, db_get_path(), DB_INVALID_HANDLE, db_lock_database(), DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_OUT_OF_RANGE, DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH, db_unlock_database(), db_validate_hkey(), KEY::item_size, MERROR, MODE_READ, KEY::name, KEY::num_values, rpc_call(), RPC_DB_GET_DATA_INDEX, rpc_is_remote(), rpc_tid_name(), TID_KEY, and KEY::type.

04380       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_DATA_INDEX, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, index, type);
04381
