04383    {
04384       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04385       KEY *pkey;
04386       char str[256];
04387 
04388       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04389          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "Invalid database handle");
04390          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04391       }
04392 
04393       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04394          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data", "invalid database handle");
04395          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04396       }

04400          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04401       }
04402

04407 
04408       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04409       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04410          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04411          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04412       }
04413 
04414       /* check for read access */
04415       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
04416          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04417          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04418       }
04419 
04420       if (!pkey->type) {

04422          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "invalid key");
04423          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;

04425 
04426       if (pkey->type != type) {
04427          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04428          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index",
04429                 "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s", pkey->name,
04430                 rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04431          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04432       }
04433 
04434       /* keys cannot contain data */
04435       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04436          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04437          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "Key cannot contain data");
04438          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04439       }
04440 
04441       /* check if key has data */
04442       if (pkey->data == 0) {
04443          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04444          *buf_size = 0;
04445          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04446          return DB_SUCCESS;
04447       }
04448 
04449       /* check if index in range */
04450       if (index < 0 || index >= pkey->num_values) {
04451          memset(data, 0, *buf_size);
04452          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04453 
04454          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
04455          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index",
04456                 "index (%d) exceeds array length (%d) for key \"%s\"",
04457                 index, pkey->num_values, str);
04458          return DB_OUT_OF_RANGE;
04459       }
04460 
04461       /* check if buffer is too small */
04462       if (pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
04463          /* copy data */
04464          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data + index * pkey->item_size, *buf_size);
04465          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04466          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_data_index", "data for key \"%s\" truncated", pkey->name);
04467          return DB_TRUNCATED;
04468       }
04469 
04470       /* copy key data */
04471       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data + index * pkey->item_size,
04472              pkey->item_size);
04473       *buf_size = pkey->item_size;
04474 
04475       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04476 
04477    }
04478 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04479 
04480    return DB_SUCCESS;
04481 }

INT EXPRT db_get_key ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
KEY *  key 
)

dox Get key structure from a handle.

KEY structure has following format: 

typedef struct {
  DWORD         type;                 // TID_xxx type
  INT           num_values;           // number of values
  char          name[NAME_LENGTH];    // name of variable
  INT           data;                 // Address of variable (offset)
  INT           total_size;           // Total size of data block
  INT           item_size;            // Size of single data item
  WORD          access_mode;          // Access mode
  WORD          notify_count;         // Notify counter
  INT           next_key;             // Address of next key
  INT           parent_keylist;       // keylist to which this key belongs
  INT           last_written;         // Time of last write action
} KEY;

Most of these values are used for internal purposes, the values which are of public interest are type, num_values, and name. For keys which contain a single value, num_values equals to one and total_size equals to item_size. For keys which contain an array of strings (TID_STRING), item_size equals to the length of one string. 

KEY   key;
HNDLE hkey;
db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &hkey);
db_get_key(hDB, hkey, &key);
printf("The run number is of type %s\n", rpc_tid_name(key.type));
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
key Pointer to KEY stucture.
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE

Definition at line 3722 of file odb.c.

References _database_entries, cm_msg, DATABASE::database_header, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, db_lock_database(), DB_SUCCESS, db_unlock_database(), db_validate_hkey(), MERROR, rpc_call(), RPC_DB_GET_KEY, rpc_is_remote(), and KEY::type.

03759          db_unlock_database(hDB);

03761          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;

03765 
03766       db_unlock_database(hDB);

03771    return DB_SUCCESS;

DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE

03885

03888          strcpy(name, "/");
03889

03891       *num_values = pkey->num_values;
03892       *item_size = pkey->item_size;
03893

03895          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03896          *num_values = pkeylist->num_keys;
03897       }
03898 
03899       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03900    }
03901 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03902 
03903    return DB_SUCCESS;
03904 }

Referenced by db_check_record(), and rpc_server_dispatch().

03570          : db_get_next_link
03571 
03572   Purpose: Get next key in ODB after hKey
03573 
03574   Input:
03575     HNDLE hDB               Handle to the database
03576     HNDLE hKey              Handle of key to enumerate, zero for the
03577                             root key
03578 
03579   Output:
03580     HNDLE *subkey_handle    Handle of subkey which can be used in
03581                             db_get_key and db_get_data
03582 
03583   Function value:
03584     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03585     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
03586     DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS      Last subkey reached
03587 
03588 \********************************************************************/
03589 {
03590    if (rpc_is_remote())
03591       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_NEXT_LINK, hDB, hKey, subkey_handle);
03592 
03593 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03594    {
03595       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03596       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
03597       KEY *pkey;
03598       INT descent;
03599 
03600       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03601          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03602          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03603       }
03604 
03605       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03606          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_enum_link", "invalid database handle");
03607          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03608       }
03609 
03610       *subkey_handle = 0;
03611 
03612       /* first lock database */
03613       db_lock_database(hDB);
03614 
03615       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03616       if (!hKey)
03617          hKey = pheader->root_key;
03618       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03619 
03620       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
03621       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
03622          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03623          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03624       }
03625 
03626       descent = TRUE;
03627       do {
03628          if (pkey->type != TID_KEY || !descent) {
03629             if (pkey->next_key) {
03630                /* key has next key, return it */
03631                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->next_key);
03632 
03633                if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03634                   *subkey_handle = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
03635                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
03636                   return DB_SUCCESS;
03637                }
03638 
03639                /* key has subkeys, so descent on the next iteration */
03640                descent = TRUE;
03641             } else {
03642                if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0) {
03643                   /* return if we are back to the root key */
03644                   db_unlock_database(hDB);
03645                   return DB_NO_MORE_SUBKEYS;
03646                }
03647 
03648                /* key is last in list, traverse up */
03649                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
03650 
03651                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
03652                descent = FALSE;
03653             }
03654          } else {
03655             if (descent) {
03656                /* find first subkey */
03657                pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
03658 
03659                if (pkeylist->num_keys == 0) {
03660                   /* if key has no subkeys, look for next key on this level */
03661                   descent = FALSE;
03662                } else {
03663                   /* get first subkey */
03664                   pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
03665 
03666                   if (pkey->type != TID_KEY) {
03667                      *subkey_handle = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
03668                      db_unlock_database(hDB);
03669                      return DB_SUCCESS;
03670                   }
03671                }
03672             }
03673          }
03674 
03675       } while (TRUE);
03676    }
03677 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03678 
03679    return DB_SUCCESS;
03680 }

02911

02935    {
02936       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
02937       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
02938       KEY *pkey;
02939       char str[MAX_ODB_PATH];
02940 
02941       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
02942          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_path", "invalid database handle");
02943          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02944       }
02945 
02946       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
02947          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_path", "invalid database handle");
02948          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02949       }
02950 
02951       db_lock_database(hDB);
02952 
02953       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
02954       if (!hKey)
02955          hKey = pheader->root_key;
02956       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
02957 
02958       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
02959       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
02960          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02961          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
02962       }
02963 
02964       if (hKey == pheader->root_key) {
02965          strcpy(path, "/");
02966          db_unlock_database(hDB);
02967          return DB_SUCCESS;
02968       }
02969 
02970       *path = 0;
02971       do {
02972          /* add key name in front of path */
02973          strcpy(str, path);
02974          strcpy(path, "/");
02975          strcat(path, pkey->name);
02976 
02977          if (strlen(path) + strlen(str) + 1 > (DWORD) buf_size) {
02978             *path = 0;
02979             db_unlock_database(hDB);
02980             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
02981          }
02982          strcat(path, str);
02983 
02984          /* find parent key */
02985          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
02986          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
02987       } while (pkey->parent_keylist);
02988 
02989       db_unlock_database(hDB);
02990    }
02991 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02992 
02993    return DB_SUCCESS;
02994 }

INT EXPRT db_get_record ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
void *  data,
INT *  buf_size,
INT  align 
)

Copy a set of keys to local memory.

An ODB sub-tree can be mapped to a C structure automatically via a hot-link using the function db_open_record() or manually with this function. Problems might occur if the ODB sub-tree contains values which don't match the C structure. Although the structure size is checked against the sub-tree size, no checking can be done if the type and order of the values in the structure are the same than those in the ODB sub-tree. Therefore it is recommended to use the function db_create_record() before db_get_record() is used which ensures that both are equivalent. 

struct {
  INT level1;
  INT level2;
} trigger_settings;
char *trigger_settings_str =
"[Settings]\n\
level1 = INT : 0\n\
level2 = INT : 0";

main()
{
  HNDLE hDB, hkey;
  INT   size;
  ...
  cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
  db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger", trigger_settings_str);
  db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings", &hkey);
  size = sizeof(trigger_settings);
  db_get_record(hDB, hkey, &trigger_settings, &size, 0);
  ...
}
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
data Pointer to the retrieved data.
buf_size Size of data structure, must be obtained via sizeof(RECORD-NAME).
align Byte alignment calculated by the stub and passed to the rpc side to align data according to local machine. Must be zero when called from user level.
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH

Definition at line 6770 of file odb.c.

References cm_msg, db_get_data(), db_get_key(), db_get_path(), db_get_record_size(), db_lock_database(), db_recurse_record_tree(), DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH, DB_SUCCESS, db_unlock_database(), FALSE, KEY::item_size, key, MERROR, KEY::name, KEY::num_values, rpc_call(), rpc_convert_data(), RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS, rpc_convert_single(), RPC_DB_GET_RECORD, RPC_FIXARRAY, rpc_get_server_option(), rpc_is_remote(), RPC_OSERVER_TYPE, RPC_OUTGOING, ss_get_struct_align(), ST_REMOTE, status, TID_KEY, and KEY::type.

Referenced by al_check(), al_reset_alarm(), al_trigger_alarm(), al_trigger_class(), bb_psi_init(), bl_psi_init(), cm_transition(), das1600_init(), dastemp_init(), db_open_record(), db_update_record(), lazy_remove_entry(), lrs1440_init(), lrs1445a_init(), lrs1454_init(), main(), nitronic_init(), null_init(), nulldev_init(), register_equipment(), rpc_server_dispatch(), rs232_init(), show_status_page(), tcpip_init(), tr_start(), and tr_start1().

06771 {
06772    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
06773       align = ss_get_struct_align();
06774       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_RECORD, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, align);
06775    }
06776 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06777    {
06778       KEY key;
06779       INT convert_flags, status;
06780       INT total_size;
06781       void *pdata;
06782       char str[256];
06783 
06784       convert_flags = 0;
06785 
06786       if (!align)
06787          align = ss_get_struct_align();
06788       else
06789          /* only convert data if called remotely, as indicated by align != 0 */
06790       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
06791          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
06792 
06793       /* check if key has subkeys */
06794       status = db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06795       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06796          return status;
06797 
06798       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
06799          /* copy single key */
06800          if (key.item_size * key.num_values != *buf_size) {
06801             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\"", key.name);
06802             return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
06803          }
06804 
06805          db_get_data(hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, key.type);
06806 
06807          if (convert_flags) {
06808             if (key.num_values > 1)
06809                rpc_convert_data(data, key.type,
06810                                 RPC_OUTGOING | RPC_FIXARRAY,
06811                                 key.item_size * key.num_values, convert_flags);
06812             else
06813                rpc_convert_single(data, key.type, RPC_OUTGOING, convert_flags);
06814          }
06815 
06816          return DB_SUCCESS;
06817       }
06818 
06819       /* check record size */
06820       db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &total_size);
06821       if (total_size != *buf_size) {
06822          db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
06823          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_record",
06824                 "struct size mismatch for \"%s\" (%d instead of %d)", str,
06825                 *buf_size, total_size);
06826          return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
06827       }
06828 
06829       /* get subkey data */
06830       pdata = data;
06831       total_size = 0;
06832 
06833       db_lock_database(hDB);
06834       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, &pdata, &total_size, align,
06835                              NULL, FALSE, convert_flags);
06836       db_unlock_database(hDB);
06837 
06838    }
06839 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06840 
06841    return DB_SUCCESS;
06842 }

INT EXPRT db_get_record_size ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
INT  align,
INT *  buf_size 
)

dox Calculates the size of a record.

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
align Byte alignment calculated by the stub and passed to the rpc side to align data according to local machine. Must be zero when called from user level
buf_size Size of record structure
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH, DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH, DB_NO_KEY

06693       INT status, max_align;

06700       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
06701          return status;

06705          *buf_size = key.item_size * key.num_values;
06706          return DB_SUCCESS;
06707       }
06708

06710

06712       *buf_size = max_align = 0;
06713       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, NULL, buf_size, align, &max_align, 0, 0);
06714 
06715       /* correct for byte padding */
06716       *buf_size = VALIGN(*buf_size, max_align);
06717 
06718       db_unlock_database(hDB);
06719    }
06720 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06721 
06722    return DB_SUCCESS;
06723 }

INT EXPRT db_get_value ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKeyRoot,
char *  key_name,
void *  data,
INT *  buf_size,
DWORD  type,
BOOL  create 
)

Get value of a single key.

The function returns single values or whole arrays which are contained in an ODB key. Since the data buffer is of type void, no type checking can be performed by the compiler. Therefore the type has to be explicitly supplied, which is checked against the type stored in the ODB. key_name can contain the full path of a key (like: "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1") while hkey is zero which refers to the root, or hkey can refer to a sub-directory (like: /Equipment/Trigger) and key_name is interpreted relative to that directory like "Settings/Level1". 

INT level1, size;
  size = sizeof(level1);
  db_get_value(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1",
                                   &level1, &size, TID_INT, 0);
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
key_name Name of key to search, can contain directories.
data Address of data.
buf_size Maximum buffer size on input, number of written bytes on return.
type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see Midas_Data_Types)
create If TRUE, create key if not existing
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_NO_KEY

Definition at line 3261 of file odb.c.

03263 {
03264    if (rpc_is_remote())
03265       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_GET_VALUE, hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name,
03266                       data, buf_size, type, create);
03267 
03268 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03269    {
03270       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03271       HNDLE hkey;
03272       KEY *pkey;
03273       INT status, size;
03274       char path[256];
03275 
03276       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
03277          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "invalid database handle");
03278          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03279       }
03280 
03281       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
03282          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "invalid database handle");
03283          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
03284       }
03285 
03286       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hkey);
03287       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
03288          if (create) {
03289             db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, type);
03290             status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hkey);
03291             if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03292                return status;
03293 
03294             /* get string size from data size */
03295             if (type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK)
03296                size = *buf_size;
03297             else
03298                size = rpc_tid_size(type);
03299 
03300             if (size == 0)
03301                return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03302 
03303             /* set default value if key was created */
03304             status = db_set_value(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, data,
03305                                   *buf_size, *buf_size / size, type);
03306          } else
03307             return DB_NO_KEY;
03308       }
03309 
03310       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03311          return status;
03312 
03313       /* now lock database */
03314       db_lock_database(hDB);
03315       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03316 
03317       /* get address from handle */
03318       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hkey);
03319 
03320       /* check for correct type */
03321       if (pkey->type != (type)) {
03322          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03323          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
03324                 key_name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
03325          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03326       }
03327 
03328       /* check for read access */
03329       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_READ)) {
03330          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03331          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value", "%s has no read access", key_name);
03332          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
03333       }
03334 
03335       /* check if buffer is too small */
03336       if (pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size > *buf_size) {
03337          memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, *buf_size);
03338          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03339          db_get_path(hDB, hkey, path, sizeof(path));
03340          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_get_value",
03341                 "buffer too small, data truncated for key \"%s\"", path);
03342          return DB_TRUNCATED;
03343       }
03344 
03345       /* copy key data */
03346       memcpy(data, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size);
03347       *buf_size = pkey->num_values * pkey->item_size;
03348 
03349       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03350    }
03351 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03352 
03353    return DB_SUCCESS;
03354 }

INT EXPRT db_load ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKeyRoot,
char *  filename,
BOOL  bRemote 
)

dox Load a branch of a database from an .ODB file.

This function is used by the ODBEdit command load. For a description of the ASCII format, see db_copy(). Data can be loaded relative to the root of the ODB (hkey equal zero) or relative to a certain key.

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
filename Filename of .ODB file.
bRemote If TRUE, the file is loaded by the server process on the back-end, if FALSE, it is loaded from the current process
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_FILE_ERROR

Definition at line 5138 of file odb.c.

References buffer, cm_msg, DB_FILE_ERROR, DB_NO_MEMORY, db_paste(), i, MERROR, n, O_TEXT, read, rpc_call(), RPC_DB_LOAD, rpc_is_remote(), size, status, and TRUE.

Referenced by command_loop(), CMKey::Load(), load_parameters(), and rpc_server_dispatch().

05139 {
05140    struct stat stat_buf;
05141    INT hfile, size, n, i, status;
05142    char *buffer;
05143 
05144    if (rpc_is_remote() && bRemote)
05145       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_LOAD, hDB, hKeyRoot, filename);
05146 
05147    /* open file */
05148    hfile = open(filename, O_RDONLY | O_TEXT, 0644);
05149    if (hfile == -1) {
05150       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_load", "file \"%s\" not found", filename);
05151       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
05152    }
05153 
05154    /* allocate buffer with file size */
05155    fstat(hfile, &stat_buf);
05156    size = stat_buf.st_size;
05157    buffer = (char *) malloc(size + 1);
05158 
05159    if (buffer == NULL) {
05160       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_load", "cannot allocate ODB load buffer");
05161       close(hfile);
05162       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05163    }
05164 
05165    n = 0;
05166 
05167    do {
05168       i = read(hfile, buffer + n, size);
05169       if (i <= 0)
05170          break;
05171       n += i;
05172    } while (TRUE);
05173 
05174    buffer[n] = 0;
05175 
05176    status = db_paste(hDB, hKeyRoot, buffer);
05177 
05178    close(hfile);
05179    free(buffer);
05180 
05181    return status;
05182 }

04975          : db_merge_data
04976 
04977   Purpose: Merge an array with an ODB array. If the ODB array doesn't
04978            exist, create it and fill it with the array. If it exists,
04979            load it in the array. Adjust ODB array size if necessary.
04980 
04981   Input:
04982     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
04983     HNDLE  hKeyRoot         Key handle to start with, 0 for root
04984     cha    *name            Key name relative to hKeyRoot
04985     void   *data            Pointer to data array
04986     INT    data_size        Size of data array
04987     INT    num_values       Number of values in array
04988     DWORD  type             Type of data
04989 
04990   Output:

04993   Function value:
04994     <same as db_set_data>

04997 {
04998    HNDLE hKey;
04999    INT status, old_size;
05000 
05001    if (num_values == 0)
05002       return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
05003 
05004    status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, &hKey);
05005    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
05006       db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, type);
05007       db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, name, &hKey);
05008       status = db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, data_size, num_values, type);
05009    } else {
05010       old_size = data_size;
05011       db_get_data(hDB, hKey, data, &old_size, type);
05012       status = db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, data_size, num_values, type);
05013    }
05014 
05015    return status;
05016 }

00995 {
00996    if (rpc_is_remote())
00997       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_OPEN_DATABASE, database_name, database_size,
00998                       hDB, client_name);
00999 
01000 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
01001    {
01002       INT i, status;
01003       HNDLE handle;
01004       DATABASE_CLIENT *pclient;
01005       BOOL shm_created;
01006       HNDLE shm_handle;
01007       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
01008       KEY *pkey;
01009       KEYLIST *pkeylist;
01010       FREE_DESCRIP *pfree;
01011       BOOL call_watchdog;
01012       DWORD timeout;
01013 
01014       if (database_size < 0 || database_size > 10E7) {
01015          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "invalid database size");
01016          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
01017       }
01018 
01019       /* restrict name length */
01020       if (strlen(database_name) >= NAME_LENGTH)
01021          database_name[NAME_LENGTH] = 0;
01022 
01023       /* allocate new space for the new database descriptor */
01024       if (_database_entries == 0) {
01025          _database = (DATABASE *) malloc(sizeof(DATABASE));
01026          memset(_database, 0, sizeof(DATABASE));
01027          if (_database == NULL) {
01028             *hDB = 0;
01029             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
01030          }
01031 
01032          _database_entries = 1;
01033          i = 0;
01034       } else {
01035          /* check if database already open */
01036          for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
01037             if (_database[i].attached && equal_ustring(_database[i].name, database_name)) {
01038                /* check if database belongs to this thread */
01039                if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_MTHREAD) {
01040                   if (_database[i].index == ss_gettid()) {
01041                      *hDB = i + 1;
01042                      return DB_SUCCESS;
01043                   }
01044                } else {
01045                   *hDB = i + 1;
01046                   return DB_SUCCESS;
01047                }
01048             }
01049 
01050          /* check for a deleted entry */
01051          for (i = 0; i < _database_entries; i++)
01052             if (!_database[i].attached)
01053                break;
01054 
01055          /* if not found, create new one */
01056          if (i == _database_entries) {
01057             _database =
01058                 (DATABASE *) realloc(_database,
01059                                      sizeof(DATABASE) * (_database_entries + 1));
01060             memset(&_database[_database_entries], 0, sizeof(DATABASE));
01061 
01062             _database_entries++;
01063             if (_database == NULL) {
01064                _database_entries--;
01065                *hDB = 0;
01066                return DB_NO_MEMORY;
01067             }
01068          }
01069       }
01070 
01071       handle = (HNDLE) i;
01072 
01073       /* open shared memory region */
01074       status = ss_shm_open(database_name,
01075                            sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) +
01076                            2 * ALIGN8(database_size / 2),
01077                            (void **) &(_database[(INT) handle].
01078                                        database_header), &shm_handle);
01079 
01080       if (status == SS_NO_MEMORY || status == SS_FILE_ERROR) {
01081          *hDB = 0;
01082          return DB_INVALID_NAME;
01083       }
01084 
01085       /* shortcut to header */
01086       pheader = _database[handle].database_header;
01087 
01088       /* save name */
01089       strcpy(_database[handle].name, database_name);
01090 
01091       shm_created = (status == SS_CREATED);
01092 
01093       /* clear memeory for debugging */
01094       /* memset(pheader, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2*ALIGN8(database_size/2)); */
01095 
01096       if (shm_created && pheader->name[0] == 0) {
01097          /* setup header info if database was created */
01098          memset(pheader, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + 2 * ALIGN8(database_size / 2));
01099 
01100          strcpy(pheader->name, database_name);
01101          pheader->version = DATABASE_VERSION;
01102          pheader->key_size = ALIGN8(database_size / 2);
01103          pheader->data_size = ALIGN8(database_size / 2);
01104          pheader->root_key = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER);
01105          pheader->first_free_key = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER);
01106          pheader->first_free_data = sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER) + pheader->key_size;
01107 
01108          /* set up free list */
01109          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_key);
01110          pfree->size = pheader->key_size;
01111          pfree->next_free = 0;
01112 
01113          pfree = (FREE_DESCRIP *) ((char *) pheader + pheader->first_free_data);
01114          pfree->size = pheader->data_size;
01115          pfree->next_free = 0;
01116 
01117          /* create root key */
01118          pkey = (KEY *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEY));
01119 
01120          /* set key properties */
01121          pkey->type = TID_KEY;
01122          pkey->num_values = 1;
01123          pkey->access_mode = MODE_READ | MODE_WRITE | MODE_DELETE;
01124          strcpy(pkey->name, "root");
01125          pkey->parent_keylist = 0;
01126 
01127          /* create keylist */
01128          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) malloc_key(pheader, sizeof(KEYLIST));
01129 
01130          /* store keylist in data field */
01131          pkey->data = (PTYPE) pkeylist - (PTYPE) pheader;
01132          pkey->item_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01133          pkey->total_size = sizeof(KEYLIST);
01134 
01135          pkeylist->parent = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
01136          pkeylist->num_keys = 0;
01137          pkeylist->first_key = 0;
01138       }
01139 
01140       /* check database version */
01141       if (pheader->version != DATABASE_VERSION) {
01142          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "Different database format: Shared memory is %d, program is %d",
01143             pheader->version, DATABASE_VERSION);
01144          return DB_VERSION_MISMATCH;
01145       }
01146 
01147       /* create mutex for the database */
01148       status = ss_mutex_create(database_name, &(_database[handle].mutex));
01149       if (status != SS_SUCCESS && status != SS_CREATED) {
01150          *hDB = 0;
01151          return DB_NO_MUTEX;
01152       }
01153       _database[handle].lock_cnt = 0;
01154 
01155       /* first lock database */
01156       status = db_lock_database(handle + 1);
01157       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
01158          return status;
01159 
01160       /*
01161          Now we have a DATABASE_HEADER, so let's setup a CLIENT
01162          structure in that database. The information there can also
01163          be seen by other processes.
01164        */
01165 
01166       /*
01167          update the client count
01168        */
01169       pheader->num_clients = 0;
01170       pheader->max_client_index = 0;
01171       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++) {
01172          if (pheader->client[i].pid == 0)
01173             continue;
01174          pheader->num_clients++;
01175          pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
01176       }
01177 
01178       /*fprintf(stderr,"num_clients: %d, max_client: %d\n",pheader->num_clients,pheader->max_client_index); */
01179 
01180       /*
01181          Look for empty client slot
01182        */
01183       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++)
01184          if (pheader->client[i].pid == 0)
01185             break;
01186 
01187       if (i == MAX_CLIENTS) {
01188          db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01189          *hDB = 0;
01190          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database", "maximum number of clients exceeded");
01191          return DB_NO_SLOT;
01192       }
01193 
01194       /* store slot index in _database structure */
01195       _database[handle].client_index = i;
01196 
01197       /*
01198          Save the index of the last client of that database so that later only
01199          the clients 0..max_client_index-1 have to be searched through.
01200        */
01201       pheader->num_clients++;
01202       if (i + 1 > pheader->max_client_index)
01203          pheader->max_client_index = i + 1;
01204 
01205       /* setup database header and client structure */
01206       pclient = &pheader->client[i];
01207 
01208       memset(pclient, 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01209       /* use client name previously set by bm_set_name */
01210       strcpy(pclient->name, client_name);
01211       pclient->pid = ss_getpid();
01212       pclient->tid = ss_gettid();
01213       pclient->thandle = ss_getthandle();
01214       pclient->num_open_records = 0;
01215 
01216       ss_suspend_get_port(&pclient->port);
01217 
01218       pclient->last_activity = ss_millitime();
01219 
01220       cm_get_watchdog_params(&call_watchdog, &timeout);
01221       pclient->watchdog_timeout = timeout;
01222 
01223       /* check ODB for corruption */
01224       if (!db_validate_db(pheader)) {
01225          /* do not treat corrupted odb as a fatal error- allow the user
01226             to preceed at own risk- the database is already corrupted,
01227             so no further harm can possibly be made. */
01228          /*
01229             db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01230             *hDB = 0;
01231             return DB_CORRUPTED;
01232           */
01233       }
01234 
01235       /* setup _database entry */
01236       _database[handle].database_data = _database[handle].database_header + 1;
01237       _database[handle].attached = TRUE;
01238       _database[handle].shm_handle = shm_handle;
01239       _database[handle].protect = FALSE;
01240 
01241       /* remember to which connection acutal buffer belongs */
01242       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) == ST_SINGLE)
01243          _database[handle].index = rpc_get_server_acception();
01244       else
01245          _database[handle].index = ss_gettid();
01246 
01247       *hDB = (handle + 1);
01248 
01249       /* setup dispatcher for updated records */
01250       ss_suspend_set_dispatch(CH_IPC, 0, (int (*)(void)) cm_dispatch_ipc);
01251 
01252 
01253       /* remove dead clients */
01254 
01255 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01256 #ifdef ESRCH
01257       /* Only enable this for systems that define ESRCH and hope that
01258          they also support kill(pid,0) */
01259       for (i = 0; i < MAX_CLIENTS; i++) {
01260          int k;
01261 
01262          errno = 0;
01263          kill(pheader->client[i].pid, 0);
01264          if (errno == ESRCH) {
01265             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_database",
01266                    "removing client %s, pid %d, index %d because the pid no longer exists",
01267                    pheader->client[i].name, pheader->client[i].pid, i);
01268 
01269             /* decrement notify_count for open records and clear exclusive mode */
01270             for (k = 0; k < pheader->client[i].max_index; k++)
01271                if (pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle) {
01272                   pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader +
01273                                   pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle);
01274                   if (pkey->notify_count > 0)
01275                      pkey->notify_count--;
01276 
01277                   if (pheader->client[i].open_record[k].access_mode & MODE_WRITE)
01278                      db_set_mode(handle + 1, pheader->client[i].open_record[k].handle,
01279                                  (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
01280                }
01281 
01282             /* clear entry from client structure in database header */
01283             memset(&(pheader->client[i]), 0, sizeof(DATABASE_CLIENT));
01284          }
01285       }
01286 #endif
01287 #endif
01288 
01289       db_unlock_database(handle + 1);
01290 
01291       if (shm_created)
01292          return DB_CREATED;
01293    }
01294 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
01295 
01296    return DB_SUCCESS;
01297 }

INT EXPRT db_open_record ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
void *  ptr,
INT  rec_size,
WORD  access_mode,
void(*)(INT, INT, void *)  dispatcher,
void *  info 
)

Open a record. Create a local copy and maintain an automatic update.

This function opens a hot-link between an ODB sub-tree and a local structure. The sub-tree is copied to the structure automatically every time it is modified by someone else. Additionally, a callback function can be declared which is called after the structure has been updated. The callback function receives the database handle and the key handle as parameters.

Problems might occur if the ODB sub-tree contains values which don't match the C structure. Although the structure size is checked against the sub-tree size, no checking can be done if the type and order of the values in the structure are the same than those in the ODB sub-tree. Therefore it is recommended to use the function db_create_record() before db_open_record() is used which ensures that both are equivalent.

The access mode might either be MODE_READ or MODE_WRITE. In read mode, the ODB sub-tree is automatically copied to the local structure when modified by other clients. In write mode, the local structure is copied to the ODB sub-tree if it has been modified locally. This update has to be manually scheduled by calling db_send_changed_records() periodically in the main loop. The system keeps a copy of the local structure to determine if its contents has been changed.

If MODE_ALLOC is or'ed with the access mode, the memory for the structure is allocated internally. The structure pointer must contain a pointer to a pointer to the structure. The internal memory is released when db_close_record() is called.

  • To open a record in write mode. 
    struct {
  INT level1;
  INT level2;
} trigger_settings;
char *trigger_settings_str =
"[Settings]\n\
level1 = INT : 0\n\
level2 = INT : 0";
main()
{
  HNDLE hDB, hkey, i=0;
  ...
  cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
  db_create_record(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger", trigger_settings_str);
  db_find_key(hDB, 0,"/Equipment/Trigger/Settings", &hkey);
  db_open_record(hDB, hkey, &trigger_settings, sizeof(trigger_settings)
                  , MODE_WRITE, NULL);
  do
  {
    trigger_settings.level1 = i++;
    db_send_changed_records()
    status = cm_yield(1000);
  } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN && status != SS_ABORT);
  ...
}
    Parameters:
    hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
    hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
    ptr If access_mode includes MODE_ALLOC: Address of pointer which points to the record data after the call if access_mode includes not MODE_ALLOC: Address of record if ptr==NULL, only the dispatcher is called.
    rec_size Record size in bytes
    access_mode Mode for opening record, either MODE_READ or MODE_WRITE. May be or'ed with MODE_ALLOC to let db_open_record allocate the memory for the record.
    (*dispatcher) Function which gets called when record is updated.The argument list composed of: HNDLE hDB, HNDLE hKey, void *info
    info Additional info passed to the dispatcher.
    Returns:
    DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_MEMORY, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH

Definition at line 7741 of file odb.c.

07748 
07749    /* allocate new space for the local record list */
07750    if (_record_list_entries == 0) {
07751       _record_list = (RECORD_LIST *) malloc(sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
07752       memset(_record_list, 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
07753       if (_record_list == NULL) {
07754          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
07755          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07756       }
07757 
07758       _record_list_entries = 1;
07759       index = 0;
07760    } else {
07761       /* check for a deleted entry */
07762       for (index = 0; index < _record_list_entries; index++)
07763          if (!_record_list[index].handle)
07764             break;
07765 
07766       /* if not found, create new one */
07767       if (index == _record_list_entries) {
07768          _record_list = (RECORD_LIST *) realloc(_record_list,
07769                                                 sizeof(RECORD_LIST) *
07770                                                 (_record_list_entries + 1));
07771          if (_record_list == NULL) {
07772             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
07773             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07774          }
07775 
07776          memset(&_record_list[_record_list_entries], 0, sizeof(RECORD_LIST));
07777 
07778          _record_list_entries++;
07779       }
07780    }
07781 
07782    db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
07783 
07784    /* check record size */
07785    status = db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &size);
07786    if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07787       _record_list_entries--;
07788       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot get record size");
07789       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07790    }
07791    if (size != rec_size && ptr != NULL) {
07792       _record_list_entries--;
07793       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, str, sizeof(str));
07794       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record",
07795              "struct size mismatch for \"%s\" (%d instead of %d)", str, rec_size, size);
07796       return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
07797    }
07798 
07799    /* check for read access */
07800    if (((key.access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE) && (access_mode & MODE_WRITE))
07801        || (!(key.access_mode & MODE_WRITE) && (access_mode & MODE_WRITE))
07802        || (!(key.access_mode & MODE_READ) && (access_mode & MODE_READ))) {
07803       _record_list_entries--;
07804       return DB_NO_ACCESS;
07805    }
07806 
07807    if (access_mode & MODE_ALLOC) {
07808       data = malloc(size);
07809       memset(data, 0, size);
07810 
07811       if (data == NULL) {
07812          _record_list_entries--;
07813          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
07814          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07815       }
07816 
07817       *((void **) ptr) = data;
07818    } else
07819       data = ptr;
07820 
07821    /* copy record to local memory */
07822    if (access_mode & MODE_READ && data != NULL) {
07823       status = db_get_record(hDB, hKey, data, &size, 0);
07824       if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07825          _record_list_entries--;
07826          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot get record");
07827          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07828       }
07829    }
07830 
07831    /* copy local record to ODB */
07832    if (access_mode & MODE_WRITE) {
07833       /* only write to ODB if not in MODE_ALLOC */
07834       if ((access_mode & MODE_ALLOC) == 0) {
07835          status = db_set_record(hDB, hKey, data, size, 0);
07836          if (status != DB_SUCCESS) {
07837             _record_list_entries--;
07838             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "cannot set record");
07839             return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07840          }
07841       }
07842 
07843       /* init a local copy of the record */
07844       _record_list[index].copy = malloc(size);
07845       if (_record_list[index].copy == NULL) {
07846          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_open_record", "not enough memory");
07847          return DB_NO_MEMORY;
07848       }
07849 
07850       memcpy(_record_list[index].copy, data, size);
07851    }
07852 
07853    /* initialize record list */
07854    _record_list[index].handle = hKey;
07855    _record_list[index].hDB = hDB;
07856    _record_list[index].access_mode = access_mode;
07857    _record_list[index].data = data;
07858    _record_list[index].buf_size = size;
07859    _record_list[index].dispatcher = dispatcher;
07860    _record_list[index].info = info;
07861 
07862    /* add record entry in database structure */
07863    db_add_open_record(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (access_mode & ~MODE_ALLOC));
07864 
07865    return DB_SUCCESS;
07866 }

INT EXPRT db_paste ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKeyRoot,
char *  buffer 
)

Copy an ODB subtree in ASCII format from a buffer

hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
buffer NULL-terminated buffer
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_TRUNCATED, DB_NO_MEMORY

05486 
05487    title[0] = 0;
05488    multi_line = FALSE;
05489 
05490    if (hKeyRoot == 0)
05491       db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, "", &hKeyRoot);
05492 
05493    db_get_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, &root_key);
05494 
05495    /* initial data size */
05496    data_size = 1000;
05497    data = (char *) malloc(data_size);
05498    if (data == NULL) {
05499       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05500       return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05501    }
05502 
05503    do {
05504       if (*buffer == 0)
05505          break;
05506 
05507       for (i = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer && i < MAX_STRING_LENGTH; i++)
05508          line[i] = *buffer++;
05509 
05510       if (i == MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
05511          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "line too long");
05512          free(data);
05513          return DB_TRUNCATED;
05514       }
05515 
05516       line[i] = 0;
05517       if (*buffer == '\n')
05518          buffer++;
05519 
05520       /* check if it is a section title */
05521       if (line[0] == '[') {
05522          /* extract title and append '/' */
05523          strcpy(title, line + 1);
05524          if (strchr(title, ']'))
05525             *strchr(title, ']') = 0;
05526          if (title[0] && title[strlen(title) - 1] != '/')
05527             strcat(title, "/");
05528       } else {
05529          /* valid data line if it includes '=' and no ';' */
05530          if (strchr(line, '=') && line[0] != ';') {
05531             /* copy type info and data */
05532             pc = strchr(line, '=') + 1;
05533             while (*pc == ' ')
05534                pc++;
05535             strcpy(data_str, pc);
05536 
05537             /* extract key name */
05538             *strchr(line, '=') = 0;
05539 
05540             pc = &line[strlen(line) - 1];
05541             while (*pc == ' ')
05542                *pc-- = 0;
05543 
05544             key_name[0] = 0;
05545             if (title[0] != '.')
05546                strcpy(key_name, title);
05547 
05548             strcat(key_name, line);
05549 
05550             /* evaluate type info */
05551             strcpy(line, data_str);
05552             if (strchr(line, ' '))
05553                *strchr(line, ' ') = 0;
05554 
05555             n_data = 1;
05556             if (strchr(line, '[')) {
05557                n_data = atol(strchr(line, '[') + 1);
05558                *strchr(line, '[') = 0;
05559             }
05560 
05561             for (tid = 0; tid < TID_LAST; tid++)
05562                if (strcmp(tid_name[tid], line) == 0)
05563                   break;
05564 
05565             string_length = 0;
05566 
05567             if (tid == TID_LAST)
05568                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste",
05569                       "found unknown data type \"%s\" in ODB file", line);
05570             else {
05571                /* skip type info */
05572                pc = data_str;
05573                while (*pc != ' ' && *pc)
05574                   pc++;
05575                while ((*pc == ' ' || *pc == ':') && *pc)
05576                   pc++;
05577                strcpy(data_str, pc);
05578 
05579                if (n_data > 1) {
05580                   data_str[0] = 0;
05581                   if (!*buffer)
05582                      break;
05583 
05584                   for (j = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer; j++)
05585                      data_str[j] = *buffer++;
05586                   data_str[j] = 0;
05587                   if (*buffer == '\n')
05588                      buffer++;
05589                }
05590 
05591                for (i = 0; i < n_data; i++) {
05592                   /* strip trailing \n */
05593                   pc = &data_str[strlen(data_str) - 1];
05594                   while (*pc == '\n' || *pc == '\r')
05595                      *pc-- = 0;
05596 
05597                   if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK) {
05598                      if (!string_length) {
05599                         if (data_str[1] == '=')
05600                            string_length = -1;
05601                         else
05602                            string_length = atoi(data_str + 1);
05603                         if (string_length > MAX_STRING_LENGTH) {
05604                            string_length = MAX_STRING_LENGTH;
05605                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste",
05606                                   "found string exceeding MAX_STRING_LENGTH");
05607                         }
05608                      }
05609 
05610                      if (string_length == -1) {
05611                         /* multi-line string */
05612                         if (strstr(buffer, "\n====#$@$#====\n") != NULL) {
05613                            string_length =
05614                                (PTYPE) strstr(buffer,
05615                                               "\n====#$@$#====\n") - (PTYPE) buffer + 1;
05616 
05617                            if (string_length >= data_size) {
05618                               data_size += string_length + 100;
05619                               data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
05620                               if (data == NULL) {
05621                                  cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste",
05622                                         "cannot allocate data buffer");
05623                                  return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05624                               }
05625                            }
05626 
05627                            memset(data, 0, data_size);
05628                            strncpy(data, buffer, string_length);
05629                            data[string_length - 1] = 0;
05630                            buffer =
05631                                strstr(buffer,
05632                                       "\n====#$@$#====\n") + strlen("\n====#$@$#====\n");
05633                         } else
05634                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste",
05635                                   "found multi-line string without termination sequence");
05636                      } else {
05637                         pc = data_str + 2;
05638                         while (*pc && *pc != ' ')
05639                            pc++;
05640                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
05641                            pc++;
05642 
05643                         /* limit string size */
05644                         *(pc + string_length - 1) = 0;
05645 
05646                         /* increase data buffer if necessary */
05647                         if (string_length * (i + 1) >= data_size) {
05648                            data_size += 1000;
05649                            data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
05650                            if (data == NULL) {
05651                               cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05652                               return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05653                            }
05654                         }
05655 
05656                         strcpy(data + string_length * i, pc);
05657                      }
05658                   } else {
05659                      pc = data_str;
05660 
05661                      if (n_data > 1 && data_str[0] == '[') {
05662                         pc = strchr(data_str, ']') + 1;
05663                         while (*pc && *pc == ' ')
05664                            pc++;
05665                      }
05666 
05667                      db_sscanf(pc, data, &size, i, tid);
05668 
05669                      /* increase data buffer if necessary */
05670                      if (size * (i + 1) >= data_size) {
05671                         data_size += 1000;
05672                         data = (char *) realloc(data, data_size);
05673                         if (data == NULL) {
05674                            cm_msg(MERROR, "db_paste", "cannot allocate data buffer");
05675                            return DB_NO_MEMORY;
05676                         }
05677                      }
05678 
05679                   }
05680 
05681                   if (i < n_data - 1) {
05682                      data_str[0] = 0;
05683                      if (!*buffer)
05684                         break;
05685 
05686                      pold = buffer;
05687 
05688                      for (j = 0; *buffer != '\n' && *buffer; j++)
05689                         data_str[j] = *buffer++;
05690                      data_str[j] = 0;
05691                      if (*buffer == '\n')
05692                         buffer++;
05693 
05694                      /* test if valid data */
05695                      if (tid != TID_STRING && tid != TID_LINK) {
05696                         if (data_str[0] == 0 || (strchr(data_str, '=')
05697                                                  && strchr(data_str, ':')))
05698                            buffer = pold;
05699                      }
05700                   }
05701                }
05702 
05703                /* skip system client entries */
05704                strcpy(test_str, key_name);
05705                test_str[15] = 0;
05706 
05707                if (!equal_ustring(test_str, "/System/Clients")) {
05708                   if (root_key.type != TID_KEY) {
05709                      /* root key is destination key */
05710                      hKey = hKeyRoot;
05711                   } else {
05712                      /* create key and set value */
05713                      if (key_name[0] == '/') {
05714                         status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, key_name, &hKey);
05715                         if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
05716                            db_create_key(hDB, 0, key_name, tid);
05717                            status = db_find_link(hDB, 0, key_name, &hKey);
05718                         }
05719                      } else {
05720                         status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
05721                         if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
05722                            db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, tid);
05723                            status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
05724                         }
05725                      }
05726                   }
05727 
05728                   /* set key data if created sucessfully */
05729                   if (hKey) {
05730                      if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
05731                         db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, string_length * n_data, n_data, tid);
05732                      else
05733                         db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data,
05734                                     rpc_tid_size(tid) * n_data, n_data, tid);
05735                   }
05736                }
05737             }
05738          }
05739       }
05740    } while (TRUE);
05741 
05742    free(data);
05743    return DB_SUCCESS;
05744 }

INT EXPRT db_protect_database ( HNDLE  hDB  ) 

Protect a database for read/write access outside of the db_xxx functions

Parameters:

07064          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;

07077          db_set_mode(hDB, hKey, (WORD) (pkey->access_mode & ~MODE_EXCLUSIVE), 2);
07078 
07079       memset(&pclient->open_record[index], 0, sizeof(OPEN_RECORD));
07080

07083          if (pclient->open_record[i].handle != 0)
07084             break;
07085       pclient->max_index = i + 1;
07086 
07087       if (lock)
07088          db_unlock_database(hDB);
07089    }
07090 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
07091 
07092    return DB_SUCCESS;
07093 }

04009       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_REORDER_KEY, hDB, hKey, index);

04020          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04021       }

04025          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04026       }
04027 
04028       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04029          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_rename_key", "invalid key handle");
04030          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04031       }
04032 
04033       db_lock_database(hDB);
04034 
04035       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04036       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04037 
04038       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04039       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04040          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04041          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04042       }
04043 
04044       if (!pkey->type) {
04045          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04046          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_reorder_key", "invalid key");
04047          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04048       }
04049 
04050       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE)) {
04051          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04052          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04053       }
04054 
04055       /* check if someone has opened key or parent */
04056       do {
04057          if (pkey->notify_count) {
04058             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04059             return DB_OPEN_RECORD;
04060          }
04061 
04062          if (pkey->parent_keylist == 0)
04063             break;
04064 
04065          pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
04066          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->parent);
04067       } while (TRUE);
04068 
04069       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04070       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->parent_keylist);
04071 
04072       /* first remove key from list */
04073       pnext_key = (KEY *) (PTYPE) pkey->next_key;
04074 
04075       if ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key) == pkey) {
04076          /* key is first in list */
04077          pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pnext_key;
04078       } else {
04079          /* find predecessor */
04080          pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
04081          while ((KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key) != pkey)
04082             pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04083          pkey_tmp->next_key = (PTYPE) pnext_key;
04084       }
04085 
04086       /* add key to list at proper index */
04087       pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
04088       if (index < 0 || index >= pkeylist->num_keys - 1) {
04089          /* add at bottom */
04090 
04091          /* find last key */
04092          for (i = 0; i < pkeylist->num_keys - 2; i++) {
04093             pprev_key = pkey_tmp;
04094             pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04095          }
04096 
04097          pkey_tmp->next_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
04098          pkey->next_key = 0;
04099       } else {
04100          if (index == 0) {
04101             /* add at top */
04102             pkey->next_key = pkeylist->first_key;
04103             pkeylist->first_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
04104          } else {
04105             /* add at position index */
04106             for (i = 0; i < index - 1; i++)
04107                pkey_tmp = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkey_tmp->next_key);
04108 
04109             pkey->next_key = pkey_tmp->next_key;
04110             pkey_tmp->next_key = (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader;
04111          }
04112       }
04113 
04114       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04115 
04116    }
04117 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04118 
04119    return DB_SUCCESS;
04120 }

INT EXPRT db_save ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  filename,
BOOL  bRemote 
)

dox Save a branch of a database to an .ODB file

This function is used by the ODBEdit command save. For a description of the ASCII format, see db_copy(). Data of the whole ODB can be saved (hkey equal zero) or only a sub-tree.

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
filename Filename of .ODB file.
bRemote Flag for saving database on remote server.
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_FILE_ERROR

Definition at line 5878 of file odb.c.

Referenced by command_loop(), lazy_main(), odb_save(), rpc_server_dispatch(), and CMKey::Save().

05882 
05883 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
05884    {
05885       INT hfile, size, buffer_size, n, status;
05886       char *buffer, path[256];
05887 
05888       /* open file */
05889       hfile = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_TEXT, 0644);
05890       if (hfile == -1) {
05891          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "Cannot open file \"%s\"", filename);
05892          return DB_FILE_ERROR;
05893       }
05894 
05895       db_get_path(hDB, hKey, path, sizeof(path));
05896 
05897       buffer_size = 10000;
05898       do {
05899          buffer = (char *) malloc(buffer_size);
05900          if (buffer == NULL) {
05901             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "cannot allocate ODB dump buffer");
05902             break;
05903          }
05904 
05905          size = buffer_size;
05906          status = db_copy(hDB, hKey, buffer, &size, path);
05907          if (status != DB_TRUNCATED) {
05908             n = write(hfile, buffer, buffer_size - size);
05909             free(buffer);
05910 
05911             if (n != buffer_size - size) {
05912                cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save", "cannot save .ODB file");
05913                close(hfile);
05914                return DB_FILE_ERROR;
05915             }
05916             break;
05917          }
05918 
05919          /* increase buffer size if truncated */
05920          free(buffer);
05921          buffer_size *= 2;
05922       } while (1);
05923 
05924       close(hfile);
05925 
05926    }
05927 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05928 
05929    return DB_SUCCESS;
05930 }

06278 
06279    return DB_SUCCESS;

INT EXPRT db_save_xml ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
char *  filename 
)

Save a branch of a database to an .xml file

This function is used by the ODBEdit command save to write the contents of the ODB into a XML file. Data of the whole ODB can be saved (hkey equal zero) or only a sub-tree.

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
filename Filename of .XML file.
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_FILE_ERROR

06100 
06101    /* open file */
06102    fh = open(filename, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_TEXT, 0644);
06103    if (fh == -1) {
06104       cm_msg(MERROR, "db_save_xml", "Cannot open file \"%s\"", filename);
06105       return DB_FILE_ERROR;
06106    }
06107 
06108    /* write XML header */
06109    strcpy(line, "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"ISO-8859-1\"?>\n");
06110    write(fh, line, strlen(line));
06111    cm_asctime(str, sizeof(str));
06112    sprintf(line, "<!-- created by ODBEdit on %s -->\n", str);
06113    write(fh, line, strlen(line));

Referenced by db_create_record(), db_get_open_records(), and db_scan_tree_link().

INT EXPRT db_send_changed_records ( void   ) 

Send all records to the ODB which were changed locally since the last call to this function.

This function is valid if used in conjunction with db_open_record() under the condition the record is open as MODE_WRITE access code.

  • Full example dbchange.c which can be compiled as follow 
    gcc -DOS_LINUX -I/midas/include -o dbchange dbchange.c
/midas/linux/lib/libmidas.a -lutil}

\begin{verbatim}
//------- dbchange.c
#include "midas.h"
#include "msystem.h"

//-------- BOF dbchange.c
typedef struct {
    INT    my_number;
    float   my_rate;
} MY_STATISTICS;

MY_STATISTICS myrec;

#define MY_STATISTICS(_name) char *_name[] = {\
"My Number = INT : 0",\
"My Rate = FLOAT : 0",\
"",\
NULL }

HNDLE hDB, hKey;

// Main
int main(unsigned int argc,char **argv)
{
  char      host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
  char      expt_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
  INT       lastnumber, status, msg;
  BOOL      debug=FALSE;
  char      i, ch;
  DWORD     update_time, mainlast_time;
  MY_STATISTICS (my_stat);

  // set default
  host_name[0] = 0;
  expt_name[0] = 0;

  // get default
  cm_get_environment(host_name, sizeof(host_name), expt_name, sizeof(expt_name));

  // get parameters
  for (i=1 ; i<argc ; i++)
  {
    if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'd')
      debug = TRUE;
    else if (argv[i][0] == '-')
    {
      if (i+1 >= argc || argv[i+1][0] == '-')
        goto usage;
      if (strncmp(argv[i],"-e",2) == 0)
        strcpy(expt_name, argv[++i]);
      else if (strncmp(argv[i],"-h",2)==0)
        strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
    }
    else
    {
   usage:
      printf("usage: dbchange [-h <Hostname>] [-e <Experiment>]\n");
      return 0;
    }
  }

  // connect to experiment
  status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, expt_name, "dbchange", 0);
  if (status != CM_SUCCESS)
    return 1;

  // Connect to DB
  cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);

  // Create a default structure in ODB
  db_create_record(hDB, 0, "My statistics", strcomb(my_stat));

  // Retrieve key for that strucutre in ODB
  if (db_find_key(hDB, 0, "My statistics", &hKey) != DB_SUCCESS)
  {
    cm_msg(MERROR, "mychange", "cannot find My statistics");
    goto error;
  }

  // Hot link this structure in Write mode
  status = db_open_record(hDB, hKey, &myrec
                          , sizeof(MY_STATISTICS), MODE_WRITE, NULL, NULL);
  if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
  {
    cm_msg(MERROR, "mychange", "cannot open My statistics record");
    goto error;
  }

  // initialize ss_getchar()
  ss_getchar(0);

  // Main loop
  do
  {
    // Update local structure
    if ((ss_millitime() - update_time) > 100)
    {
      myrec.my_number += 1;
      if (myrec.my_number - lastnumber) {
        myrec.my_rate = 1000.f * (float) (myrec.my_number - lastnumber)
          / (float) (ss_millitime() - update_time);
      }
      update_time = ss_millitime();
      lastnumber = myrec.my_number;
    }

    // Publish local structure to ODB (db_send_changed_record)
    if ((ss_millitime() - mainlast_time) > 5000)
    {
      db_send_changed_records();                   // <------- Call
      mainlast_time = ss_millitime();
    }

    // Check for keyboard interaction
    ch = 0;
    while (ss_kbhit())
    {
      ch = ss_getchar(0);
      if (ch == -1)
        ch = getchar();
      if ((char) ch == '!')
        break;
    }
    msg = cm_yield(20);
  } while (msg != RPC_SHUTDOWN && msg != SS_ABORT && ch != '!');

 error:
  cm_disconnect_experiment();
  return 1;
}
//-------- EOF dbchange.c
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS

Definition at line 8155 of file odb.c.

References _record_list_entries, data, db_set_record(), DB_SUCCESS, handle, i, MODE_WRITE, RPC_FTCP, rpc_is_remote(), RPC_OTRANSPORT, rpc_set_option(), and RPC_TCP.

Referenced by lazy_statistics_update(), lazy_update_list(), main(), scan_fragment(), scheduler(), tr_stop(), and update_stats().

08157    INT i;
08158

08160       if (_record_list[i].access_mode & MODE_WRITE) {
08161          if (memcmp
08162              (_record_list[i].copy, _record_list[i].data,
08163               _record_list[i].buf_size) != 0) {
08164             /* switch to fast TCP mode temporarily */
08165             if (rpc_is_remote())
08166                rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
08167             db_set_record(_record_list[i].hDB,
08168                           _record_list[i].handle,
08169                           _record_list[i].data, _record_list[i].buf_size, 0);
08170             if (rpc_is_remote())
08171                rpc_set_option(-1, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_TCP);
08172             memcpy(_record_list[i].copy, _record_list[i].data, _record_list[i].buf_size);
08173          }
08174       }

INT EXPRT db_set_data ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
void *  data,
INT  buf_size,
INT  num_values,
DWORD  type 
)

Set key data from a handle. Adjust number of values if previous data has different size. 

HNLDE hkey;
 INT   run_number;
 // get key handle for run number
 db_find_key(hDB, 0, "/Runinfo/Run number", &hkey);
 // set run number
 db_set_data(hDB, hkey, &run_number, sizeof(run_number),TID_INT);
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
data Buffer from which data gets copied to.
buf_size Size of data buffer.
num_values Number of data values (for arrays).
type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see Midas_Data_Types).
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TRUNCATED

Definition at line 4503 of file odb.c.

References _database_entries, KEY::access_mode, cm_msg, KEY::data, DATABASE::database_header, DB_FULL, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_INVALID_PARAM, db_lock_database(), DB_NO_ACCESS, db_notify_clients(), DB_SUCCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH, db_unlock_database(), db_validate_hkey(), KEY::item_size, KEY::last_written, MERROR, MODE_EXCLUSIVE, MODE_WRITE, KEY::name, KEY::num_values, PTYPE, realloc_data(), rpc_call(), RPC_DB_SET_DATA, rpc_is_remote(), rpc_tid_name(), ss_time(), TID_KEY, KEY::total_size, TRUE, and KEY::type.

04506    if (rpc_is_remote())
04507       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_DATA, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, num_values, type);
04508

04511       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04512       KEY *pkey;
04513

04516          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04517       }
04518 
04519       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04520          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04521          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04522       }
04523 
04524       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04525          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid key handle");
04526          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04527       }
04528 
04529       if (num_values == 0)
04530          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04531 
04532       db_lock_database(hDB);
04533 
04534       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04535       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04536 
04537       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04538       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04539          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04540          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04541       }
04542 
04543       /* check for write access */
04544       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04545          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04546          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04547       }
04548 
04549       if (pkey->type != type) {
04550          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04551          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
04552                 pkey->name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
04553          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04554       }
04555 
04556       /* keys cannot contain data */
04557       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04558          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04559          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04560          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04561       }
04562 
04563       /* if no buf_size given (Java!), calculate it */
04564       if (buf_size == 0)
04565          buf_size = pkey->item_size * num_values;
04566 
04567       /* resize data size if necessary */
04568       if (pkey->total_size != buf_size) {
04569          pkey->data =
04570              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
04571                                   pkey->total_size, buf_size);
04572 
04573          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04574             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04575             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "online database full");
04576             return DB_FULL;
04577          }
04578 
04579          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
04580          pkey->total_size = buf_size;
04581       }
04582 
04583       /* set number of values */
04584       pkey->num_values = num_values;
04585       if (num_values)
04586          pkey->item_size = buf_size / num_values;
04587 
04588       /* copy data */
04589       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, data, buf_size);
04590 
04591       /* update time */
04592       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04593 
04594       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04595       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04596 
04597    }
04598 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04599 
04600    return DB_SUCCESS;
04601 }

INT EXPRT db_set_data_index ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
void *  data,
INT  data_size,
INT  index,
DWORD  type 
)

dox Set key data for a key which contains an array of values.

This function sets individual values of a key containing an array. If the index is larger than the array size, the array is extended and the intermediate values are set to zero.

Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
data Pointer to single value of data.
data_size 
index Size of single data element.
type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see Midas_Data_Types).
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH

04789          return DB_FULL;

04791

04793       if (index >= pkey->num_values || pkey->item_size == 0) {
04794          pkey->data =
04795              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
04796                                   pkey->total_size, data_size * (index + 1));
04797 
04798          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04799             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04800             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data_index", "online database full");
04801             return DB_FULL;
04802          }
04803 
04804          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
04805          if (!pkey->item_size)
04806             pkey->item_size = data_size;
04807          pkey->total_size = data_size * (index + 1);
04808          pkey->num_values = index + 1;
04809       }
04810 
04811       /* cut strings which are too long */
04812       if ((type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK) &&
04813           (int) strlen((char *) data) + 1 > pkey->item_size)
04814          *((char *) data + pkey->item_size - 1) = 0;
04815 
04816       /* copy data */
04817       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data + index * pkey->item_size,
04818              data, pkey->item_size);
04819 
04820       /* update time */
04821       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04822 
04823       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04824       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04825 
04826    }
04827 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04828 
04829    return DB_SUCCESS;
04830 }

INT EXPRT db_set_mode ( HNDLE  hdb,

05022          : db_set_mode
05023 
05024   Purpose: Set access mode of key
05025 
05026   Input:
05027     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database
05028     HNDLE  hKey             Key handle
05029     DWORD  mode             Access mode, any or'ed combination of

05031                             and MODE_DELETE

05070       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05071 
05072       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
05073       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
05074          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05075          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
05076       }
05077 
05078       pkeylist = (KEYLIST *) ((char *) pheader + pkey->data);
05079 
05080       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY && pkeylist->first_key && recurse) {
05081          /* first recurse subtree */
05082          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + pkeylist->first_key);
05083 
05084          do {
05085             pnext_key = (KEY *) (PTYPE) pkey->next_key;
05086 
05087             db_set_mode(hDB, (PTYPE) pkey - (PTYPE) pheader, mode, recurse + 1);
05088 
05089             if (pnext_key)
05090                pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + (PTYPE) pnext_key);
05091          } while (pnext_key);
05092       }
05093 
05094       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05095 
05096       /* resolve links */
05097       if (pkey->type == TID_LINK) {
05098          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05099          if (*((char *) pheader + pkey->data) == '/')
05100             db_find_key(hDB, 0, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, &hKeyLink);
05101          else
05102             db_find_key(hDB, hKey, (char *) pheader + pkey->data, &hKeyLink);
05103          if (hKeyLink)
05104             db_set_mode(hDB, hKeyLink, mode, recurse > 0);
05105          db_lock_database(hDB);
05106          pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
05107          pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
05108       }
05109 
05110       /* now set mode */
05111       pkey->access_mode = mode;
05112 
05113       if (recurse < 2)
05114          db_unlock_database(hDB);
05115    }
05116 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
05117 
05118    return DB_SUCCESS;
05119 }

INT EXPRT db_set_num_values ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
INT  num_values 
)

dox

04610          : db_set_num_values

04612   Purpose: Set numbe of values in a key. Extend with zeros or truncate.
04613

04615     HNDLE  hDB              Handle to the database

04618
