04621 
04622   Function value:
04623     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04624     DB_INVALID_HANDLE       Database handle is invalid
04625 
04626 \********************************************************************/
04627 {
04628    if (rpc_is_remote())
04629       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_NUM_VALUES, hDB, hKey, num_values);
04630 
04631 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
04632    {
04633       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
04634       KEY *pkey;
04635       INT new_size;
04636 
04637       if (hDB > _database_entries || hDB <= 0) {
04638          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04639          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04640       }
04641 
04642       if (!_database[hDB - 1].attached) {
04643          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid database handle");
04644          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04645       }
04646 
04647       if (hKey < sizeof(DATABASE_HEADER)) {
04648          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "invalid key handle");
04649          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04650       }
04651 
04652       if (num_values == 0)
04653          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
04654 
04655       db_lock_database(hDB);
04656 
04657       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
04658       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
04659 
04660       /* check if hKey argument is correct */
04661       if (!db_validate_hkey(pheader, hKey)) {
04662          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04663          return DB_INVALID_HANDLE;
04664       }
04665 
04666       /* check for write access */
04667       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
04668          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04669          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
04670       }
04671 
04672       /* keys cannot contain data */
04673       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
04674          db_unlock_database(hDB);
04675          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "Key cannot contain data");
04676          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
04677       }
04678 
04679       /* resize data size if necessary */
04680       if (pkey->num_values != num_values) {
04681          new_size = pkey->item_size * num_values;
04682          pkey->data =
04683              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
04684                                   pkey->total_size, new_size);
04685 
04686          if (pkey->data == 0) {
04687             db_unlock_database(hDB);
04688             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_data", "online database full");
04689             return DB_FULL;
04690          }
04691 
04692          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
04693          pkey->total_size = new_size;
04694          pkey->num_values = num_values;
04695       }
04696 
04697       /* update time */
04698       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
04699 
04700       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
04701       db_unlock_database(hDB);
04702 
04703    }
04704 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
04705 
04706    return DB_SUCCESS;
04707 }

INT EXPRT db_set_record ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKey,
void *  data,
INT  buf_size,
INT  align 
)

Copy a set of keys from local memory to the database.

An ODB sub-tree can be mapped to a C structure automatically via a hot-link using the function db_open_record() or manually with this function. Problems might occur if the ODB sub-tree contains values which don't match the C structure. Although the structure size is checked against the sub-tree size, no checking can be done if the type and order of the values in the structure are the same than those in the ODB sub-tree. Therefore it is recommended to use the function db_create_record() before using this function. 

...
  memset(&lazyst,0,size);
  if (db_find_key(hDB, pLch->hKey, "Statistics",&hKeyst) == DB_SUCCESS)
    status = db_set_record(hDB, hKeyst, &lazyst, size, 0);
  else
    cm_msg(MERROR,"task","record %s/statistics not found", pLch->name)
...
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKey Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
data Pointer where data is stored.
buf_size Size of data structure, must be obtained via sizeof(RECORD-NAME).
align Byte alignment calculated by the stub and passed to the rpc side to align data according to local machine. Must be zero when called from user level.
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH, DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH

Definition at line 6874 of file odb.c.

References cm_msg, db_get_key(), db_get_record_size(), db_lock_database(), db_notify_clients(), db_recurse_record_tree(), db_set_data(), DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH, DB_SUCCESS, db_unlock_database(), KEY::item_size, key, MERROR, KEY::name, KEY::num_values, rpc_call(), rpc_convert_data(), RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS, rpc_convert_single(), RPC_DB_SET_RECORD, RPC_FIXARRAY, rpc_get_server_option(), rpc_is_remote(), RPC_OSERVER_TYPE, ss_get_struct_align(), ST_REMOTE, TID_KEY, KEY::total_size, TRUE, and KEY::type.

Referenced by al_check(), al_reset_alarm(), al_trigger_alarm(), al_trigger_class(), db_open_record(), db_send_changed_records(), hv_init(), lazy_main(), main(), multi_init(), multi_read_output(), register_equipment(), register_requests(), rpc_server_dispatch(), tr_poststop(), tr_prestart(), tr_start(), tr_start1(), tr_stop(), update_odb(), and write_event_odb().

06875 {
06876    if (rpc_is_remote()) {
06877       align = ss_get_struct_align();
06878       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_RECORD, hDB, hKey, data, buf_size, align);
06879    }
06880 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
06881    {
06882       KEY key;
06883       INT convert_flags;
06884       INT total_size;
06885       void *pdata;
06886 
06887       convert_flags = 0;
06888 
06889       if (!align)
06890          align = ss_get_struct_align();
06891       else
06892          /* only convert data if called remotely, as indicated by align != 0 */
06893       if (rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
06894          convert_flags = rpc_get_server_option(RPC_CONVERT_FLAGS);
06895 
06896       /* check if key has subkeys */
06897       db_get_key(hDB, hKey, &key);
06898       if (key.type != TID_KEY) {
06899          /* copy single key */
06900          if (key.item_size * key.num_values != buf_size) {
06901             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\"", key.name);
06902             return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
06903          }
06904 
06905          if (convert_flags) {
06906             if (key.num_values > 1)
06907                rpc_convert_data(data, key.type, RPC_FIXARRAY,
06908                                 key.item_size * key.num_values, convert_flags);
06909             else
06910                rpc_convert_single(data, key.type, 0, convert_flags);
06911          }
06912 
06913          db_set_data(hDB, hKey, data, key.total_size, key.num_values, key.type);
06914          return DB_SUCCESS;
06915       }
06916 
06917       /* check record size */
06918       db_get_record_size(hDB, hKey, 0, &total_size);
06919       if (total_size != buf_size) {
06920          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_record", "struct size mismatch for \"%s\"", key.name);
06921          return DB_STRUCT_SIZE_MISMATCH;
06922       }
06923 
06924       /* set subkey data */
06925       pdata = data;
06926       total_size = 0;
06927 
06928       db_lock_database(hDB);
06929       db_recurse_record_tree(hDB, hKey, &pdata, &total_size, align,
06930                              NULL, TRUE, convert_flags);
06931       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
06932       db_unlock_database(hDB);
06933    }
06934 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
06935 
06936    return DB_SUCCESS;
06937 }

INT EXPRT db_set_value ( HNDLE  hDB,
HNDLE  hKeyRoot,
char *  key_name,
void *  data,
INT  data_size,
INT  num_values,
DWORD  type 
)

dox Set value of a single key.

The function sets a single value or a whole array to a ODB key. Since the data buffer is of type void, no type checking can be performed by the compiler. Therefore the type has to be explicitly supplied, which is checked against the type stored in the ODB. key_name can contain the full path of a key (like: "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1") while hkey is zero which refers to the root, or hkey can refer to a sub-directory (like /Equipment/Trigger) and key_name is interpreted relative to that directory like "Settings/Level1". 

INT level1;
  db_set_value(hDB, 0, "/Equipment/Trigger/Settings/Level1",
                          &level1, sizeof(level1), 1, TID_INT);
Parameters:
hDB ODB handle obtained via cm_get_experiment_database().
hKeyRoot Handle for key where search starts, zero for root.
key_name Name of key to search, can contain directories.
data Address of data.
data_size Size of data (in bytes).
num_values Number of data elements.
type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see Midas_Data_Types)
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS, DB_INVALID_HANDLE, DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH

Definition at line 3128 of file odb.c.

References KEY::access_mode, cm_msg, KEY::data, DATABASE::database_header, db_create_key(), db_find_key(), db_find_link(), DB_FULL, DB_INVALID_PARAM, db_lock_database(), DB_NO_ACCESS, DB_NO_KEY, db_notify_clients(), DB_SUCCESS, DB_TYPE_MISMATCH, db_unlock_database(), KEY::item_size, KEY::last_written, MERROR, MODE_EXCLUSIVE, MODE_WRITE, KEY::num_values, PTYPE, realloc_data(), rpc_call(), RPC_DB_SET_VALUE, rpc_is_remote(), rpc_tid_name(), rpc_tid_size(), ss_time(), status, TID_KEY, TID_LINK, TID_STRING, KEY::total_size, TRUE, and KEY::type.

Referenced by al_trigger_alarm(), analyze_run(), cm_connect_experiment1(), cm_delete_client_info(), cm_register_deferred_transition(), cm_register_function(), cm_register_transition(), cm_set_client_info(), cm_set_transition_sequence(), cm_set_watchdog_params(), cm_transition(), command_loop(), db_create_link(), db_get_value(), frontend_init(), ge_ln2_read(), lazy_main(), lazy_maintain_check(), lazy_update_list(), log_callback(), log_write(), main(), mana_init(), process_event(), read_separator_event(), register_equipment(), rpc_server_dispatch(), save_huffman(), show_alarm_page(), show_elog_new(), show_elog_query(), show_hist_config_page(), show_hist_page(), test_write(), tr_start(), and update_odb().

03130 {
03131    if (rpc_is_remote())
03132       return rpc_call(RPC_DB_SET_VALUE, hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name,
03133                       data, data_size, num_values, type);
03134 
03135 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
03136    {
03137       DATABASE_HEADER *pheader;
03138       KEY *pkey;
03139       HNDLE hKey;
03140       INT status;
03141 
03142       if (num_values == 0)
03143          return DB_INVALID_PARAM;
03144 
03145       status = db_find_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
03146       if (status == DB_NO_KEY) {
03147          db_create_key(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, type);
03148          status = db_find_link(hDB, hKeyRoot, key_name, &hKey);
03149       }
03150 
03151       if (status != DB_SUCCESS)
03152          return status;
03153 
03154       db_lock_database(hDB);
03155       pheader = _database[hDB - 1].database_header;
03156 
03157       /* get address from handle */
03158       pkey = (KEY *) ((char *) pheader + hKey);
03159 
03160       /* check for write access */
03161       if (!(pkey->access_mode & MODE_WRITE) || (pkey->access_mode & MODE_EXCLUSIVE)) {
03162          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03163          return DB_NO_ACCESS;
03164       }
03165 
03166       if (pkey->type != type) {
03167          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03168          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "\"%s\" is of type %s, not %s",
03169                 key_name, rpc_tid_name(pkey->type), rpc_tid_name(type));
03170          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03171       }
03172 
03173       /* keys cannot contain data */
03174       if (pkey->type == TID_KEY) {
03175          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03176          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "key cannot contain data");
03177          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03178       }
03179 
03180       if (data_size == 0) {
03181          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03182          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "zero data size not allowed");
03183          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03184       }
03185 
03186       if (type != TID_STRING && type != TID_LINK &&
03187           data_size != rpc_tid_size(type) * num_values) {
03188          db_unlock_database(hDB);
03189          cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value",
03190                 "data_size (%d) does not match num_values (%d)", data_size, num_values);
03191          return DB_TYPE_MISMATCH;
03192       }
03193 
03194       /* resize data size if necessary */
03195       if (pkey->total_size < data_size) {
03196          pkey->data =
03197              (PTYPE) realloc_data(pheader, (char *) pheader + pkey->data,
03198                                   pkey->total_size, data_size);
03199 
03200          if (pkey->data == 0) {
03201             db_unlock_database(hDB);
03202             cm_msg(MERROR, "db_set_value", "online database full");
03203             return DB_FULL;
03204          }
03205 
03206          pkey->data -= (PTYPE) pheader;
03207          pkey->total_size = data_size;
03208       }
03209 
03210       /* set number of values */
03211       pkey->num_values = num_values;
03212 
03213       if (type == TID_STRING || type == TID_LINK)
03214          pkey->item_size = data_size / num_values;
03215       else
03216          pkey->item_size = rpc_tid_size(type);
03217 
03218       /* copy data */
03219       memcpy((char *) pheader + pkey->data, data, data_size);
03220 
03221       /* update time */
03222       pkey->last_written = ss_time();
03223 
03224       db_notify_clients(hDB, hKey, TRUE);
03225       db_unlock_database(hDB);
03226 
03227    }
03228 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
03229 
03230    return DB_SUCCESS;
03231 }

INT EXPRT db_sprintf ( char *  string,
void *  data,
INT  data_size,
INT  index,
DWORD  type 
)

dox Convert a database value to a string according to its type.

This function is a convenient way to convert a binary ODB value into a string depending on its type if is not known at compile time. If it is known, the normal sprintf() function can be used. 

...
  for (j=0 ; j<key.num_values ; j++)
  {
    db_sprintf(pbuf, pdata, key.item_size, j, key.type);
    strcat(pbuf, "\n");
  }
  ...
Parameters:
string output ASCII string of data.
data Value data.
data_size Size of single data element.
index Index for array data.
type Type of key, one of TID_xxx (see Midas_Data_Types).
Returns:
DB_SUCCESS

Definition at line 6308 of file odb.c.

References DB_SUCCESS, MAX_STRING_LENGTH, strlcpy(), TID_BITFIELD, TID_BOOL, TID_BYTE, TID_CHAR, TID_DOUBLE, TID_DWORD, TID_FLOAT, TID_INT, TID_LINK, TID_SBYTE, TID_SHORT, TID_STRING, and TID_WORD.

Referenced by al_evaluate_condition(), ascii_write(), cmd_dir(), command_loop(), condition_test(), db_copy(), db_save_xml_key(), display_range_hist(), display_single_hist(), dump_write(), exec_script(), gen_odb_attachment(), hs_dump(), print_key(), rpc_execute(), rpc_execute_ascii(), scan_tree(), search_callback(), search_key(), show_custom_page(), show_odb_page(), show_sc_page(), show_set_page(), show_start_page(), and write_event_ascii().

06309 {
06310    if (data_size == 0)
06311       sprintf(string, "<NULL>");
06312    else
06313       switch (type) {
06314       case TID_BYTE:
06315          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((BYTE *) data) + index));
06316          break;
06317       case TID_SBYTE:
06318          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((char *) data) + index));
06319          break;
06320       case TID_CHAR:
06321          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((char *) data) + index));
06322          break;
06323       case TID_WORD:
06324          sprintf(string, "%u", *(((WORD *) data) + index));
06325          break;
06326       case TID_SHORT:
06327          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((short *) data) + index));
06328          break;
06329       case TID_DWORD:
06330          sprintf(string, "%lu", *(((DWORD *) data) + index));
06331          break;
06332       case TID_INT:
06333          sprintf(string, "%d", *(((INT *) data) + index));
06334          break;
06335       case TID_BOOL:
06336          sprintf(string, "%c", *(((BOOL *) data) + index) ? 'y' : 'n');
06337          break;
06338       case TID_FLOAT:
06339          sprintf(string, "%g", *(((float *) data) + index));
06340          break;
06341       case TID_DOUBLE:
06342          sprintf(string, "%lg", *(((double *) data) + index));
06343          break;
06344       case TID_BITFIELD:
06345          /* TBD */
06346          break;
06347       case TID_STRING:
06348       case TID_LINK:
06349          strlcpy(string, ((char *) data) + data_size * index, MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
06350          break;
06351       default:
06352          sprintf(string, "<unknown>");
06353          break;
06354       }
06355 
06356    return DB_SUCCESS;
06357 }

06441 
06442   Input:
06443     char  *data_str         ASCII string of data
06444     INT   i                 Index for array data
06445     DWORD tid               Value type, one of TID_xxx
06446 
06447   Output:
06448     void  *data             Value data
06449     INT   *data_size        Size of single data element
06450 
06451   Function value:
06452     DB_SUCCESS              Successful completion
06453 
06454 \********************************************************************/
06455 {
06456    DWORD value;
06457    BOOL hex = FALSE;
06458 
06459    if (data_str == NULL)
06460       return 0;
06461 
06462    *data_size = rpc_tid_size(tid);
06463    if (strncmp(data_str, "0x", 2) == 0) {
06464       hex = TRUE;
06465       sscanf(data_str + 2, "%lx", &value);
06466    }
06467 
06468    switch (tid) {
06469    case TID_BYTE:
06470    case TID_SBYTE:
06471       if (hex)
06472          *((char *) data + i) = (char) value;
06473       else
06474          *((char *) data + i) = (char) atoi(data_str);
06475       break;
06476    case TID_CHAR:
06477       *((char *) data + i) = data_str[0];
06478       break;
06479    case TID_WORD:
06480       if (hex)
06481          *((WORD *) data + i) = (WORD) value;
06482       else
06483          *((WORD *) data + i) = (WORD) atoi(data_str);
06484       break;
06485    case TID_SHORT:
06486       if (hex)
06487          *((short int *) data + i) = (short int) value;
06488       else
06489          *((short int *) data + i) = (short int) atoi(data_str);
06490       break;
06491    case TID_DWORD:
06492       if (!hex)
06493          sscanf(data_str, "%lu", &value);
06494 
06495       *((DWORD *) data + i) = value;
06496       break;
06497    case TID_INT:
06498       if (hex)
06499          *((INT *) data + i) = value;
06500       else
06501          *((INT *) data + i) = atol(data_str);
06502       break;
06503    case TID_BOOL:
06504       if (data_str[0] == 'y' || data_str[0] == 'Y' || atoi(data_str) > 0)
06505          *((BOOL *) data + i) = 1;
06506       else
06507          *((BOOL *) data + i) = 0;
06508       break;
06509    case TID_FLOAT:
06510       *((float *) data + i) = (float) atof(data_str);
06511       break;
06512    case TID_DOUBLE:
06513       *((double *) data + i) = atof(data_str);
06514       break;
06515    case TID_BITFIELD:
06516       /* TBD */
06517       break;
06518    case TID_STRING:
06519    case TID_LINK:
06520       strcpy((char *) data, data_str);
06521       *data_size = strlen(data_str) + 1;
06522       break;
06523    }
06524 
06525    return DB_SUCCESS;
06526 }

15914

15917       if (buffer == NULL) {
15918          close(fh);
15919          ss_mutex_release(mutex);
15920          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15921       }
15922

15924       n = read(fh, buffer, tail_size);
15925    }

15927

15929       n = write(fh, buffer, tail_size);
15930       M_FREE(buffer);
15931    }
15932 
15933    /* truncate file here */
15934 #ifdef OS_WINNT
15935    chsize(fh, TELL(fh));
15936 #else
15937    ftruncate(fh, TELL(fh));
15938 #endif
15939 
15940    /* if file length gets zero, delete file */

15942    close(fh);
15943

15945       remove(file_name);
15946

15948    ss_mutex_release(mutex);

15950

15641   Purpose: Retrieve an ELog entry by its message tab
15642

15745       else

15778          *textsize = 0;
15779       }

15495

15502          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15503

15505       sprintf(tag, "%02d%02d%02d", tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday);

15579       lseek(*fh, -15, SEEK_CUR);
15580 
15581       if (strncmp(str, "$Start$: ", 9) != 0) {
15582          close(*fh);
15583          return EL_FILE_ERROR;
15584       }
15585 
15586       /* make sure the input string to atoi() is zero-terminated
15587        * $Start$:    606garbage
15588        * 01234567890123456789 */
15589       str[15] = 0;
15590 
15591       size = atoi(str+9);
15592       assert(size > 15);
15593 
15594       lseek(*fh, size, SEEK_CUR);
15595 
15596       /* if EOF, goto next day */
15597       i = read(*fh, str, 15);
15598       if (i < 15) {
15599          close(*fh);
15600          time((long *) &lact);
15601 
15602          lt = ltime;
15603          do {
15604             lt += 3600 * 24;
15605             tms = localtime((const time_t *) &lt);
15606             sprintf(str, "%02d%02d%02d.0",
15607                     tms->tm_year % 100, tms->tm_mon + 1, tms->tm_mday);
15608 
15609             status = el_search_message(str, fh, FALSE);
15610 
15611          } while (status != EL_SUCCESS && (INT) lt - (INT) lact < 3600 * 24);
15612 
15613          if (status != EL_SUCCESS)
15614             return EL_LAST_MSG;
15615 
15616          /* adjust tag */
15617          strcpy(tag, str);
15618 
15619          /* go to beginning of current file */
15620          lseek(*fh, 0, SEEK_SET);
15621       } else
15622          lseek(*fh, -15, SEEK_CUR);
15623 
15624       /* adjust tag */
15625       sprintf(strchr(tag, '.') + 1, "%d", (int) TELL(*fh));
15626    }
15627 
15628    return EL_SUCCESS;
15629 }

15845

dox Submit an ELog entry.

Parameters:
run Run Number.
author Message author.
type Message type.
system Message system.
subject Subject.
text Message text.
reply_to In reply to this message.
encoding Text encoding, either HTML or plain.

buffer_size1 Size of buffer in bytes.
afilename2 File name of attachment.
buffer2 File contents.
buffer_size2 Size of buffer in bytes.
afilename3 File name of attachment.
buffer3 File contents.
buffer_size3 Size of buffer in bytes.
tag If given, edit existing message.
tag_size Maximum size of tag.
Returns:

13968       if (i == n) {
13969          id[i] = def_rec.event_id;
13970          n++;
13971       }
13972    } while (TRUE);

13974

13976    close(fh);

14090 
14091    /* search latest history file */
14092    status = hs_search_file(&ltime, -1);
14093    if (status != HS_SUCCESS) {
14094       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_count_tags", "cannot find recent history file");
14095       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14096    }
14097 
14098    /* open history and definition files */
14099    hs_open_file(ltime, "hst", O_RDONLY, &fh);
14100    hs_open_file(ltime, "idf", O_RDONLY, &fhd);
14101    if (fh < 0 || fhd < 0) {
14102       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_count_tags", "cannot open index files");
14103       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14104    }
14105 
14106    /* search last definition */
14107    lseek(fhd, 0, SEEK_END);
14108    n = TELL(fhd) / sizeof(def_rec);
14109    def_rec.event_id = 0;
14110    for (i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
14111       lseek(fhd, i * sizeof(def_rec), SEEK_SET);
14112       read(fhd, (char *) &def_rec, sizeof(def_rec));
14113       if (def_rec.event_id == event_id)
14114          break;
14115    }
14116    if (def_rec.event_id != event_id) {
14117       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_count_tags", "event %d not found in index file", event_id);
14118       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14119    }
14120 
14121    /* read definition */
14122    lseek(fh, def_rec.def_offset, SEEK_SET);
14123    read(fh, (char *) &rec, sizeof(rec));
14124    *count = rec.data_size / sizeof(TAG);
14125 
14126    close(fh);
14127    close(fhd);
14128 
14129    return HS_SUCCESS;
14130 }

13466          : hs_define_evnet
13467 
13468   Purpose: Define a new event for which a history should be recorded.
13469            This routine must be called before any call to
13470            hs_write_event. It also should be called if the definition
13471            of the event has changed.
13472 
13473            The event definition is written directly to the history
13474            file. If the definition is identical to a previous
13475            definition, it is not written to the file.
13476 
13477 
13478   Input:
13479     DWORD  event_id         ID for this event. Must be unique.

13482                             variables in this event.

13495 /* History events are only written locally (?)
13496

13507 
13508       /* allocate new space for the new history descriptor */
13509       if (_history_entries == 0) {
13510          _history = (HISTORY *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(HISTORY));
13511          memset(_history, 0, sizeof(HISTORY));
13512          if (_history == NULL)
13513             return HS_NO_MEMORY;
13514 
13515          _history_entries = 1;
13516          index = 0;
13517       } else {
13518          /* check if history already open */
13519          for (i = 0; i < _history_entries; i++)
13520             if (_history[i].event_id == event_id)
13521                break;
13522 
13523          /* if not found, create new one */
13524          if (i == _history_entries) {
13525             _history =
13526                 (HISTORY *) realloc(_history, sizeof(HISTORY) * (_history_entries + 1));
13527             memset(&_history[_history_entries], 0, sizeof(HISTORY));
13528 
13529             _history_entries++;
13530             if (_history == NULL) {
13531                _history_entries--;
13532                return HS_NO_MEMORY;
13533             }
13534          }
13535          index = i;
13536       }
13537 
13538       /* assemble definition record header */
13539       rec.record_type = RT_DEF;
13540       rec.event_id = event_id;
13541       rec.time = time(NULL);
13542       rec.data_size = size;
13543       strncpy(event_name, name, NAME_LENGTH);
13544 
13545       /* pad tag names with zeos */

13547          len = strlen(tag[i].name);
13548          memset(tag[i].name + len, 0, NAME_LENGTH - len);
13549       }
13550 
13551       /* if history structure not set up, do so now */
13552       if (!_history[index].hist_fh) {
13553          /* open history file */
13554          hs_open_file(rec.time, "hst", O_CREAT | O_RDWR, &fh);
13555          if (fh < 0)
13556             return HS_FILE_ERROR;
13557 
13558          /* open index files */
13559          hs_open_file(rec.time, "idf", O_CREAT | O_RDWR, &fhd);
13560          hs_open_file(rec.time, "idx", O_CREAT | O_RDWR, &fhi);
13561          lseek(fh, 0, SEEK_END);
13562          lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_END);
13563          lseek(fhd, 0, SEEK_END);
13564 
13565          /* regenerate index if missing */
13566          if (TELL(fh) > 0 && TELL(fhd) == 0) {
13567             close(fh);
13568             close(fhi);
13569             close(fhd);
13570             hs_gen_index(rec.time);
13571             hs_open_file(rec.time, "hst", O_RDWR, &fh);
13572             hs_open_file(rec.time, "idx", O_RDWR, &fhi);
13573             hs_open_file(rec.time, "idf", O_RDWR, &fhd);
13574             lseek(fh, 0, SEEK_END);
13575             lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_END);
13576             lseek(fhd, 0, SEEK_END);
13577          }
13578 
13579          tmb = localtime((const time_t *) &rec.time);
13580          tmb->tm_hour = tmb->tm_min = tmb->tm_sec = 0;
13581 
13582          /* setup history structure */

13584          _history[index].index_fh = fhi;
13585          _history[index].def_fh = fhd;

13592          memcpy(_history[index].tag, tag, size);

13599             read(fhd, (char *) &def_rec, sizeof(def_rec));
13600             if (def_rec.event_id == event_id)
13601                break;
13602          }
13603          lseek(fhd, 0, SEEK_END);
13604 
13605          /* if definition found, compare it with new one */
13606          if (def_rec.event_id == event_id) {
13607             buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(size);
13608             memset(buffer, 0, size);
13609 
13610             lseek(fh, def_rec.def_offset, SEEK_SET);

13619                write(fh, (char *) &rec, sizeof(rec));
13620                write(fh, event_name, NAME_LENGTH);
13621                write(fh, (char *) tag, size);
13622 
13623                /* write index record */
13624                def_rec.event_id = event_id;
13625                memcpy(def_rec.event_name, event_name, sizeof(event_name));
13626                def_rec.def_offset = _history[index].def_offset;
13627                write(fhd, (char *) &def_rec, sizeof(def_rec));
13628             } else
13629                /* definition identical, just remember old offset */
13630                _history[index].def_offset = def_rec.def_offset;
13631 
13632             M_FREE(buffer);
13633          } else {
13634             /* write definition to history file */
13635             write(fh, (char *) &rec, sizeof(rec));
13636             write(fh, event_name, NAME_LENGTH);
13637             write(fh, (char *) tag, size);
13638 
13639             /* write definition index record */
13640             def_rec.event_id = event_id;
13641             memcpy(def_rec.event_name, event_name, sizeof(event_name));
13642             def_rec.def_offset = _history[index].def_offset;
13643             write(fhd, (char *) &def_rec, sizeof(def_rec));
13644          }
13645       } else {
13646          fh = _history[index].hist_fh;
13647          fhd = _history[index].def_fh;
13648

13650          buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(size);
13651          memset(buffer, 0, size);
13652 
13653          lseek(fh, _history[index].def_offset, SEEK_SET);
13654          read(fh, (char *) &prev_rec, sizeof(prev_rec));

13656          read(fh, buffer, size);

13659          lseek(fhd, 0, SEEK_END);
13660

13663             /* save new definition offset */
13664             _history[index].def_offset = TELL(fh);
13665 
13666             /* write definition to history file */

14699          : hs_dump
14700 
14701   Purpose: Display history for a given event at stdout. The output
14702            can be redirected to be read by Excel for example.
14703 
14704   Input:
14705     DWORD  event_id         Event ID
14706     DWORD  start_time       Starting Date/Time
14707     DWORD  end_time         End Date/Time
14708     DWORD  interval         Minimum time in seconds between reported
14709                             events. Can be used to skip events
14710     BOOL   binary_time      Display DWORD time stamp
14711   Output:
14712     <screen output>
14713 
14714   Function value:
14715     HS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
14716     HS_FILE_ERROR           Cannot open history file
14717

14719 {

14721    int fh, fhd, fhi;
14722    INT i, j, delta, status, n_tag = 0, old_n_tag = 0;
14723    INDEX_RECORD irec;

14726    TAG *tag = NULL, *old_tag = NULL;
14727    char str[NAME_LENGTH], data_buffer[10000];

14729 
14730    /* if not time given, use present to one hour in past */
14731    if (start_time == 0)
14732       start_time = time(NULL) - 3600;
14733    if (end_time == 0)
14734       end_time = time(NULL);
14735 
14736    /* search history file for start_time */
14737    status = hs_search_file(&start_time, 1);
14738    if (status != HS_SUCCESS) {
14739       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_dump", "cannot find recent history file");
14740       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14741    }
14742 
14743    /* open history and definition files */
14744    hs_open_file(start_time, "hst", O_RDONLY, &fh);
14745    hs_open_file(start_time, "idf", O_RDONLY, &fhd);
14746    hs_open_file(start_time, "idx", O_RDONLY, &fhi);
14747    if (fh < 0 || fhd < 0 || fhi < 0) {
14748       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_dump", "cannot open index files");
14749       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14750    }
14751 
14752    /* search record closest to start time */
14753    lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_END);
14754    delta = (TELL(fhi) / sizeof(irec)) / 2;
14755    lseek(fhi, delta * sizeof(irec), SEEK_SET);
14756    do {
14757       delta = (int) (abs(delta) / 2.0 + 0.5);
14758       read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14759       if (irec.time > start_time)
14760          delta = -delta;
14761 
14762       i = lseek(fhi, (delta - 1) * sizeof(irec), SEEK_CUR);
14763    } while (abs(delta) > 1 && irec.time != start_time);
14764    read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14765    if (irec.time > start_time)
14766       delta = -abs(delta);
14767 
14768    i = TELL(fhi) + (delta - 1) * sizeof(irec);
14769    if (i <= 0)
14770       lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_SET);
14771    else
14772       lseek(fhi, (delta - 1) * sizeof(irec), SEEK_CUR);
14773    read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14774 
14775    /* read records, skip wrong IDs */
14776    old_def_offset = -1;
14777    prev_time = 0;
14778    last_irec_time = 0;
14779    do {
14780       if (irec.time < last_irec_time) {
14781          cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_dump",
14782                 "corrupted history data: time does not increase: %d -> %d",
14783                 last_irec_time, irec.time);
14784          return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14785       }
14786       last_irec_time = irec.time;
14787       if (irec.event_id == event_id && irec.time <= end_time && irec.time >= start_time) {
14788          if (irec.time >= prev_time + interval) {
14789             prev_time = irec.time;
14790             lseek(fh, irec.offset, SEEK_SET);
14791             read(fh, (char *) &rec, sizeof(rec));
14792 
14793             /* if definition changed, read new definition */
14794             if ((INT) rec.def_offset != old_def_offset) {
14795                lseek(fh, rec.def_offset, SEEK_SET);
14796                read(fh, (char *) &drec, sizeof(drec));
14797                read(fh, str, NAME_LENGTH);
14798 
14799                if (tag == NULL)
14800                   tag = (TAG *) M_MALLOC(drec.data_size);
14801                else
14802                   tag = (TAG *) realloc(tag, drec.data_size);
14803                if (tag == NULL)
14804                   return HS_NO_MEMORY;
14805                read(fh, (char *) tag, drec.data_size);
14806                n_tag = drec.data_size / sizeof(TAG);
14807 
14808                /* print tag names if definition has changed */
14809                if (old_tag == NULL || old_n_tag != n_tag ||
14810                    memcmp(old_tag, tag, drec.data_size) != 0) {
14811                   printf("Date\t");
14812                   for (i = 0; i < n_tag; i++) {
14813                      if (tag[i].n_data == 1 || tag[i].type == TID_STRING)
14814                         printf("%s\t", tag[i].name);
14815                      else
14816                         for (j = 0; j < (INT) tag[i].n_data; j++)
14817                            printf("%s%d\t", tag[i].name, j);
14818                   }
14819                   printf("\n");
14820 
14821                   if (old_tag == NULL)
14822                      old_tag = (TAG *) M_MALLOC(drec.data_size);
14823                   else
14824                      old_tag = (TAG *) realloc(old_tag, drec.data_size);
14825                   memcpy(old_tag, tag, drec.data_size);
14826                   old_n_tag = n_tag;
14827                }
14828 
14829                old_def_offset = rec.def_offset;
14830                lseek(fh, irec.offset + sizeof(rec), SEEK_SET);
14831             }
14832 
14833             /* print time from header */
14834             if (binary_time)
14835                printf("%li ", irec.time);
14836             else {
14837                sprintf(str, "%s", ctime((const time_t *) &irec.time) + 4);
14838                str[20] = '\t';
14839                printf(str);
14840             }
14841 
14842             /* read data */
14843             read(fh, data_buffer, rec.data_size);
14844 
14845             /* interprete data from tag definition */
14846             offset = 0;
14847             for (i = 0; i < n_tag; i++) {
14848                /* strings have a length of n_data */
14849                if (tag[i].type == TID_STRING) {
14850                   printf("%s\t", data_buffer + offset);
14851                   offset += tag[i].n_data;
14852                } else if (tag[i].n_data == 1) {
14853                   /* non-array data */
14854                   db_sprintf(str, data_buffer + offset, rpc_tid_size(tag[i].type), 0,
14855                              tag[i].type);
14856                   printf("%s\t", str);
14857                   offset += rpc_tid_size(tag[i].type);
14858                } else
14859                   /* loop over array data */
14860                   for (j = 0; j < (INT) tag[i].n_data; j++) {
14861                      db_sprintf(str, data_buffer + offset, rpc_tid_size(tag[i].type), 0,
14862                                 tag[i].type);
14863                      printf("%s\t", str);
14864                      offset += rpc_tid_size(tag[i].type);
14865                   }
14866             }
14867             printf("\n");
14868          }
14869       }
14870 
14871       /* read next index record */
14872       i = read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14873 
14874       /* end of file: search next history file */
14875       if (i <= 0) {
14876          close(fh);
14877          close(fhd);
14878          close(fhi);
14879 
14880          /* advance one day */
14881          tms = localtime((const time_t *) &last_irec_time);
14882          tms->tm_hour = tms->tm_min = tms->tm_sec = 0;
14883          last_irec_time = mktime(tms);
14884 
14885          last_irec_time += 3600 * 24;
14886          if (last_irec_time > end_time)
14887             break;
14888 
14889          /* search next file */
14890          status = hs_search_file(&last_irec_time, 1);
14891          if (status != HS_SUCCESS)
14892             break;
14893 
14894          /* open history and definition files */
14895          hs_open_file(last_irec_time, "hst", O_RDONLY, &fh);
14896          hs_open_file(last_irec_time, "idf", O_RDONLY, &fhd);
14897          hs_open_file(last_irec_time, "idx", O_RDONLY, &fhi);
14898          if (fh < 0 || fhd < 0 || fhi < 0) {
14899             cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_dump", "cannot open index files");
14900             break;
14901          }
14902 
14903          /* read first record */
14904          i = read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14905          if (i <= 0)
14906             break;
14907 
14908          /* old definition becomes invalid */
14909          old_def_offset = -1;
14910       }
14911    } while (irec.time < end_time);
14912 
14913    M_FREE(tag);
14914    M_FREE(old_tag);
14915    close(fh);
14916    close(fhd);
14917    close(fhi);
14918 
14919    return HS_SUCCESS;
14920 }

INT EXPRT hs_enum_events ( DWORD  ltime,

13822          : hs_enum_events
13823 
13824   Purpose: Enumerate events for a given date
13825 
13826   Input:
13827     DWORD  ltime            Date at which events should be enumerated
13828 
13829   Output:
13830     char   *event_name      Array containing event names
13831     DWORD  *name_size       Size of name array
13832     char   *event_id        Array containing event IDs

13835   Function value:
13836     HS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
13837     HS_NO_MEMEORY           Out of memory
13838     HS_FILE_ERROR           Cannot open history file

13840 \********************************************************************/
13841 {
13842    int fh, fhd;
13843    INT status, i, j, n;
13844    DEF_RECORD def_rec;
13845 
13846    if (rpc_is_remote())
13847       return rpc_call(RPC_HS_ENUM_EVENTS, ltime, event_name, name_size, event_id,
13848                       id_size);
13849 
13850    /* search latest history file */
13851    status = hs_search_file(&ltime, -1);
13852    if (status != HS_SUCCESS) {
13853       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_enum_events", "cannot find recent history file");
13854       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
13855    }
13856 
13857    /* open history and definition files */
13858    hs_open_file(ltime, "hst", O_RDONLY, &fh);
13859    hs_open_file(ltime, "idf", O_RDONLY, &fhd);
13860    if (fh < 0 || fhd < 0) {
13861       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_enum_events", "cannot open index files");
13862       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
13863    }
13864    lseek(fhd, 0, SEEK_SET);
13865 
13866    /* loop over definition index file */
13867    n = 0;
13868    do {
13869       /* read event definition */
13870       j = read(fhd, (char *) &def_rec, sizeof(def_rec));
13871       if (j < (int) sizeof(def_rec))
13872          break;
13873

13876          if (event_id[i] == (INT) def_rec.event_id) {
13877             strcpy(event_name + i * NAME_LENGTH, def_rec.event_name);
13878             break;
13879          }
13880 
13881       /* new entry found */
13882       if (i == n) {
13883          if (i * NAME_LENGTH > (INT) * name_size || i * sizeof(INT) > (INT) * id_size) {
13884             cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_enum_events", "index buffer too small");
13885             close(fh);
13886             close(fhd);
13887             return HS_NO_MEMORY;
13888          }
13889 
13890          /* copy definition record */
13891          strcpy(event_name + i * NAME_LENGTH, def_rec.event_name);
13892          event_id[i] = def_rec.event_id;
13893          n++;
13894       }
13895    } while (TRUE);
13896 
13897    close(fh);
13898    close(fhd);
13899    *name_size = n * NAME_LENGTH;
13900    *id_size = n * sizeof(INT);
13901 
13902    return HS_SUCCESS;
13903 }

14140   Purpose: Enumerate variable tags for a given date and event id
14141

14167       return rpc_call(RPC_HS_ENUM_VARS, ltime, event_id, var_name, size);
14168

14171    if (status != HS_SUCCESS) {
14172       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_enum_vars", "cannot find recent history file");
14173       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14174    }
14175 
14176    /* open history and definition files */
14177    hs_open_file(ltime, "hst", O_RDONLY, &fh);
14178    hs_open_file(ltime, "idf", O_RDONLY, &fhd);
14179    if (fh < 0 || fhd < 0) {
14180       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_enum_vars", "cannot open index files");
14181       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14182    }
14183 
14184    /* search last definition */
14185    lseek(fhd, 0, SEEK_END);
14186    n = TELL(fhd) / sizeof(def_rec);
14187    def_rec.event_id = 0;
14188    for (i = n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
14189       lseek(fhd, i * sizeof(def_rec), SEEK_SET);
14190       read(fhd, (char *) &def_rec, sizeof(def_rec));
14191       if (def_rec.event_id == event_id)
14192          break;
14193    }
14194    if (def_rec.event_id != event_id) {
14195       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_enum_vars", "event %d not found in index file", event_id);
14196       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14197    }
14198 
14199    /* read definition header */
14200    lseek(fh, def_rec.def_offset, SEEK_SET);
14201    read(fh, (char *) &rec, sizeof(rec));
14202    read(fh, str, NAME_LENGTH);
14203 
14204    /* read event definition */
14205    n = rec.data_size / sizeof(TAG);
14206    tag = (TAG *) M_MALLOC(rec.data_size);
14207    read(fh, (char *) tag, rec.data_size);
14208 
14209    if (n * NAME_LENGTH > (INT) *size || n * sizeof(DWORD) > *n_size) {
14210       
14211       /* store partial definition */
14212       for (i = 0; i < (INT) *size / NAME_LENGTH; i++) {
14213          strcpy(var_name + i * NAME_LENGTH, tag[i].name);
14214          var_n[i] = tag[i].n_data;
14215       }
14216 
14217       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_enum_vars", "tag buffer too small");
14218       M_FREE(tag);
14219       close(fh);
14220       close(fhd);
14221       return HS_NO_MEMORY;
14222    }
14223 
14224    /* store full definition */
14225    for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
14226       strcpy(var_name + i * NAME_LENGTH, tag[i].name);
14227       var_n[i] = tag[i].n_data;
14228    }
14229    *size = n * NAME_LENGTH;
14230    *n_size = n * sizeof(DWORD);
14231 
14232    M_FREE(tag);
14233    close(fh);
14234    close(fhd);
14235 
14236    return HS_SUCCESS;
14237 }

14927          : hs_fdump
14928 
14929   Purpose: Display history for a given history file
14930 
14931   Input:
14932     char   *file_name       Name of file to dump

14946    INT n;

14948    char event_name[NAME_LENGTH];

14950

14952    fh = open(file_name, O_RDONLY | O_BINARY, 0644);
14953    if (fh < 0) {
14954       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_fdump", "cannot open file %s", file_name);
14955       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14956    }
14957

14959    do {
14960       n = read(fh, (char *) &rec, sizeof(rec));
14961       if (n < sizeof(rec))
14962          break;
14963 
14964       /* check if record type is definition */
14965       if (rec.record_type == RT_DEF) {
14966          /* read name */
14967          read(fh, event_name, sizeof(event_name));
14968 
14969          if (rec.event_id == id || id == 0)
14970             printf("Event definition %s, ID %ld\n", event_name, rec.event_id);
14971 
14972          /* skip tags */
14973          lseek(fh, rec.data_size, SEEK_CUR);
14974       } else {
14975          /* print data record */
14976          if (binary_time)
14977             sprintf(str, "%li ", rec.time);
14978          else {
14979             strcpy(str, ctime((const time_t *) &rec.time) + 4);
14980             str[15] = 0;
14981          }
14982          if (rec.event_id == id || id == 0)
14983             printf("ID %ld, %s, size %ld\n", rec.event_id, str, rec.data_size);
14984 
14985          /* skip data */
14986          lseek(fh, rec.data_size, SEEK_CUR);
14987       }
14988 
14989    } while (TRUE);
14990 
14991    close(fh);
14992 
14993    return HS_SUCCESS;
14994 }

Referenced by generate_hist_graph(), and rpc_server_dispatch().

13988          : hs_get_event_id
13989 
13990   Purpose: Return event ID for a given name. If event cannot be found
13991            in current definition file, go back in time until found
13992 
13993   Input:
13994     DWORD  ltime            Date at which event ID should be looked for
13995 
13996   Output:
13997     DWORD  *id              Event ID
13998 
13999   Function value:
14000     HS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
14001     HS_FILE_ERROR           Cannot open history file
14002     HS_UNDEFINED_EVENT      Event "name" not found
14003 
14004 \********************************************************************/
14005 {
14006    int fh, fhd;
14007    INT status, i;
14008    DWORD lt;
14009    DEF_RECORD def_rec;
14010 
14011    if (rpc_is_remote())
14012       return rpc_call(RPC_HS_GET_EVENT_ID, ltime, name, id);
14013 
14014    /* search latest history file */
14015    if (ltime == 0)
14016       ltime = time(NULL);
14017 
14018    lt = ltime;
14019 
14020    do {
14021       status = hs_search_file(&lt, -1);
14022       if (status != HS_SUCCESS) {
14023          cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_count_events", "cannot find recent history file");
14024          return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14025       }
14026 
14027       /* open history and definition files */
14028       hs_open_file(lt, "hst", O_RDONLY, &fh);
14029       hs_open_file(lt, "idf", O_RDONLY, &fhd);
14030       if (fh < 0 || fhd < 0) {
14031          cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_count_events", "cannot open index files");
14032          return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14033       }
14034 
14035       /* loop over index file */
14036       *id = 0;
14037       do {
14038          /* read definition index record */
14039          i = read(fhd, (char *) &def_rec, sizeof(def_rec));
14040          if (i < (int) sizeof(def_rec))
14041             break;
14042 
14043          if (strcmp(name, def_rec.event_name) == 0) {
14044             *id = def_rec.event_id;
14045             close(fh);
14046             close(fhd);
14047             return HS_SUCCESS;
14048          }
14049       } while (TRUE);
14050 
14051       close(fh);
14052       close(fhd);
14053 
14054       /* not found -> go back one day */
14055       lt -= 3600 * 24;
14056 
14057    } while (lt > ltime - 3600 * 24 * 365 * 10); /* maximum 10 years */
14058 
14059    return HS_UNDEFINED_EVENT;
14060 }

INT EXPRT hs_read ( DWORD  event_id,

Referenced by display_range_hist(), display_single_hist(), generate_hist_graph(), and rpc_server_dispatch().

14345          : hs_read
14346 
14347   Purpose: Read history for a variable at a certain time interval
14348 
14349   Input:
14350     DWORD  event_id         Event ID
14351     DWORD  start_time       Starting Date/Time
14352     DWORD  end_time         End Date/Time
14353     DWORD  interval         Minimum time in seconds between reported
14354                             events. Can be used to skip events
14355     char   *tag_name        Variable name inside event
14356     DWORD  var_index        Index if variable is array
14357 
14358   Output:
14359     DWORD  *time_buffer     Buffer containing times for each value
14360     DWORD  *tbsize          Size of time buffer
14361     void   *data_buffer     Buffer containing variable values
14362     DWORD  *dbsize          Data buffer size
14363     DWORD  *type            Type of variable (one of TID_xxx)
14364     DWORD  *n               Number of time/value pairs found
14365                             in specified interval and placed into
14366                             time_buffer and data_buffer
14367 
14368 
14369   Function value:
14370     HS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
14371     HS_NO_MEMEORY           Out of memory
14372     HS_FILE_ERROR           Cannot open history file
14373     HS_WRONG_INDEX          var_index exceeds array size of variable
14374     HS_UNDEFINED_VAR        Variable "tag_name" not found in event
14375     HS_TRUNCATED            Buffer too small, data has been truncated
14376 
14377 \********************************************************************/
14378 {
14379    DWORD prev_time, last_irec_time;
14380    int fh, fhd, fhi, cp = 0;
14381    INT i, delta, index = 0, status, cache_size;
14382    INDEX_RECORD irec, *pirec;
14383    HIST_RECORD rec, drec;
14384    INT old_def_offset, var_size = 0, var_offset = 0;
14385    TAG *tag;
14386    char str[NAME_LENGTH];
14387    struct tm *tms;
14388    char *cache;
14389 
14390    if (rpc_is_remote())
14391       return rpc_call(RPC_HS_READ, event_id, start_time, end_time, interval,
14392                       tag_name, var_index, time_buffer, tbsize, data_buffer,
14393                       dbsize, type, n);
14394 
14395    /* if not time given, use present to one hour in past */
14396    if (start_time == 0)
14397       start_time = time(NULL) - 3600;
14398    if (end_time == 0)
14399       end_time = time(NULL);
14400 
14401    /* search history file for start_time */
14402    status = hs_search_file(&start_time, 1);
14403    if (status != HS_SUCCESS) {
14404       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_read", "cannot find recent history file");
14405       *tbsize = *dbsize = *n = 0;
14406       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14407    }
14408 
14409    /* open history and definition files */
14410    hs_open_file(start_time, "hst", O_RDONLY, &fh);
14411    hs_open_file(start_time, "idf", O_RDONLY, &fhd);
14412    hs_open_file(start_time, "idx", O_RDONLY, &fhi);
14413    if (fh < 0 || fhd < 0 || fhi < 0) {
14414       cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_read", "cannot open index files");
14415       *tbsize = *dbsize = *n = 0;
14416       return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14417    }
14418 
14419    /* try to read index file into cache */
14420    lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_END);
14421    cache_size = TELL(fhi);
14422 
14423    if (cache_size > 0) {
14424       cache = (char *) M_MALLOC(cache_size);
14425       if (cache) {
14426          lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_SET);
14427          i = read(fhi, cache, cache_size);
14428          if (i < cache_size) {
14429             M_FREE(cache);
14430             close(fh);
14431             close(fhd);
14432             close(fhi);
14433             return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14434          }
14435       }
14436 
14437       /* search record closest to start time */
14438       if (cache == NULL) {
14439          lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_END);
14440          delta = (TELL(fhi) / sizeof(irec)) / 2;
14441          lseek(fhi, delta * sizeof(irec), SEEK_SET);
14442          do {
14443             delta = (int) (abs(delta) / 2.0 + 0.5);
14444             read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14445             if (irec.time > start_time)
14446                delta = -delta;
14447 
14448             lseek(fhi, (delta - 1) * sizeof(irec), SEEK_CUR);
14449          } while (abs(delta) > 1 && irec.time != start_time);
14450          read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14451          if (irec.time > start_time)
14452             delta = -abs(delta);
14453 
14454          i = TELL(fhi) + (delta - 1) * sizeof(irec);
14455          if (i <= 0)
14456             lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_SET);
14457          else
14458             lseek(fhi, (delta - 1) * sizeof(irec), SEEK_CUR);
14459          read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14460       } else {
14461          delta = (cache_size / sizeof(irec)) / 2;
14462          cp = delta * sizeof(irec);
14463          do {
14464             delta = (int) (abs(delta) / 2.0 + 0.5);
14465             pirec = (INDEX_RECORD *) (cache + cp);
14466             if (pirec->time > start_time)
14467                delta = -delta;
14468 
14469             cp = cp + delta * sizeof(irec);
14470          } while (abs(delta) > 1 && pirec->time != start_time);
14471          pirec = (INDEX_RECORD *) (cache + cp);
14472          if (pirec->time > start_time)
14473             delta = -abs(delta);
14474 
14475          if (cp <= delta * (int) sizeof(irec))
14476             cp = 0;
14477          else
14478             cp = cp + delta * sizeof(irec);
14479 
14480          if (cp >= cache_size)
14481             cp = cache_size - sizeof(irec);
14482          if (cp < 0)
14483             cp = 0;
14484 
14485          memcpy(&irec, (INDEX_RECORD *) (cache + cp), sizeof(irec));
14486          cp += sizeof(irec);
14487       }
14488    } else {                     /* file size > 0 */
14489 
14490       cache = NULL;
14491       irec.time = start_time;
14492    }
14493 
14494    /* read records, skip wrong IDs */
14495    old_def_offset = -1;
14496    *n = 0;
14497    prev_time = 0;
14498    last_irec_time = 0;
14499    do {
14500       if (irec.time < last_irec_time) {
14501          cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_read",
14502                 "corrupted history data: time does not increase: %d -> %d",
14503                 last_irec_time, irec.time);
14504          *tbsize = *dbsize = *n = 0;
14505          return HS_FILE_ERROR;
14506       }
14507       last_irec_time = irec.time;
14508       if (irec.event_id == event_id && irec.time <= end_time && irec.time >= start_time) {
14509          /* check if record time more than "interval" seconds after previous time */
14510          if (irec.time >= prev_time + interval) {
14511             prev_time = irec.time;
14512             lseek(fh, irec.offset, SEEK_SET);
14513             read(fh, (char *) &rec, sizeof(rec));
14514 
14515             /* if definition changed, read new definition */
14516             if ((INT) rec.def_offset != old_def_offset) {
14517                lseek(fh, rec.def_offset, SEEK_SET);
14518                read(fh, (char *) &drec, sizeof(drec));
14519                read(fh, str, NAME_LENGTH);
14520 
14521                tag = (TAG *) M_MALLOC(drec.data_size);
14522                if (tag == NULL) {
14523                   *n = *tbsize = *dbsize = 0;
14524                   if (cache)
14525                      M_FREE(cache);
14526                   close(fh);
14527                   close(fhd);
14528                   close(fhi);
14529                   return HS_NO_MEMORY;
14530                }
14531                read(fh, (char *) tag, drec.data_size);
14532 
14533                /* find index of tag_name in new definition */
14534                index = -1;
14535                for (i = 0; (DWORD) i < drec.data_size / sizeof(TAG); i++)
14536                   if (equal_ustring(tag[i].name, tag_name)) {
14537                      index = i;
14538                      break;
14539                   }
14540 
14541                /*
14542                   if ((DWORD) i == drec.data_size/sizeof(TAG))
14543                   {
14544                   *n = *tbsize = *dbsize = 0;
14545                   if (cache)
14546                   M_FREE(cache);
14547 
14548                   return HS_UNDEFINED_VAR;
14549                   }
14550                 */
14551 
14552                if (index >= 0 && var_index >= tag[i].n_data) {
14553                   *n = *tbsize = *dbsize = 0;
14554                   if (cache)
14555                      M_FREE(cache);
14556                   M_FREE(tag);
14557                   close(fh);
14558                   close(fhd);
14559                   close(fhi);
14560                   return HS_WRONG_INDEX;
14561                }
14562 
14563                /* calculate offset for variable */
14564                if (index >= 0) {
14565                   *type = tag[i].type;
14566 
14567                   /* loop over all previous variables */
14568                   for (i = 0, var_offset = 0; i < index; i++)
14569                      var_offset += rpc_tid_size(tag[i].type) * tag[i].n_data;
14570 
14571                   /* strings have size n_data */
14572                   if (tag[index].type == TID_STRING)
14573                      var_size = tag[i].n_data;
14574                   else
14575                      var_size = rpc_tid_size(tag[index].type);
14576 
14577                   var_offset += var_size * var_index;
14578                }
14579 
14580                M_FREE(tag);
14581                old_def_offset = rec.def_offset;
14582                lseek(fh, irec.offset + sizeof(rec), SEEK_SET);
14583             }
14584 
14585             if (index >= 0) {
14586                /* check if data fits in buffers */
14587                if ((*n) * sizeof(DWORD) >= *tbsize || (*n) * var_size >= *dbsize) {
14588                   *dbsize = (*n) * var_size;
14589                   *tbsize = (*n) * sizeof(DWORD);
14590                   if (cache)
14591                      M_FREE(cache);
14592                   close(fh);
14593                   close(fhd);
14594                   close(fhi);
14595                   return HS_TRUNCATED;
14596                }
14597 
14598                /* copy time from header */
14599                time_buffer[*n] = irec.time;
14600 
14601                /* copy data from record */
14602                lseek(fh, var_offset, SEEK_CUR);
14603                read(fh, (char *) data_buffer + (*n) * var_size, var_size);
14604 
14605                /* increment counter */
14606                (*n)++;
14607             }
14608          }
14609       }
14610 
14611       /* read next index record */
14612       if (cache) {
14613          if (cp >= cache_size) {
14614             i = -1;
14615             M_FREE(cache);
14616             cache = NULL;
14617          } else
14618             i = sizeof(irec);
14619 
14620          if (cp < cache_size) {
14621             memcpy(&irec, cache + cp, sizeof(irec));
14622             cp += sizeof(irec);
14623          }
14624       } else
14625          i = read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14626 
14627       /* end of file: search next history file */
14628       if (i <= 0) {
14629          close(fh);
14630          close(fhd);
14631          close(fhi);
14632 
14633          /* advance one day */
14634          tms = localtime((const time_t *) &last_irec_time);
14635          tms->tm_hour = tms->tm_min = tms->tm_sec = 0;
14636          last_irec_time = mktime(tms);
14637 
14638          last_irec_time += 3600 * 24;
14639 
14640          if (last_irec_time > end_time)
14641             break;
14642 
14643          /* search next file */
14644          status = hs_search_file(&last_irec_time, 1);
14645          if (status != HS_SUCCESS)
14646             break;
14647 
14648          /* open history and definition files */
14649          hs_open_file(last_irec_time, "hst", O_RDONLY, &fh);
14650          hs_open_file(last_irec_time, "idf", O_RDONLY, &fhd);
14651          hs_open_file(last_irec_time, "idx", O_RDONLY, &fhi);
14652          if (fh < 0 || fhd < 0 || fhi < 0) {
14653             cm_msg(MERROR, "hs_read", "cannot open index files");
14654             break;
14655          }
14656 
14657          /* try to read index file into cache */
14658          lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_END);
14659          cache_size = TELL(fhi);
14660          lseek(fhi, 0, SEEK_SET);
14661          cache = (char *) M_MALLOC(cache_size);
14662          if (cache) {
14663             i = read(fhi, cache, cache_size);
14664             if (i < cache_size)
14665                break;
14666             /* read first record */
14667             cp = 0;
14668             memcpy(&irec, cache, sizeof(irec));
14669          } else {
14670             /* read first record */
14671             i = read(fhi, (char *) &irec, sizeof(irec));
14672             if (i <= 0)
14673                break;
14674          }
14675 
14676          /* old definition becomes invalid */
14677          old_def_offset = -1;
14678       }
14679    } while (irec.time < end_time);
14680 
14681    if (cache)
14682       M_FREE(cache);
14683    close(fh);
14684    close(fhd);
14685    close(fhi);
14686 
14687    *dbsize = *n * var_size;
14688    *tbsize = *n * sizeof(DWORD);
14689 
14690    return HS_SUCCESS;
14691 }

09813          : rpc_call
09814 
09815   Purpose: Call a function on a MIDAS server
09816 
09817   Input:
09818     INT  routine_id         routine ID as defined in RPC.H (RPC_xxx)
09819 
09820     ...                     variable argument list
09821 
09822   Output:
09823     (depends on argument list)
09824 
09825   Function value:
09826     RPC_SUCCESS             Successful completion
09827     RPC_NET_ERROR           Error in socket call
09828     RPC_NO_CONNECTION       No active connection
09829     RPC_TIMEOUT             Timeout in RPC call
09830     RPC_INVALID_ID          Invalid routine_id (not in rpc_list)
09831     RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER       Paramters don't fit in network buffer
09832 
09833 \********************************************************************/
09834 {
09835    va_list ap, aptmp;
09836    char arg[8], arg_tmp[8];
09837    INT arg_type, transport, rpc_timeout;
09838    INT i, index, status;
09839    INT param_size, arg_size, send_size;
09840    INT tid, flags;
09841    fd_set readfds;
09842    struct timeval timeout;
09843    char *param_ptr, str[80];
09844    BOOL bpointer, bbig;
09845    NET_COMMAND *nc;
09846    int send_sock;
09847 
09848    send_sock = _server_connection.send_sock;
09849    transport = _server_connection.transport;
09850    rpc_timeout = _server_connection.rpc_timeout;
09851 
09852    /* init network buffer */
09853    if (_net_send_buffer_size == 0) {
09854       _net_send_buffer = (char *) M_MALLOC(NET_BUFFER_SIZE);
09855       if (_net_send_buffer == NULL) {
09856          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "not enough memory to allocate network buffer");
09857          return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
09858       }
09859       _net_send_buffer_size = NET_BUFFER_SIZE;
09860    }
09861 
09862    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) _net_send_buffer;
09863    nc->header.routine_id = routine_id;
09864 
09865    if (transport == RPC_FTCP)
09866       nc->header.routine_id |= TCP_FAST;
09867 
09868    for (i = 0;; i++)
09869       if (rpc_list[i].id == routine_id || rpc_list[i].id == 0)
09870          break;
09871    index = i;
09872    if (rpc_list[i].id == 0) {
09873       sprintf(str, "invalid rpc ID (%d)", routine_id);
09874       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", str);
09875       return RPC_INVALID_ID;
09876    }
09877 
09878    /* examine variable argument list and convert it to parameter array */
09879    va_start(ap, routine_id);
09880 
09881    /* find out if we are on a big endian system */
09882    bbig = ((rpc_get_option(0, RPC_OHW_TYPE) & DRI_BIG_ENDIAN) > 0);
09883 
09884    for (i = 0, param_ptr = nc->param; rpc_list[index].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
09885       tid = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
09886       flags = rpc_list[index].param[i].flags;
09887 
09888       bpointer = (flags & RPC_POINTER) || (flags & RPC_OUT) ||
09889           (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY) || (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) ||
09890           tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_ARRAY || tid == TID_STRUCT || tid == TID_LINK;
09891 
09892       if (bpointer)
09893          arg_type = TID_ARRAY;
09894       else
09895          arg_type = tid;
09896 
09897       /* floats are passed as doubles, at least under NT */
09898       if (tid == TID_FLOAT && !bpointer)
09899          arg_type = TID_DOUBLE;
09900 
09901       /* get pointer to argument */
09902       rpc_va_arg(&ap, arg_type, arg);
09903 
09904       /* shift 1- and 2-byte parameters to the LSB on big endian systems */
09905       if (bbig) {
09906          if (tid == TID_BYTE || tid == TID_CHAR || tid == TID_SBYTE) {
09907             arg[0] = arg[3];
09908          }
09909          if (tid == TID_WORD || tid == TID_SHORT) {
09910             arg[0] = arg[2];
09911             arg[1] = arg[3];
09912          }
09913       }
09914 
09915       if (flags & RPC_IN) {
09916          if (bpointer)
09917             arg_size = tid_size[tid];
09918          else
09919             arg_size = tid_size[arg_type];
09920 
09921          /* for strings, the argument size depends on the string length */
09922          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
09923             arg_size = 1 + strlen((char *) *((char **) arg));
09924 
09925          /* for varibale length arrays, the size is given by
09926             the next parameter on the stack */
09927          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
09928             memcpy(&aptmp, &ap, sizeof(ap));
09929             rpc_va_arg(&aptmp, TID_ARRAY, arg_tmp);
09930 
09931             if (flags & RPC_OUT)
09932                arg_size = *((INT *) * ((void **) arg_tmp));
09933             else
09934                arg_size = *((INT *) arg_tmp);
09935 
09936             *((INT *) param_ptr) = ALIGN8(arg_size);
09937             param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
09938          }
09939 
09940          if (tid == TID_STRUCT || (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY))
09941             arg_size = rpc_list[index].param[i].n;
09942 
09943          /* always align parameter size */
09944          param_size = ALIGN8(arg_size);
09945 
09946          if ((PTYPE) param_ptr - (PTYPE) nc + param_size > NET_BUFFER_SIZE) {
09947             cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call",
09948                    "parameters (%d) too large for network buffer (%d)",
09949                    (PTYPE) param_ptr - (PTYPE) nc + param_size, NET_BUFFER_SIZE);
09950             return RPC_EXCEED_BUFFER;
09951          }
09952 
09953          if (bpointer)
09954             memcpy(param_ptr, (void *) *((void **) arg), arg_size);
09955          else {
09956             /* floats are passed as doubles on most systems */
09957             if (tid != TID_FLOAT)
09958                memcpy(param_ptr, arg, arg_size);
09959             else
09960                *((float *) param_ptr) = (float) *((double *) arg);
09961          }
09962 
09963          param_ptr += param_size;
09964 
09965       }
09966    }
09967 
09968    va_end(ap);
09969 
09970    nc->header.param_size = (PTYPE) param_ptr - (PTYPE) nc->param;
09971 
09972    send_size = nc->header.param_size + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
09973 
09974    /* in FAST TCP mode, only send call and return immediately */
09975    if (transport == RPC_FTCP) {
09976       i = send_tcp(send_sock, (char *) nc, send_size, 0);
09977 
09978       if (i != send_size) {
09979          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "send_tcp() failed");
09980          return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09981       }
09982 
09983       return RPC_SUCCESS;
09984    }
09985 
09986    /* in TCP mode, send and wait for reply on send socket */
09987    i = send_tcp(send_sock, (char *) nc, send_size, 0);
09988    if (i != send_size) {
09989       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "send_tcp() failed");
09990       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
09991    }
09992 
09993    /* make some timeout checking */
09994    if (rpc_timeout > 0) {
09995       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
09996       FD_SET(send_sock, &readfds);
09997 
09998       timeout.tv_sec = rpc_timeout / 1000;
09999       timeout.tv_usec = (rpc_timeout % 1000) * 1000;
10000 
10001       do {
10002          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
10003 
10004          /* if an alarm signal was cought, restart select with reduced timeout */
10005          if (status == -1 && timeout.tv_sec >= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000)
10006             timeout.tv_sec -= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000;
10007 
10008       } while (status == -1);   /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
10009 
10010       if (!FD_ISSET(send_sock, &readfds)) {
10011          cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "rpc timeout, routine = \"%s\"",
10012                 rpc_list[index].name);
10013 
10014          /* disconnect to avoid that the reply to this rpc_call comes at
10015             the next rpc_call */
10016          rpc_server_disconnect();
10017 
10018          return RPC_TIMEOUT;
10019       }
10020    }
10021 
10022    /* receive result on send socket */
10023    i = recv_tcp(send_sock, _net_send_buffer, NET_BUFFER_SIZE, 0);
10024 
10025    if (i <= 0) {
10026       cm_msg(MERROR, "rpc_call", "recv_tcp() failed, routine = \"%s\"",
10027              rpc_list[index].name);
10028       return RPC_NET_ERROR;
10029    }
10030 
10031    /* extract result variables and place it to argument list */
10032    status = nc->header.routine_id;
10033 
10034    va_start(ap, routine_id);
10035 
10036    for (i = 0, param_ptr = nc->param; rpc_list[index].param[i].tid != 0; i++) {
10037       tid = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
10038       flags = rpc_list[index].param[i].flags;
10039 
10040       bpointer = (flags & RPC_POINTER) || (flags & RPC_OUT) ||
10041           (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY) || (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) ||
10042           tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_ARRAY || tid == TID_STRUCT || tid == TID_LINK;
10043 
10044       if (bpointer)
10045          arg_type = TID_ARRAY;
10046       else
10047          arg_type = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
10048 
10049       if (tid == TID_FLOAT && !bpointer)
10050          arg_type = TID_DOUBLE;
10051 
10052       rpc_va_arg(&ap, arg_type, arg);
10053 
10054       if (rpc_list[index].param[i].flags & RPC_OUT) {
10055          tid = rpc_list[index].param[i].tid;
10056          arg_size = tid_size[tid];
10057 
10058          if (tid == TID_STRING || tid == TID_LINK)
10059             arg_size = strlen((char *) (param_ptr)) + 1;
10060 
10061          if (flags & RPC_VARARRAY) {
10062             arg_size = *((INT *) param_ptr);
10063             param_ptr += ALIGN8(sizeof(INT));
10064          }
10065 
10066          if (tid == TID_STRUCT || (flags & RPC_FIXARRAY))
10067             arg_size = rpc_list[index].param[i].n;
10068 
10069          /* return parameters are always pointers */
10070          if (*((char **) arg))
10071             memcpy((void *) *((char **) arg), param_ptr, arg_size);
10072 
10073          /* parameter size is always aligned */
10074          param_size = ALIGN8(arg_size);
10075 
10076          param_ptr += param_size;
10077       }
10078    }
10079 
10080    va_end(ap);
10081 
10082    return status;
10083 }
